courses.title: Health and Safety in Construction & CSCS Card Quiz Questions
courses.bio: Health and safety requirements and legal requirements
objectives: Health and Safety Law and Management for Project Managers and Site Operatives
General Safety on a construction site for workmen and visitors
Health and safety around High Risk Activities and Demolition
Health and welfare requirements on a construction site

Module 1 - Health and Safety Law and Man: Module 1: Lesson 1 - History of Health and Safety
Module 1: Lesson 2 - Record Keeping and checks
Module 2 - Health and Welfare: Module 2: Lesson 1 - First Aid Assessments and Emergencies
Module 3 - General Safety: Module 3: Lesson 2 - Fire and Electrical prevention
Module 4 - Environment: Module 4: Lesson 3 - Planning for safety and traffic
Module 5 - High Risk Activities and Demo: Module 5: Lesson 1 - Working at Height Regulations
Module 5: Lesson 2 - Excavations and contained Spaces
Module 5: Lesson 3 - Demolition and Associated Risks

requirements: None
courses.description:
What Can You Achieve with this Course?


There is a lot of content and resources given to you with this course. The course is broken down into 5 main Modules, each with smaller modules and end of module tests.


You will be able to gain a better knowledge and understanding of hiring contractors for your work, for safety that follow regulations and legislation.


There is no time limit to finish the course!


Module Outlines
1. Health and Safety Law and Management
2. Health and welfare
3. General Safety
4. Environment
5. High Risk Activities and Demolition


My aim here is to help you to learn about health and safety on a construction site, in order to comply with rules and regulations and reduce the chances of accidents and incidents happening.


Extra resources included:
* Excavation checklists
* Protected species list
* Face fit record document
* Prohibition signs guide
* Fall protection summary
* Inspections and Examination guide
* Hazardous substances sheet


Additional Resources
- Sites Diary/ Work Site Diary
-  CSCS Style Question Bank (200 Questions)


The Health and Safety Awareness course is for anyone who has just started working in the construction or wants to know more.


Starting from first principles, the course is designed to raise awareness of basic matters of health and safety which new entrants to the industry will encounter whilst carrying out day to day duties.


Areas of study where candidates will gain knowledge and skills:


* Individual responsibilities – covering all aspects of personal safety and the individual’s responsibility to contribute towards a safe environment for others.


* Typical construction hazards – how to recognise them and how such hazards can be effectively controlled.


* Safe working community – how all workers can support and help to improve practical site-safety standards in the daily work environment.


* Statutory requirements – the broad scope of health and safety legislation addressing hazards in the workplace environment, and the legal liabilities of all who work there.


* Working at height – the special risks associated with working above the ground, and the safe working practices which should be adopted to avoid fatalities and major injuries.


* Manual Handling – the risks to workers and potential risks to others (manual handling is responsible for a third of all workplace injuries), plus safe working practices to minimise the risks.


* Fire prevention – recognising the special risks posed by workplace fires, and the safe working practices designed to avoid fires and minimise the consequences when a fire does occur.


* Work equipment – generic risks associated with operating tools and machinery, plus safe working practices to minimise the risk of accident and injury.


* Occupational Health – a look at common health issues associated with the impact of work on your health, such as work-related diseases, and how worker fitness should always match the demands of the job.
target_audience: All - Beginner, Intermediate and Advanced

courses.title: CPR and First Aid MCQs Bank
courses.bio: Time Based MCQs With First Aid Scenarios
courses.description:
The CPR and First Aid MCQ Bank is a comprehensive resource designed for anyone who wants to excel in first aid and emergency response skills. Whether you’re a medical student, doctor, nurse, security guard, first aider, ambulance crew member, or emergency responder, this question bank will help you master life-saving techniques and confidently prepare for critical situations.
This extensive collection includes meticulously curated multiple-choice questions covering all first aid and CPR aspects. The MCQs are tailored to address real-world scenarios and theoretical knowledge, from basic wound care and bleeding control to advanced resuscitation techniques and emergency procedures.
Ideal for exam preparation and skill enhancement, the MCQ bank supports various certifications and training programs. It’s a perfect companion for those pursuing first aid training courses, healthcare provider certifications, or emergency services qualifications.
Each question is designed to test your understanding, improve decision-making skills, and reinforce best practices. With diverse levels of difficulty, the bank caters to beginners seeking foundational knowledge and professionals striving for advanced expertise.
Equip yourself with the essential skills to save lives and respond effectively in emergencies. The CPR and  First Aid MCQ Bank is your ultimate tool to become a confident and capable first responder in any situation.
target_audience: Doctors
Nurses
First Aid Responders
Emergency Staff
Ambulance Crew
Security Guards
Housewives
Anyone who wants to improve his firs aid skills

objectives: FREE course workbook, toolbox talks, and heat stress calculation app.
Certificate of Completion.
More than TWO hours of instruction.
The essentials of heat stress and heat stress management in the workplace.
How to evaluate and control heat stress hazards.
OSHA, consensus, and state heat stress regulations.
The signs and symptoms of common heat illnesses.

Hest Stress Regulations: Cal/OSHA Heat Stress Regulations Part One - Introduction/Scope and Application
Cal/OSHA Heat Stress Regulations Part Two - Definitions
Cal/OSHA Heat Stress Regulations Part Three - Provision of water
Cal/OSHA Heat Stress Regulations Part Four - Access to shade
Cal/OSHA Heat Stress Regulations Part Five - High-heat procedures
Cal/OSHA Heat Stress Regulations Part Six - Emergency response procedures
Cal/OSHA Heat Stress Regulations Part Seven - Acclimatization
Cal/OSHA Heat Stress Regulations Part Eight - Training
Cal/OSHA Heat Stress Regulations Part Nine - Heat illness prevention plan
Heat Surveys and Exposure Assessments: Evaluating Heat Exposures OSHA Method One
Evaluating Heat Exposures OSHA Method Two
Heat Stress Control: Review of the Hierarchy of Controls
Worker Training and Education: Introduction to Worker Training and Education
Heat Stress Programs: Parts of a Heat Stress Program

requirements: A desire to learn about heat stress and become a safety and health professional.
courses.description:
This course intended to introduce current and future safety professionals to basic heat stress management concepts. This course focuses on management applications and is primarily intended for safety professionals, foremen, and project managers.
The course sections are as follows:
Section One: Course Introduction
Section Two: Heat Stress Physics
Section Three: Heat Stress Regulations
Section Four: Heat Illnesses
Section Five: Heat Stress Risk Factors
Section Six: Heat Surveys and Exposure Assessments
Section Seven: Heat Stress Control
Section Eight: Worker Training and Education
Section Nine: Heat Stress Programs
Section Ten: OSHA Heat Index Guidance
Students will receive a certificate of completion after completing the course.
target_audience: This course is intended for workers desiring to transition into a safety role as well as current safety professionals wishing to expand their skillsets and learn more about heat stress management.

courses.title: Investigação de Acidentes
courses.bio: Aprenda a realizar uma investigação de acidentes utilizando as técnicas de Análise dos 5 Porquês e Análise de Ishikawa
objectives: Aprender a realizar uma investigação de acidentes utilizando a Técnica de Análise dos 5 Porquês
Aprender a realizar uma investigação de acidentes utilizando a Técnica de Análise de Ishikawa
Aprender a elaborar um Plano de Ação 5W2H
Os alunos serão capazes de conduzir investigações de acidentes de forma eficaz, compreendendo os principais passos das metodologias citadas
requirements: Não é necessário nenhum tipo de experiência anterior para fazer este curso.
courses.description:
O curso de Investigação de Acidentes capacita os alunos a conduzirem investigações eficazes de incidentes e acidentes no ambiente de trabalho. Ao longo do curso, os participantes aprenderão técnicas fundamentais, como a Análise dos 5 Porquês, a Análise de Ishikawa e o Plano de Ação 5W2H, essenciais para identificar as causas raiz dos eventos adversos.
Com uma abordagem prática e orientada para resultados, os alunos serão guiados através dos passos necessários para uma investigação completa, desde a coleta de dados até a implementação de medidas corretivas. Espera-se que, ao concluir o curso, os participantes sejam capazes de formular planos de ação precisos e eficazes, visando a prevenção da recorrência de acidentes e a promoção de um ambiente de trabalho seguro e saudável.
Além disso, os alunos desenvolverão uma mentalidade proativa em relação à segurança, reconhecendo a importância da prevenção de acidentes e contribuindo para uma cultura organizacional que priorize o bem-estar dos colaboradores.
Com uma combinação de conhecimentos teóricos e práticos, este curso oferece as habilidades necessárias para a identificação e mitigação de riscos, resultando em redução de custos e melhoria contínua da segurança no local de trabalho.
Temos certeza que ao alcançar esses resultados, os alunos estarão preparados para lidar com incidentes e acidentes em seus ambientes de trabalho, fazendo-os mais seguro, produtivo e saudável para todos os envolvidos.
target_audience: Este curso é indicado para qualquer pessoa que deseja aprender sobre como fazer uma Investigação de Acidentes

courses.title: First Aid Training for Babysitters
courses.bio: First Aid knowledge for all who look after children
objectives: Treatment of an unconscious casualty (Child and Baby) who is breathing
Treatment of an unconscious casualty who is not breathing (Child and Baby CPR)
Treatment of a choking child and baby
Treatment for a bleeding casualty
Treatment of burns and scalds
Treatment of poisoning
Treatment of meningitis
Treatment for raised temperatures and seizures
Treatment of Head injuries

Bleeding: Treatment of minor cuts, stings and bites
Embedded objects in nose, eyes and ears

requirements: This course is suitable for anyone who would like an increased knowledge in first aid.
courses.description:
First Aid for Babysitters
This course is full of knowledge and useful first aid information for all who look after children and babies. The course is suitable for babysitters, grandparents, neighbours and friends and family. Learning first aid is a must for all, by learning these vital lifesaving first aid skills you can make a difference to some ones life.
The course consists of videos that encourage you to practice the skills you are learning. There are numerous handouts you can download and keep for future reference as well as short tests to check your learning after various sections.
We will keep you entertained and engaged throughout and will always be on hand to help answer any questions you have - just email info@emtfirstaid.com or use the Q&A section. The course is fully compatible with all computers and mobile devices. You will be able to stop and start as often as you like and on completion you will be able to print your Certificate.
The course covers all major injuries and illnesses that can occur to a child and baby.


Unconscious Casualty (Recovery position)
CPR
Choking
Bleeding and Shock
Head Injuries
Effects of heat
Poisoning
Burns and Scalds
Meningities


The course is interactive, and confidence-building, and will provide plenty of opportunity to practice techniques.


EMT First Aid and Lifeguard Training provides this course for guidance and it is not in any way a substitute for medical advice. EMT First Aid and Lifeguard Training is not responsible or liable for any diagnosis made, or actions taken based on this course.  We strongly recommend that you attend a practical First Aid course to understand what to do in a medical emergency.


Please be aware that the information is correct at the time of filming June 2021 and relates only to UK Resuscitation and First Aid guidelines. If you are outside the UK please refer to your countries guidelines and governing board
target_audience: Grandparents
Babysitters
New parents
Nannies

courses.title: CPR، جهاز AED والإسعافات الأولية
courses.bio: تعلّم الإنعاش القلبي الرئوي (CPR) عبر الإنترنت – في أي مكان وزمان! تم إنشاؤه بواسطة أطباء ويتبع أحدث معايير وإرشادات ILC

إنقاذ حياة بواسطة NHCPS ومؤسسة ديسك: نقدم لكم "إنقاذ حياة" من NHCPS ومؤسسة ديسك.
دليل الإنعاش القلبي الرئوي واستخدام جهاز: دليل مقدم الإنعاش القلبي الرئوي واستخدام جهاز الصدمات الكهربائية والإسعافات الأو
الإنعاش القلبي الرئوي، استخدام جهاز الصد: إعطاء التنفسات في إنعاش القلب الرئوي
إعطاء التنفسات في إنعاش قلبي رئوي للرضع
كيفية الحصول على تدريب الإنعاش القلبي ال: كيفية الحصول على تدريب الإنعاش القلبي الرئوي (CPR)، واستخدام جهاز الصدمات الكهرب

requirements: لا يُشترط تدريب مسبق أو مواد خاصة.
courses.description:
معرفة كيفية تقديم الإنعاش القلبي الرئوي (CPR)، واستخدام جهاز الصدمات الكهربائية الخارجية الآلي (AED) وتقديم الإسعافات الأولية أمر بالغ الأهمية في الاستجابة لحالات الطوارئ اليومية. باتباع أحدث الإرشادات، ستعدك هذه الدورة لأداء CPR والإسعافات الأولية واستخدام جهاز AED.
ستغطي هذه الدورة تقديم الرعاية للإصابات البسيطة والمعقدة، والاستجابة للمشاكل الطبية الشائعة، وأداء CPR بجودة عالية، وإدارة مجرى الهواء الأساسية، والسلامة والوقاية. تشمل الفئات العمرية التي يغطيها البرنامج الرضع والأطفال والبالغين.
تشرح هذه الدورة كيفية تقديم الإسعافات الأولية للأشخاص الذين يعانون من حالات طوارئ مختلفة، بما في ذلك المشاكل الطبية والإصابات الناتجة عن الصدمات والإصابات البيئية. نعرّف مصطلح "الإسعافات الأولية" ونحدد خطواته الأساسية قبل الغوص في محتويات حقيبة الإسعافات الأولية القياسية. نعرفك على تقنية الإنعاش القلبي الرئوي (CPR)، التي تجمع بين "التنفس الإنقاذي" وضغطات الصدر لإنقاذ الأشخاص في حالات الطوارئ الطبية.
ثم تناقش الدورة الاختناق لأنه الحادث الأكثر شيوعًا في المنزل أو مكان العمل. نوضح لك كيفية تقديم الإسعافات الأولية للرضع والأطفال والبالغين الذين يعانون من الاختناق. ثم نوسع تحليلنا لـ CPR ونوضح كيفية تطبيق واستخدام أجهزة الصدمات الكهربائية الخارجية الآلية (AED) بأمان لاستعادة ضربات القلب بشكل منتظم أثناء الأحداث القلبية.
نساعدك على تعلم مهارات إنقاذ الحياة بوتيرتك الخاصة، لذا سجل الآن للحصول على الاعتماد الدولي الذي يخبر الناس أنك تعرف كيفية إنقاذ الأرواح في الأزمات. يمكن أن تساعدك هذه الدورة في الحفاظ على سلامتك وسلامة أحبائك في المنزل، كما تؤهلك لتكون ضابط الأمان في مكتبك، وهو ما يحتاجه كل مكان عمل.
تشمل حزمة الدورة:
محاضرات وعروض فيديو عن الإنعاش القلبي الرئوي (CPR)، واستخدام جهاز الصدمات الكهربائية الخارجية الآلي (AED) والإسعافات الأولية
تقييمات المعرفة ومراجعة الأسئلة عن الإنعاش القلبي الرئوي (CPR)، واستخدام جهاز الصدمات الكهربائية الخارجية الآلي (AED) والإسعافات الأولية
شهادة في الإنعاش القلبي الرئوي (CPR)، واستخدام جهاز الصدمات الكهربائية الخارجية الآلي (AED) والإسعافات الأولية من NHCPS
ملاحظة: هذه الدورة للتدريب على الإنعاش القلبي الرئوي (CPR)، واستخدام جهاز الصدمات الكهربائية الخارجية الآلي (AED) والإسعافات الأولية.
target_audience: المهنيون الصحيون
طلاب الطب
طلاب التمريض والرعاية الصحية المساعدة
مستجيبون لحالات الطوارئ
أي شخص يريد أن يكون مستعداً لإنقاذ حياة.

courses.title: Active Shooter/Workplace Violence & Terrorism Attack Defense
courses.bio: learn how to defend yourself and your loved ones against active shooter, terrorist attacks and workplace violence attack
objectives: How to Survive an Active Shooter or Terrorist Attack
requirements: To Be Proactive
courses.description:
the active shooter, workplace violence and terrorism attack defense program is the most comprehensive program that exists today on this topics. While active shooter shootouts and terrorist attacks happening all over the world in more frequent manner it is not a matter of a choice anymore, it is an obligation to learn how you can better defend yourself against this type of threats.
The program was created by a former Israeli special forces and counter terrorism expert where he brings a lot of his knowledge from the state of Israel which is the number one country combating terrorism for the past 70 years.
The program consist of the following modules:
An active shooter attack experiment
Classroom defense for students
Classroom defense for teachers
Knife attacks defense
Handgun attacks defense
Improvised first aid
Belt defense
Vehicle attack defense
Defense in public places
Explosives attack defense
Workplace violence defense
target_audience: Anyone That is concerned about Active Shooter, Armed Intruders and Terrorist Attacks and want to know How to Be Able to Survive

courses.title: Cardio Pulmonary Resuscitation (CPR)
courses.bio: The mechanics of CPR and explanations of why each step is necessary
objectives: History and legal basis
How CPR should be preformed
Practice CPR
requirements: one tennis ball, or soccer ball, and a mechanical scale
courses.description:
Cardio Pulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) is an essential and necessary skill for all persons. This course will take the student through the origins of CPR, The legal systems that regulate it, and organizations creating national and international standards for it. It will explain how CPR has be come more than just a part of First Aid. The course will explain how CPR has become an international force reshaping our world. This includes material for persons who need, or want an in depth refresher, or first timers wanting an in depth course in CPR, this course is for you. Using common house hold items, such as a tennis balls or soccer balls you can learn effective CPR. This is the most complete course on CPR today. The course has been upgraded to show High Performance CPR, which is the standard today, as well as a lecture on narcan and the opiate adiction problem in the United States.
This course is in compliance with the 2010consessus. If you are interested in certification contact us at the Arthur Jackson CTC website
target_audience: Adults and children above the age of twelve (12)

courses.title: Hazard Communication Safety Training
courses.bio: The ultimate hazard communication safety training course
objectives: What is hazard communication
How to safely work with chemicals
How to read an SDS
Learn the relevant OSHA standards related to this topic
Learn how to work safer when doing work related to this topic
Increase your workplace safety and health skill set
Get certified and become more valuable in the workforce
requirements: No experience necessary. Everyone welcome.
courses.description:
Chemicals are everywhere in the workplace. You have a right to know what chemicals are in the workplace and what chemicals you may be exposed to.  Learn how to work safely with chemicals, how to read safety data sheets, why they are important and why you need to know where they are.
This course is intended to provide safety and health training in compliance with Federal OSHA and State OSHA training requirements such as CalOSHA. If you have questions, you may ask our instructors and they will respond to you with in a short period of time as is outlined by the OSHA standards.
The training will cover all of the required elements outlined in Federal and State OSHA standards to ensure that your training meets or exceed the minimum required training. If your training has a time-requirement, the content of the training has been designed to meet that requirement.
The training is developed by our in-house, real trainers with twenty years of experience, working in the field and with real crews and is trusted by public agencies throughout California.
There are no prerequisites required for this course. The course will walk you through all of the elements required to be successful and complete any questions or quizzes or testing that may be required.
target_audience: Anyone working with chemicals in the workplace
Anyone working around chemicals in the workplace

The training will cover all of the required elements outlined in Federal and State OSHA standards to ensure that your training meets or exceed the minimum required training. If your training has a time-requirement, the content of the training has been designed to meet that requirement.
The training is developed by our in-house, real trainers with twenty years of experience, working in the field and with real crews and is trusted by public agencies throughout California.
There are no prerequisites required for this course. The course will walk you through all of the elements required to be successful and complete any questions or quizzes or testing that may be required.

courses.title: Noções de Primeiros Socorros
courses.bio: RCP; Tratamento de ferimentos, fraturas e queimaduras; Manobras de desengasgamento.
objectives: Aprenderão a identificar e agir rapidamente em situações de parada cardíaca, aplicando a técnica de RCP de forma eficiente e segura para salvar vidas.
Serão capacitados a reconhecer os sinais de AVC, infarto e outras emergências, sabendo quando e como chamar ajuda médica imediatamente.
Conhecerão as abordagens para tratar ferimentos como cortes, fraturas e queimaduras, minimizando os danos enquanto aguardam atendimento profissional.
Entenderão como agir em casos de engasgos e asfixia, realizando manobras como a manobra de Heimlich para desobstruir vias aéreas e garantir a respiração.

Curso de Noções de Primeiros Socorros: Hemorragias - Elevação do ponto de sangramento
Obstrução das vias aéreas por corpo estranho
Picadas de cobra e outros animais peçonhentos

requirements: Acesso à internet: Conexão estável para assistir às aulas e acessar materiais do curso. Dispositivo compatível: Computador, tablet ou celular para visualizar vídeos, tutoriais e realizar atividades práticas. Motivação para aprender: Interesse em adquirir conhecimento sobre cuidados de emergência e primeiros socorros. Idade mínima: Recomendado para maiores de 16 anos, com compreensão básica de instruções e manuais. Condições físicas para prática: Algumas atividades exigem simulação de manobras que podem ser realizadas de forma segura em casa.
courses.description:
O curso online de Noções de Primeiros Socorros é ideal para quem deseja aprender técnicas essenciais para agir rapidamente em situações de emergência, oferecendo os conhecimentos necessários para salvar vidas até a chegada de profissionais de saúde. Com um conteúdo completo e acessível, o curso abrange temas fundamentais, como a realização de RCP (reanimação cardiopulmonar), manobras de desengasgamento (como a manobra de Heimlich), controle de hemorragias, tratamento de queimaduras, fraturas e ferimentos, além do reconhecimento de sinais de AVC, infarto e outras emergências médicas.
A metodologia do curso é 100% online, com aulas em vídeo, materiais de leitura e atividades práticas, permitindo que os alunos aprendam no seu próprio ritmo, de qualquer lugar e a qualquer momento. O curso é dividido em módulos que cobrem situações cotidianas e de maior risco, promovendo o desenvolvimento de habilidades essenciais para agir com segurança e eficiência em momentos críticos.
Destinado a pessoas de todas as idades, o curso é particularmente útil para pais, professores, cuidadores, profissionais da saúde e qualquer indivíduo que queira estar preparado para lidar com emergências. Ao final do curso, os participantes terão a confiança necessária para prestar os primeiros socorros com agilidade e conhecimento, proporcionando ajuda vital em situações de risco.
target_audience: Esse curso é destinado a qualquer pessoa interessada em aprender noções básicas de primeiros socorros, incluindo: Profissionais da saúde que desejam reforçar seus conhecimentos. Pais e responsáveis que querem estar preparados para situações de emergência com crianças. Professores, treinadores e cuidadores que lidam com grupos e precisam saber como agir rapidamente em emergências. Qualquer pessoa que deseje saber como agir em casos de acidentes e emergências, garantindo maior segurança no dia a dia.

target_audience: Profissionais de diversas áreas que lidam com produtos químicos no local de trabalho;
Técnicos em segurança do trabalho que buscam aumentar seu conhecimento em gestão de produtos químicos;
Supervisores, coorenadores responsável por liderar equipes que precisam lidar com produtos químicos.

courses.title: Understanding Sepsis: Definition, Signs, and Treatments
courses.bio: Sepsis- Definition, Signs and Symptoms, Diagnosis and Treatments (UK BASED COURSE)
objectives: A Clear and Precise Sepsis definition
The Causes of Sepsis
The Signs and Symptoms of Sepsis in an Adult
Tools for Sepsis Preventnion
The Treatments can Help Cure Sepsis
How the NEWS2 Score can help track Sepsis
An Overview of Post Sepsis Syndrome
The Signs and Symptoms of Sepsis in Pregnant Adult
The Signs and Symptoms of Sepsis in Children
requirements: That you are aware UK Healthcare System
courses.description:
Join us in this comprehensive video guide as we dive deep into the critical topic of sepsis, a life-threatening condition resulting from the body's extreme response to an infection. Sepsis is a global health crisis, affecting millions of people around the world every year, yet it remains poorly understood by the general public.
In this informative and engaging video, we unravel the complexities of sepsis, covering its causes, the science behind its development, and why it can be so dangerous if not recognised early and treated promptly. Through expert interviews, patient stories, and clear explanations, we'll explore:
What sepsis is and the different stages of its progression, including sepsis, severe sepsis, and septic shock.
The common infections that can lead to sepsis and the signs and symptoms to watch out for.
The importance of rapid diagnosis and the latest treatment options available.
Preventative measures to reduce the risk of sepsis and the importance of vaccination and proper hygiene.
Real-life experiences from survivors and healthcare professionals on the front lines of sepsis management.
Whether you're a healthcare professional looking to update your knowledge on sepsis, a student in the medical field, or someone interested in understanding more about this critical condition, this video offers valuable insights and information.
Remember, sepsis is a medical emergency, and early recognition and treatment can save lives. Watch, learn, and share this video to spread awareness about sepsis and its impact on global health.
It is important to note that this a UK based Sepsis Course and therefore the stats, treatment options and prevention techniques are all from the NHS. This course is an educational course, and should not be taken for medical or legal advice.
target_audience: Training Nurses that wanted an in depth Overview of Sepsis
Experienced Nurses who want a Refresher on Sepsis

courses.title: Emergency Life Support | First Aid Training
courses.bio: Learn important life saving first aid. Treatment of major illness and injuries
objectives: To learn how to treat an unconscious casualty who is breathing by using the recovery position
To learn how to treat an unconscious casualty who is NOT breathing by performing CPR
To understand how to use an AED (defibrillator)
To learn how to treat a suspected Heart Attack
To learn how to treat a casualty choking
To learn how to treat a bleeding casualty with minor and major wounds
To learn how to treat a burn
To learn how to treat Seizures
To learn how to treat Asthma
To learn how to treat Anaphylaxis
requirements: This course is suitable for anyone who would like an increased knowledge in first aid.
courses.description:
Do you want to know what to do in a emergency life threatening situation? This course will empower you with the skills to know how to treat various life threatening illness and injuries.


The course consists of videos that encourage you to practice the skills you are learning. There are numerous handouts you can download and keep for future reference as well as short tests to check your learning after various sections. We will keep you entertained and engaged throughout and will always be on hand to help answer any questions you have - just email info@emtfirstaid.com or use the Q&A section. The course is fully compatible with all computers and mobile devices. You will be able to stop and start as often as you like and on completion you will be able to print your Certificate.


It is impossible to cover all eventualities within this course, or to equip you with the knowledge and skills to appropriately diagnose and treat in unpredictable real life situations. If you suspect illness or injury, you should always seek immediate professional medical advice.
The Author has made every effort to ensure the accuracy of the information contained within the course, however this course is merely a guide and the Author does not accept any liability or responsibility for any inaccuracies or for any mistreatment or misdiagnosis of any person, however caused.
EMT First Aid and Lifeguard Training provides this course for guidance and it is not in any way a substitute for medical advice. EMT First Aid and Lifeguard Training is not responsible or liable for any diagnosis made, or actions taken based on this course.  We strongly recommend that you attend a practical First Aid course to understand what to do in a medical emergency.
Please be aware that the information is correct at the time of filming June 2021 and relates only to UK Resuscitation and First Aid guidelines. If you are outside the UK please refer to your countries guidelines and governing board.
target_audience: This course is suitable for anyone who would like an increased knowledge in emergency life support
You!

courses.title: Accident | Incident Investigation
courses.bio: This training is designed to enable you to successfully investigate an incident or accident.
objectives: The definitions and terminology of occupational health and safety.
The principle theories of accident in practice.
The human failures lead to accident.
Four steps of accident investigation process.
Demonstration of report writing.
requirements: You should have knowledge in basics of health and safety.
There are no academic qualifications, skills or experience required to take the courses.
courses.description:
The ILO estimates that some 2.3 million women and men around the world succumb to work-related accidents or diseases every year; this corresponds to over 6000 deaths every single day. Worldwide, there are around 340 million occupational accidents and 160 million victims of work-related illnesses annually.
This course gives you an opportunity to find out what went wrong. Learning the lessons and taking action may reduce, or even prevent, accidents in the future.
As a step-by-step approach of investigating the incident, it will help you, particularly smaller businesses, to carry out your own health and safety investigations. Investigating accidents and incidents explains why you need to carry out investigations and takes you through each step of the process.
What to expect
Memorable case studies
Sessions with  clear examples.
Summaries to reinforce key points
Multiple choice quiz after each session.
Successful completion of assignment  awarded a certificate.(Soft-copy)
Top 4 business benefits
Making a safer workplace
Improving worker confidence
Preventing future business losses from disruption , down-time and lost business
Developing useful skills and knowledge that can be applied throughout the organization
After the course there will be an assessment 20 multiple choice questions to assess your knowledge.
Course content:
1. INTRODUCTION
i. ILO statistics
ii. Reasons of manage OSH
iii. Responsibilities of employer
iv. Why investigate?
v. What Law says?
2. DEFINITIONS
i. Hazard
ii. Risk
iii. Incident
iv. Accident
v. Near miss
vi. Dangerous occurrence
vii. Days lost
viii. First aid case
ix. Lost Time Injury (LTI)
x. Medical treatment case (MTC)
xi. Risk control measures
xii. Immediate Cause
xiii. Underlying Cause
xiv. Root Cause
xv. Unsafe Act
xvi. Unsafe Condition
3. ACCIDENT THEORIES
i. Accident Ratio Study
ii. Domino Theory
iii. Multiple Causation Theory
iv. Cause & Effect Concept
4. HUMAN FAILURE
i. Human errors
ii. Human violations
iii. Factors Affecting Human Behavior
5. INCIDENT INVESTIGATION PROCEDURE
i. Reasons for investigation
ii. Level of Investigation
iii. Under Reporting
iv. Written plan for investigation
v. Incident investigation procedures
vi. When should it start?
vii. What makes a good investigation?
viii. Role of OHS policy
ix. Emergency response
x. Initial report
xi. Steps of Investigation
xii. Step one : Gathering the information
xiii. Step two : Analyzing the information
xiv. Step three : Identifying risk control measures
xv. Step four : The action plan and its implementation
After each section, there will be a session quiz.
Finally there will be a report writing assignment which you have to submit within 7 days from course completion. This assignment will enable you to develop report writing skill and convince the management to take action.
target_audience: Who are working as Occupational Health and Safety or related position.
Managers , Engineers m Supervisors.
Who wish to become Occupational Health and Safety professionals
Anyone responsible for accident investigation within their organisation.

courses.title: Safety Culture
courses.bio: Creating a Culture of Safety
objectives: This course is designed to empower workers with the knowledge and confidence to use tools aimed at establishing a strong safety culture.
Provide workers with a foundational understanding of what a safety culture is and its importance.
Equip workers with the skills to identify unsafe conditions in the workplace
Apply the knowledge gained throughout the course to real-world scenarios.

Introduction: Course Overview and Summary of Topics

requirements: Beginner to Advanced: No experience needed
courses.description:
This course is designed to be a comprehensive and engaging learning experience that equips workers with the knowledge, skills, and confidence to promote a positive safety culture in the workplace. By covering key topics such as safety culture, its importance, and effective tools like Stop Work Authority, the course aims to:


Provide a foundational understanding of safety culture and its significance.
Equip workers with the skills to identify and address potential safety hazards.
Address common challenges and fears associated with invoking Stop Work Authority, empowering workers to take action when necessary.
Through a combination of theoretical knowledge, real-world scenarios, and practical application, the course empowers workers to:


Promote a strong safety culture through collaboration and open dialogue.
Take an active role in preventing accidents and ensuring a safe working environment.
Develop the confidence and skills to invoke Stop Work Authority when necessary.
By using practical methods and encouraging feedback, the course fosters a culture of immediate action, collaboration, and priority on safety, ultimately reinforcing a safety-first mindset among workers.


This course is intended to be part of a comprehensive series focused on specialized safety training in the workplace. Each course within the series is designed to build upon the fundamentals of safety culture, addressing specific topics and challenges that workers may encounter in various environments. By integrating this course into a broader safety training curriculum, participants can expect to gain:


Cohesive Learning Experience: Each course will connect and complement one another, allowing participants to gradually deepen their understanding of safety principles and practices.
Specialized Knowledge: Subsequent courses will address specialized areas of safety, such as hazard recognition, emergency response, ergonomics, and specific industry-related risks, providing participants with tailored skills relevant to their roles.
Progressive Skill Development: As workers move through the series, they will acquire a progressive skill set that enhances their ability to identify, address, and manage safety concerns effectively.
Collaborative Safety Culture: The series promotes a culture of safety that emphasizes employee involvement, communication, and shared responsibility, reinforcing the importance of a proactive approach to workplace safety.
Real-World Application: Each course will incorporate real-world examples and scenarios to illustrate applicable safety practices, ensuring that participants can implement their learning in their daily work environments.
By participating in this series of courses, workers will be better prepared to contribute to a positive safety culture, fostering a safer workplace for everyone.
target_audience: This is an introductory course to familiarize workers with safety culture.

courses.title: حِماية المؤسسات من خطر الحرائق
courses.bio: المؤسسات و خطر الحرائق و الانْفجارات
objectives: هو درس يَستهدف الأشخاص الذين يرغبون في اكْتساب معرفة واسعة حول مخاطر الحريق في مُختلف المؤسسات- صناعية كانت أو غير ذلك- وحول طبيعته والأسباب التي تُحدثه والعواق
ويصف بالتفصيل التدابير الواجب اتخاذها والوسائل التي يجب اسْتخدامها لِمكافحته في حالة فشل الإجراءات الوقائية ومنعه من الانْتشار إلى الجوار.
تم تنظيم الدرس بطريقة تضمن الغرض الذي صمم من أجله وهو جعل الطلاب يستفيدون من معلومات أكثر كلما تقدموا في الدرس.
هو درس يستهدف المهنيين والباحثين عن عمل وأولئك الذين يرغبون في إعادة التدريب بسبب الوضع الاقتصادي الذي يجبرهم أحيانًا على التوجه نحو هذا الاخْتيار وحتى الفضوليي

2- ما هو الحريق و ما هو الانفجار؟: ما هو الحريق و ما هو الانْفجار؟
الاحْتراق أو الآشْتعال: هل يمكن لكل الغازات أن تنفجر في الجو بفعل شرارة كهربائية؟
أسباب الحرائق: ما هي الأسباب التي لا تنتمي لأسباب الحرائق؟
كيفية انْتشار الحرائق: :تنتقل حرارة الحرائق من مكان إلى آخر عن طريق الأدخنة والغازات من-
الوقاية من الحرائق و الانْفجارات: :كواشف الحرائق تكتشف الحرائق وتطفئُها في الوقت نفسه
مكافحة الحرايق: ما هي المطفأة التي تصلح لكل الحرائق؟

requirements: هو درس لا يتطلب أي معلومات مُسبقة
courses.description:
هو درس موجه لِلأشخاص العاديين الذين يرغبون في اكْتساب معرفة واسعة حول الحرائق في المؤسسات الصناعية وغيرها من المؤسسات الأخرى مهما كان نشاطها والقطاع الذي تنتسب إليه ومهما كن حجمها كبيرًا أو صغيرًا. وهو يَصف بالتفصيل أنواع هذه الحرائق والأسْباب التي تؤدي إلى نشوبها والعواقب التي يُمكن أن تَنجر عنها وهي تمُس بالعمال أنفسهم وكذلك بمُمتلكات المؤسسات المُتضررة دون نسيان البيئة التي   قد تتعرض هي الأخرى لِتأثيرات تُلحق أضرارا بمُكوِناتها الطبيعية
كما يَتطرق للإجراءات الواجب اتخاذها والوسائل الواجب اسْتخدامها لِمنع حدوث هذه المخاطر التي تؤدي في الكثير من الأحيان إلى كوارث كبرى وكذلك كيفية المكافحة الناجحة في حالة الفشل الجانب الوقائي
والحرائق مخاطر كُبرى يُمكنها أن تَحدث من شرارة كهربائية أو جراء تصرف طائش كاسْتعمال عيدان الكبريت في أماكن توجد بها مواد قابلة لِلاشتعال إلى غير ذلك من الأسباب وما أكثرها
وألسنة اللهب قد تأتي على الأخضر واليابس. فقد تشل جزءًا مهمًا من المؤسسة وتؤثر على مصداقياتها اتجاه الزبون وقد تُشلها كليًا فتصبح في خبر كان ويصبح عُمالها بطالين يبحثون من شارع لآخر عن قوت عيالهم
ولأجل تفادي العواقب الوخيمة التي غالبًا ما تنجر عن الحرائق تُلزِم الدول والحكومات مُختلف المؤسسات بأخذ هذا الموضوع على مَحمل الجد. فتنشئ هذه الأخيرة مصالح خاصة لذلك وتُكون تقنيين في الميدان للحفاظ على وسائل الإنتاج والقوة العاملة من أي مخاطر قد تُهددهما
target_audience: هو درس يستهدف المهنيين والباحثين عن عمل وأولئك الذين يرغبون في إعادة التدريب بسبب الوضع الاقتصادي الذي يجبرهم أحيانًا على التوجه نحو هذا الاخْتيار وحتى الفضوليين يمكنهم الاستفادة منه بشكل كبير

courses.title: Confined Space (CS) Trained
courses.bio: Confined Space Entry, CS hazards and controls, CS roles and Responsibilities, Standby man, Emergency Response and Rescue
objectives: Confined Space Hazards
Confined Space Requirement & Control Measures
Roles & Responsibilities
Rescue & Emergency Procedures
requirements: No experience or skills required. You will learn from here.
courses.description:
This course imparts knowledge to the participants with minimum time and maximum output. The animated pictures are used to elaborate each chapter. The live examples from my experience are shared with the audience to understand it.
The course is divided into 04 main sections


Section -1 Introduction and examples of the confined space.

Moreover, we will discuss about
HSE Regulations

This course involved review of the questions in each section, which will revise whatever have been learned. This training also contain videos and pictures to clear your concept about the confined space.
What you'll learn

Students

courses.title: OSHA Fall Protection
courses.bio: How To Use A Fall Protection Harness To Protect You From Falls
objectives: Learn to wear and use a fall protection harness for work at heights
Learn to identify the component parts of the fall protection harness and understand their function
Learn the importance of understanding weight limits and working from proper anchor points
Learn how to inspect your harness for defects, wear, and tear
Learn to choose the lanyard which works best with your job task
Learn the importance and hazards of working at heights
Learn what suspension trauma is and the importance of expedient fall harness rescues
Increase your workplace safety and health skill set
Get certified and become more valuable in the workforce
requirements: No experience necessary. Everyone welcome.
courses.description:
Numerous job classifications require workers to be able to work at heights, including construction workers, roofers, and public works employees. A fall protection harness with a lanyard is a crucial tool for occupations requiring such work at heights to prevent dangerous and often fatal falls.
This course will take you through the basics of the fall harness. The course will instruct you on how to wear a fall protection harness properly, as well as how to inspect it for defects. This course will also instruct you on the importance of understanding weight limits, not only for your harness but also for the lanyard and the anchor points to which you attach.
Trainees will also learn to identify the component parts of the harness and understand their function, such as the fall indicator and the D-ring. This course will also instruct you about performing a rescue for someone who has fallen while wearing a harness and the danger of suspension trauma.
Working at heights is a hazardous occupational hazard, and knowing how to properly utilize a fall protection harness is vital to your health and safety.
This course is intended to provide safety and health training in compliance with Federal OSHA and State OSHA training requirements such as CalOSHA. If you have questions, you may ask our instructors, and they will respond to you within a short period of time, as outlined by the OSHA standards.
The training will cover all of the required elements outlined in Federal and State OSHA standards to ensure that your training meets or exceed the minimum required training. If your training has a time requirement, the content of the training has been designed to meet that requirement.
The training is developed by our in-house, real trainers with twenty years of experience working in the field and with real crews and are trusted by public agencies throughout California.
There are no prerequisites required for this course. The course will walk you through all of the elements required to be successful and complete any questions or quizzes, or testing that may be required.
target_audience: Anyone working at heights, such as in construction or in excavation work

courses.title: Child Passenger Safety
courses.bio: How to Choose and Use a Car Seat

How to Choose and Use a Car Seat: Why car seats, booster seats and seat belts are so important.
What is a CPST and what is correct installation?

requirements: No prerequisites.
courses.description:
By the end of this course, you’ll be able to provide parent-friendly tips on how to correctly choose and use a car seat, including why child restraints are effective and needed, how to select the best type of car seat for a child's needs, what a correct car seat installation looks like, how a child benefits from a harness that fits correctly, and when it is time to move to a new type of car seat. Keeping kids safe on the road is a team effort and this class will give you the information you need to prevent injuries and save lives in your community.
This course includes a series of videos so you can take it at your own pace.
target_audience: Parents, caregivers, day care workers, nurses, EMTs, First Responders

courses.title: Trazabilidad alimentaria: protección legal y activo de valor
courses.bio: Trazabilidad alimentaria: cómo crear un activo de valor y darle protección legal a tu empresa
objectives: Comprender qué es la trazabilidad en el Derecho Alimentario.
Conocer los cambios regulatorios y tecnológicos que orientan la trazabilidad de alimentos.
Transformar la trazabilidad en un mecanismo de protección legal para la empresa.
Aprender cómo convertir la trazabilidad en un activo que aporta valor agregado a la actividad comercial y a los productos.
Identificar elementos legales de protección para la empresa agro-alimentaria.

Descifrando la Trazabilidad en el Derech: La trazabilidad alimentaria: una inversión más que una obligación
Kit de Herramientas: ¿Cómo y a dónde buscar la normativa alimentaria vigente?
De la teoría a la acción: la trazabilidad en el Derecho
Análisis de caso: La reforma de trazabilidad del FDA, aplicable para el 2026
La trazabilidad, un aliado para proteger: Definición de características de productos en los contratos alimentarios
Delimitando la obligación de trazabilidad por medio de contratos
Principales tipos de responsabilidad en el sector alimentario
Delimitando la responsabilidad, con ayuda de la trazabilidad
Análisis de caso: Reforma sobre el control de la salmonella en pollo - FDA
De la trazabilidad a la rentabilidad: ag: Trazabilidad alimentaria: añadiendo valor a través de la información
Transformando la trazabilidad en una ventaja competitiva
Hacia una trazabilidad “más inteligente”: con el uso de nuevas tecnologías

requirements: No se necesita ningún conocimiento legal previo. Este es un curso abierto, para todos los profesionales que trabajan en el sector alimentario, en la industria en general o para quienes tengan una gran curiosidad por nuevos temas.
courses.description:
¿Te preguntas cómo adaptar tu empresa a los requisitos de trazabilidad alimentaria? ¿Piensas que la trazabilidad es una carga y te gustaría poder sacarle provecho para el beneficio de tu empresa?
En este curso aprenderás:
1. Qué es la trazabilidad de los alimentos y cómo está regulada.
2. Cómo convertir la trazabilidad en mecanismo de protección para la empresa.
3. Cómo hacer de la trazabilidad un activo que da valor para la empresa.
Te prepararemos para identificar la situación que tiene la empresa en materia de trazabilidad y relacionarla con las exigencias del marco regulatorio. Además, podrás distinguir las obligaciones que se derivan de la regulación de aquellas que surgen de las relaciones comerciales. También, en este curso aprenderás a relacionar las obligaciones y las responsabilidades legales o contractuales con los operadores o contrapartes, las actividades y los procesos específicos que se realizan en la empresa. Aprenderás a relacionar la información técnica y regulatoria que agrega más valor a los productos con los procesos de trazabilidad.
Hemos diseñado este curso con un lenguaje sencillo. Vas a contar con un Cuaderno de curso, con el que te orientaremos para que apliques directamente el contenido de este curso en tu actividad o producto. Así, al finalizar este curso contarás con una guía que contiene los aspectos legales básicos para  convertir la trazabilidad en un elemento de protección legal de la empresa y a la vez, dar o aumentar el valor agregado de tus productos. Además, contarás con las referencias normativas principales, documentos de síntesis y acceso gratuito al Podcast Passe-Partout, que te permitirá mantenerte actualizado, sobre la legislación alimentaria, cada semana.
Este curso está basado en los siguientes estudios:
1. Principe de transparence et information des consommateurs dans la législation alimentaire européenne, publicado bajo el auspicio del Consejo Europeo de Investigación, por INIDA S.A y elaborado por el Dr. Hugo Muñoz Ureña.
2. L’obligation d’autocontrôle des entreprises en Droit européen de la sécurité alimentaire publicado bajo el auspicio del Consejo Europeo de Investigación, por INIDA S.A y elaborado por la Dra. Marlen León Guzmán.
3. Diccionario sobre Derecho de la Seguridad Alimentaria, publicado por INIDA S.A, para la versión en español.
target_audience: Personas que trabajan en la producción, la comercialización o exportación de alimentos.
Personas que deben trabajar con documentos legales que contienen aspectos de trazabilidad pero que no tienen formación jurídica.
Personas a cargo del legal compliance, control quality o regulation enforcement para atender exigencias de exportación en mercados internacionales.
Personas que desean aprender sobre la trazabilidad, inteligencia artificial y blockchain en la industria alimentaria, articulando los aspectos legales.
Personas que tienen a su cargo procesos productivos.
Personas que brindan asesoría jurídica a empresas del sector alimentario.
Personas que desean emprender o ampliar un negocio internacional de producción de alimentos.
Personas con una mentalidad abierta y que ven en los cambios, grandes oportunidades para aprender sobre nuevos temas.

courses.bio: Safety ,Health , Environment and Security at construction sites
objectives: التعرف على اجراءات السلامة في المواقع الانشائية
التعرف على اجراءات الرقابة والتحكم في المواقع الانشائية

الاستدامة في اجراءات المشاريع

courses.title: First Aid at workplace
courses.bio: Workplace First Aid: Life-Saving Skills, Emergency Response, and Injury Management
objectives: Understand the importance of workplace first aid to ensure safety and save lives.
Recognise and respond to emergencies with confidence and efficiency.
Learn essential first aid techniques, including CPR and injury management.
Build confidence and readiness to handle workplace emergencies effectively.

Building Confidence in Workplace First A: Building Confidence in Workplace First Aid
Building Confidence in Workplace First Aid

requirements: This course requires no prior knowledge and is ideal for beginners. A willingness to learn and practice first aid is essential, and access to a first aid kit is recommended but not mandatory. It’s perfect for anyone interested in workplace safety.
courses.description:
This comprehensive course, First Aid at Workplace, equips you with the essential skills and knowledge to handle medical emergencies confidently and effectively. Whether you're an employee, manager, or workplace safety officer, this course is designed to ensure you're prepared to respond to a range of incidents, from minor injuries to life-threatening situations.
You’ll begin by exploring the fundamentals of first aid, including its importance in creating a safe workplace environment. You’ll then learn to recognise common workplace emergencies, such as slips, falls, burns, and medical conditions like heart attacks or strokes. Through practical guidance, you’ll master life-saving techniques, including CPR, the use of an AED, and managing choking incidents.
Additionally, the course covers essential injury management, such as treating wounds, fractures, and burns. You’ll gain insight into health and safety regulations, risk assessment, and emergency response protocols, enabling you to proactively create a safer work environment.
Designed for beginners, this course requires no prior knowledge of first aid. It provides step-by-step instructions, real-life examples, and actionable strategies to build your confidence and readiness in handling emergencies.
By the end of the course, you’ll have the skills to save lives, minimise injuries, and promote workplace safety, making you a valuable asset in any organisation.
target_audience: This course is designed for employees, managers, and workplace safety officers who want to enhance their knowledge and skills in first aid. It is suitable for anyone keen to create a safer work environment, regardless of their previous experience. Whether you’re looking to fulfil a workplace requirement, build confidence in emergency response, or simply be better prepared to help others, this course is ideal for you.

courses.title: TRABAJOS EN ALTURAS CON CUMPLIMIENTO STPS Y OSHA 1926 SUBP M
courses.bio: Seguridad para trabajos en elturas
objectives: El estudiante será capaz de identificar los riesgos a los que se enfrentan los trabajadores que realicen trabajos en alturas
Sabrá elegir el sistema de protección contra caída adecuado dependiendo la actividad a realizar.
El estudiante conocerá los requisitos básicos para trabajos en plataformas de elevación, andamios y escaleras.
requirements: Conocimiento básicos en seguridad industrial
courses.description:
El siguiente curso está diseñado para que el estudiante comprenda de manera integral los riesgos asociados a la realización de trabajos en alturas, además también aprenderá sobre los sistemas de protección y restricción de caídas que existen para trabajos en alturas esto con el objetivo de alcanzar la meta de cero accidentes en cualquier área o sitio de trabajo donde se encuentren. Así mismo obtendrá las bases suficientes para determinar si un trabajo se hace o no de manera segura cumpliendo siempre con la normatividad vigente en los Estados Unidos Mexicanos.
Esto se logra a través de los siguientes temas.
1.  ¿Qué es un trabajo en alturas?
2. Factor de caída.
3. Puntos de anclaje
4. Detección vs restricción contra caídas.
5. Sistemas de barandales
6. Redes de seguridad
7. Cubiertas para huecos
8. Sistemas de posicionamiento
9. Líneas de advertencia
10. Anclajes
11. Líneas de vida
12. Seguridad con escaleras
13. Seguridad con plataformas de elevación
14. Seguridad con andamios
Al finalizar el curso, el estudiante puede obtener un DC3 constancia de habilidades siempre y cuando la calificación sea igual o mayor a 80 y una constancia de participación si su calificación es menor a 80 y mayor a 60.
target_audience: Supervisores y trabajadores de la construcción
Trabajadores de la construcción
Estudiantes interesados en la seguridad e higiene laboral

courses.title: Expedition and Wilderness Medicine
courses.bio: A Short Course For Everyone
objectives: Wilderness first aid
How To Manage Medical Crisis in Remote Environment
Safety in the wilderness
Survival Techniques
requirements: Basic English Knowledge and Internet
courses.description:
Embark on a transformative educational journey with our Udemy online course in Expedition and Wilderness Medicine, meticulously designed and led by your seasoned instructor. Upon successful completion, a certificate attesting to your proficiency will be awarded, marking the culmination of your enriching learning experience.
This engaging short course is tailored to empower adventurers, nature enthusiasts, and budding medical professionals with vital skills for navigating and thriving in remote and challenging environments. Delve into crucial topics such as emergency response in the wild, injury management, wilderness first aid, and environmental hazards through immersive video lessons, comprehensive tutorials, and practical simulations.
Benefit from the extensive real-world expertise of our instructor, who has triumphed in numerous expeditions and provided medical aid in the most austere settings. Under their guidance, you'll become adept in essential techniques like wound care, improvised splinting, and assessing life-threatening conditions far from conventional medical facilities.
Whether you're a novice or an experienced adventurer, our course fosters a supportive learning environment that encourages active participation and knowledge retention. Open to outdoor enthusiasts, adventure seekers, and medical professionals seeking to expand their expertise, this Udemy Expedition and Wilderness Medicine course will empower you to confidently safeguard lives and embrace the wild.
On successful completion certificate will be provided. Salient features are :


Emergency Response in the Wilderness: Learn the essential techniques for effectively responding to medical emergencies in remote and challenging environments.
Injury Management: Acquire skills in managing various types of injuries commonly encountered in the wilderness, including fractures, sprains, and cuts.
Wilderness First Aid: Explore the principles and practices of providing first aid in situations where conventional medical assistance may be unavailable.
Environmental Hazards: Understand and mitigate potential environmental hazards, ensuring safety and well-being in the wild.
Wound Care Techniques: Master the art of proper wound care, including cleaning, dressing, and preventing infections in austere settings.
Improvised Splinting: Gain proficiency in creating improvised splints, a crucial skill for stabilizing injuries when conventional medical resources are not readily accessible.
Enroll today and unlock a world of exciting possibilities!
Video Creator Tool Used For All Videos: CapCut

Outdoor enthusiasts
Military personnel

courses.title: Basic Home First Aid (BHFA) E-Learning
courses.bio: Learn to assist people who are injured in the event of an emergency situation or accident at home.
objectives: How to perform CPR (according to the latest guidelines)
How to confidently use an AED (automated external defibrillator)
How to save people from choking using the Heimlich Maneuver
How to treat a bleeding casualty with minor and major wounds

Module 01: M01 T04 Principle of CPR - DR CAB
Module 2: M02 T03 Foreign Body Airway Obstruction (Choking)
M02 T04 Choking Adult & Obese/Pregnant - Demonstration
M02 T05 Choking Children & Infant - Demonstration

requirements: No medical experience needed. You will learn everything you need to know.
courses.description:
Do you know what to do if someone suddenly collapsed in front of you?
Do you know what to do if someone is choking?
Do you know how to deal with bleeding cuts & wounds?
Think about the wide range of emergencies that may occur in the comfort of your own home or in the workplace – and think how you would feel if it were your child, partner, parent or a co-worker.
This is why it is very important for as many people as possible to have at least a basic knowledge of First Aid, CPR & AED because you may just end up saving a life.


This program educates laypersons, family members & community on how to call for EMS (Ambulance service) during an emergency and understand the importance of CPR to increase the survival rate of the patient. This program will also educate the participants on the importance & usage of Automated External Defibrillator (AED) in the workplace. Foreign Body Airway Obstruction is a common cause of sudden death. They will be taught how to dislodge choking objects by using the Heimlich maneuver.


With this course you will be able to learn at your own pace, investing your time whenever you feel comfortable.
If you are interested in certification, contact us at CERT Academy's website or on Whatsapp +6010-4082117.
target_audience: This course is suitable for anyone who is interested in learning first aid.
Nursing home employees, daycare staff, lifeguards, flight attendants, construction jobs and teachers.

courses.title: Premiers secours et médecine d'urgence : sauver une vie
courses.bio: Formation par un étudiant en santé de la Faculté Paris Diderot
objectives: Apprendre les gestes qui peuvent sauver une vie
Savoir pourquoi vous faites ces gestes
Savoir diagnostiquer les signes de gravités d'une situation d'urgence et les communiquer

MODULE 2: Le malaise sans signes de gravité
Exemple concret de questions si un personne présente des vertiges
MODULE 3: Mise en scène chez le nourisson
MODULE 4: L'obstruction totale chez l'enfant et le nourrisson
Mise en scène : obstruction totale chez l'adulte
Mise en scène : obstruction totale chez le nourrisson

requirements: Aucune
courses.description:
Je me présente, Valentin étudiant en santé à la Faculté Paris VII Diderot.
A travers cette formation vous allez apprendre à reconnaître les situations d'urgences et comment vous devez réagir fasse à celle ci ainsi que savoir diagnostiquer les signes de gravités.


Vous n'allez pas uniquement apprendre à réaliser les gestes mais surtout comprendre pourquoi vous les faites car c'est en comprenant ce que l'on fait que l'on retient mieux !


Que ce soit pour vos proches, à votre travail ou même savoir réagir dans un lieu public les gestes d'urgences et de premiers secours permettent chaque années de sauver des vies et évitent des drames.


Dans cette formation vous allez voir les différents malaises, l'arrêt cardiaque (adulte, enfant et nourrisson ), l'obstruction des voies aériennes (étouffement) , l'AVC, les convulsions, les hémorragies et les brûlures


Par conscience professionnelle je vous incite vivement, en plus de cette formation, à suivre une formation en direct avec un formateur sur place qui pourra vous corriger en TEMPS RÉEL
On se retrouve sur la formation, belle journée à vous
Valentin
target_audience: Toute personne souhaitant maîtriser et comprendre les gestes d'urgences

courses.title: Urban Survival - Volume 1
courses.bio: How to Survive Urban Disaster Events - Volume 1
objectives: After competing this course you will have a clear and common sense understanding of how to prepare yourself, your family and community for any large scale disaster event in the future.
This course focuses on common sense, real world proven skills and knowledge that account for the reality of duress, stress and confusion in real survival situations.

Introduction to Urban Survival - How to: What Risks and Threats Do We Realistically Face?
The Vulnerability of Urban Space & Supply Chain
Supply and Demand Pressures in Emergencies
How to Build Your Own Urban Survival Sys: Keeping Your Head When the World Goes Crazy
Survival-In-Depth a Framework for the System
Managing Fight or Flight (Acute Stress Response)
D.A.B.D.A - Hidden Software You Need to Understand
The Power of the Group in Survival Situations
The Layers of Urban Survival Life Suppor: Life Support Requirements in Urban Survival
Protection/Shelter in Urban Survival Sit: Introduction to Protection Measures in the Urban Space
Survival Food & Nutrition Considerations: What Food Do We Really Need?

requirements: There are no pre-requisites for this course
courses.description:
“May you live in interesting times!” ~ Without question humanity is certainly doing that and we as a species are potentially facing major challenges just around the corner. Such challenges may affect cities, regions, countries, or even the entire global community and may take the form of man made or natural disaster events or both. Things are happening so be as prepared as you possibly can be, as an individual, a family and as a community.
This course takes you step by step through what you need to do to ensure your as prepared as you can be for any disruption to the normal supply chain that every urban space depends completely upon everyday. It teaches you how to think to survive, how to manage your intrinsic acute stress (fight/flight) response. What to prepare and why. The course focuses on ensuring that you understand what life support measures you need to address in a collapsed urban space. It shows you what you need to do to keep your family safe!
No matter your level of experience in preparedness and urban survival, this course will assist you to begin preparing or enhance your current level of readiness. Employing a simple, practical and common sense approach to the complexity of disasters of all natures in the urban situation, this course will bolster your chances of getting out alive. Real world experience of conflict zones, disaster events and survival have informed what is included in the curriculum of this course. This is not just a collection of useful tips, tricks and hacks for urban survival - It is a no nonsense, straight forward and complete urban survival system.
“Prepare for the worst – hope for the best”.
target_audience: Anyone who wishes to learn how to better prepare themselves, loved ones and communities to be more resilience in any future large scale disaster situation. The course will also provide a rounded system of survival in the Urban space that will enhance any level of preparedness measures you currently undertake.

courses.title: Health And Safety Essentials: Everything You Need To Know
courses.bio: Gain Confidence, Stay Compliant And Contribute To A Safer, More Responsible Workplace
objectives: Understand health and safety legislation.
Conduct risk assessments and hazard identification.
Implement safe working practices and procedures.
Utilise Personal Protective Equipment and understand its use.
Highlight emergency procedures and first aid.
Promote a culture of health and safety.

Health And Safety: Introduction To Healt: Personal Protective Equipment And Its Use
Promoting A Culture Of Health And Safety

requirements: No specific requirements.
courses.description:
Are you responsible for ensuring health and safety compliance in your organisation? Do you need to conduct risk assessments to protect your employees and reduce workplace hazards? Are you tasked with implementing safer working practices and improving safety standards? If you answered yes to any of these, this course is for you!
Health and safety practices have been a core foundation for establishing compliance and safe Standard Operating Procedures or SOPs across industries. Employee wellbeing is not just a requirement but a prerequisite for boosting morale and productivity. In a 2022 study, it was found that companies with effective work safety policies can reduce workplace injuries by as much as 40%, thereby improving employee morale and productivity. This statistic highlights that employer policies that protect employee wellbeing are more likely to boost morale and keep employees productive over the long term. Indeed, when employees feel safe and secure at the workplace, they not only feel valued but can also do better work without the fear of getting injured. This type of security helps employees engage more at work and enables employees to develop a sense of loyalty and camaraderie within the organisation. This course is specifically designed to teach business leaders about the benefits of understanding the importance of health and safety and how it can positively affect the organisation.
Over a series of short, engaging video lectures, you'll be guided through the essential principles of workplace health and safety, equipping you with the knowledge and confidence to work safely, responsibly and in compliance with legal requirements. We'll start by exploring the key aspects of UK health and safety legislation, including the Health and Safety at Work Act, your legal rights and responsibilities and the duties of your employer to provide a safe working environment. You'll gain an understanding of how regulations such as COSHH, RIDDOR and the Management of Health and Safety at Work Regulations apply in real workplace scenarios. You'll then move on to hazard identification and risk assessment, learning how to spot common risks in different work environments, evaluate their severity and likelihood and document appropriate control measures. Practical examples will show you how to apply the principles of risk management to your specific role. As part of building your practical skills, you'll explore how to implement and follow safe working practices and procedures, such as maintaining a tidy workspace, using equipment correctly, managing manual handling tasks and following safe systems of work.
You’ll also be introduced to industry-specific procedures where relevant. You'll gain a thorough understanding of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE), including how to choose the right equipment for different tasks, how to inspect and maintain it and when and how to use it effectively to reduce risk and ensure compliance. The course also covers emergency preparedness and response, helping you recognise different types of workplace emergencies such as fire, chemical spills, or injuries and how to react appropriately. You'll learn about raising alarms, evacuation procedures and the basics of first aid, including how to assist until professional help arrives. Finally, we'll explore how you can actively promote a culture of health and safety in your workplace. From reporting near misses and encouraging safe behaviour, to participating in safety briefings and supporting colleagues, you’ll see how every employee plays a vital role in creating a safer, healthier work environment for all.
By the end of this course, you will be able to understand and apply key legislation, assess risks, follow safe systems of work, use PPE effectively, respond appropriately to incidents and contribute to a safer, more aware working environment. Enrol now to learn more!
target_audience: Employees seeking to understand their rights, responsibilities and the necessary actions to ensure their own and others' safety at work.
Managers looking to learn how to lead health and safety initiatives, enforce compliance and foster a safety-conscious workplace culture.
Supervisors who want to gain the skills to monitor safety practices, ensure team compliance with safety standards.
Health and safety officers looking to deepen their understanding of risk assessments and safety policies.
Employers who want to learn their legal obligations, how to create a safe work environment and support a strong safety culture.

courses.title: Certified Hygiene & Safety for Food Workers: +8 Hour Course
courses.bio: Essential Hygiene and Occupational Health & Safety for Food Service Workers: Certified +8 Hours Course
objectives: In this comprehensive course, students will gain essential knowledge and practical skills in hygiene and occupational health & safety,
specifically tailored for workplaces and food service environments. By the end of the course, you will be able to:
Learn the fundamental principles of hygiene, including regulations and cultural aspects, to ensure a clean and safe work environment.
Acquire detailed knowledge on disinfection methods, including the selection and application of disinfectants, to prevent contamination and ensure effective it.
Understand the classification, roles, and impact of microorganisms, and learn strategies for controlling and managing them to safeguard human health.
Learn how to prevent foodborne illnesses, produce healthy food, and maintain high standards of food hygiene in various food service settings.
Understand the importance of personal hygiene, proper use of protective equipment, maintaining cleanliness in clothing and hands to prevent cross-contamination
Visualize and practice hygiene protocols through engaging animations, including food industry mistakes and kitchen safety scenarios.
Learn about physical, chemical, and ergonomic safety, psychosocial risks, fire safety, and emergency preparedness to create a safe and healthy workplace.
Review key concepts and reinforce your knowledge with targeted revision sessions to ensure retention and practical application of the material.

Hygiene: Cultural and Social Aspects of Hygiene
Microorganisms: Environmental and Ecological Roles of Microorganisms
Impact of Microorganisms on Human Health
Food: What should We Do to Produce Healthy Food
Hygiene Animations with its Applications: Animation of Avoiding Mistakes in the Food Industry
Kitchen Safety Preventing Food Poisoning from Chicken and Fish Animation

requirements: No Prior Knowledge Required: This course is designed for individuals at all levels, including beginners. There are no specific prerequisites for enrolling in this course.
Basic Computer Skills: Familiarity with basic computer operations and internet usage is required to navigate the online course platform and access course materials.
Interest in Hygiene and Safety: A genuine interest in learning about hygiene, food safety, and occupational health & safety will help you gain the most from this course.
Access to a Computer or Mobile Device: A computer or mobile device with internet access is needed to view the course content, complete assignments, and participate in discussions.
Willingness to Engage and Apply Knowledge: Active participation in course activities and practical applications of the learned concepts are encouraged to maximize your learning experience.
courses.description:
Are you looking to enhance your understanding of hygiene and safety in the food service industry? This comprehensive course, "Essential Hygiene and Occupational Health & Safety for Food Service Workers: Certified +8 Hours Course," is designed to equip you with the essential skills and knowledge to ensure a clean, safe, and compliant work environment.
Over the course of more than 8 hours of engaging content, you will explore:
Hygiene Fundamentals: Gain a thorough understanding of hygiene regulations, principles, and practices, including the cultural and social aspects that impact hygiene standards.
Effective Disinfection Techniques: Learn about various disinfection methods, how to select and use disinfectants, and the importance of maintaining high disinfection standards.
Microorganisms and Their Impact: Discover the classification of microorganisms, their roles in the environment, and how they affect human health. Learn strategies for controlling and managing microorganisms.
Food Safety Practices: Understand how to prevent foodborne illnesses, produce safe and healthy food, and apply food hygiene best practices in a food service setting.
Personnel Hygiene and Safety: Explore the importance of personal hygiene, the use of protective equipment, hand hygiene, and maintaining a hygienic work environment.
Practical Hygiene Animations: Visualize key hygiene concepts through interactive animations, including common mistakes and kitchen safety protocols.
Occupational Health and Safety: Learn about physical and chemical safety, ergonomics, psychosocial risks, fire safety, and emergency preparedness to ensure a safe workplace.
Upon completion, you will receive a certificate demonstrating your commitment to maintaining high hygiene and safety standards. This course is perfect for food industry professionals, business owners, health and safety officers, and anyone interested in creating a safer, healthier work environment.
Join us to become a certified expert in hygiene and safety, and make a significant impact in your workplace!
target_audience: Food Industry Professionals: Chefs, kitchen staff, and food service workers who want to enhance their knowledge and skills in maintaining food safety and hygiene standards.
Business Owners and Managers: Owners and managers of restaurants, cafes, and food-related businesses seeking to implement effective hygiene practices and ensure compliance with health regulations.
Health and Safety Officers: Individuals responsible for overseeing hygiene and safety protocols in various workplaces, especially in the food service sector.
Aspiring Hygiene Specialists: Those interested in pursuing a career in hygiene and occupational health & safety, or looking to deepen their understanding of these fields.
Current and Future Employees in Food Service: Anyone entering or currently working in the food industry who wants to ensure they follow best practices for hygiene and safety.
Anyone Interested in Occupational Health & Safety: Individuals looking to learn about maintaining a safe and hygienic work environment, applicable to various industries beyond food services.
If you are passionate about improving hygiene practices and ensuring a safe, compliant work environment, this course is for you!

courses.title: ISO 45001 Occupational health and safety management system
courses.bio: ISO 45001 occupational health and safety management systems
objectives: At the end of this course, students should be able to:
Identify workplace hazards
Carry out preventive actions against OHS hazards
Carry our risk assessment
Respond safely to Fire outbreak
Carry out accident investigation
Give Cardio Pulmonary Resuscitation first aid to accident victims
certification in this course is proof of haven undergone an OHS training and as such, students should be able to demonstrate competence
Necessary OHS resources will be supplied here to help students achieve their goals

PLAN: OHS Key stakeholders and Role players

requirements: Basic familiarity with the workplace environment and work actictivities.
Ability to understand charts and figures
A Throw pillow to demonstrate Cardio Pulmonary Resuscitation first aid process
courses.description:
ISO45001 occupational health and safety management systems explains the processes, strategies involved in achieving a safe workplace by eliminating and managing workplace related hazards.According to International Labour Organisation (ILO), about 2.78 million people die a year as a result of occupational illhealth and injuries. There is also increasing absenteeism and insurance premiums.
ISO45001 is the first global standard on occupational health and safety, published by the International organisation for standardisation (ISO). It has been designed to be used by organisations irrespective of their sizes.
The foundation of this standard follows the Shewhart Deming pdca cycle, i.e PLAN, DO, CHECK,ACT. This will guide the rubrics to this course as we will touch risk assessment, accident investigation, first aid, fire management.
target_audience: Workers from all sectors, especially ones from Aviation, Construction, Oil and gas, Energy and power sectors. This course will help them in dealing with their inherent occupational hazards in their different fields

Graduates who are preparing to join the workforce are encouraged to take this course as this training will add to their wealth of knowledge of OHS and give them upper hand among their peers in the labour market
Undergraduates can also take this course. This course will expose them to OHS management in the working environment and prepare them for future challenges related to OHS
Any other individuals who are interested in the knowledge of OHS can take this course

This course will teach you the responsibilities of the mandated reporter for child abuse. If you work with or around children, or your occupation is listed under state law as being a mandated reporter, this course is necessary.
This course will teach you what a mandated reporter is. You will learn how to identify the different types of child abuse and spot their indicators. We will teach you the responsibilities of the mandated reporter, including how to report child abuse, as well as the legal ramifications of failing to perform mandated reporter duties.
