courses.title: Trauma Certified Registered Nurse (TCRN) Certification
courses.bio: Expertise in Trauma Care: Validating Specialized Knowledge and Skills through TCRN Certification
courses.description:
Trauma Certified Registered Nurse (TCRN) Certification
The Trauma Certified Registered Nurse (TCRN) Certification is a specialized credential that validates the knowledge and skills of nurses who work in trauma care settings. The TCRN certification is offered by the Board of Certification for Emergency Nursing (BCEN) and is recognized as the benchmark for expertise in trauma care nursing.
The TCRN certification exam covers a broad range of topics, including trauma prevention, assessment, intervention, and management. Nurses who earn the TCRN certification demonstrate advanced knowledge in the care of patients with traumatic injuries, including those with multiple injuries and complex medical conditions.
To be eligible for the TCRN certification, nurses must have a current RN license, a minimum of two years of experience in trauma nursing, and at least 1,000 hours of clinical practice in trauma care. Once certified, TCRN nurses must maintain their credential by completing continuing education and meeting recertification requirements every four years.
The TCRN certification is highly regarded by employers in trauma care settings, and it can lead to career advancement opportunities and higher salaries. Additionally, it allows nurses to demonstrate their commitment to providing high-quality care to patients with traumatic injuries.

In this course:
The practice test for the Trauma Certified Registered Nurse (TCRN) Certification is a valuable tool for nurses who are preparing to take the TCRN certification exam. The practice test is designed to simulate the actual exam and provide students with an opportunity to evaluate their knowledge and identify areas where they may need to focus their study efforts.
The TCRN practice test covers the same content areas as the certification exam, including trauma prevention, assessment, intervention, and management. It consists of multiple-choice questions that are written and reviewed by experts in the field of trauma care nursing.
Taking the TCRN practice test allows nurses to become familiar with the format and structure of the certification exam. It also provides an opportunity to practice test-taking skills, such as time management and answering multiple-choice questions.
After completing the practice test, nurses will get to know their performance, including a breakdown of their scores by content area. This information can be used to guide further study and help ensure success on the actual certification exam.
The TCRN practice test is an excellent resource for nurses who want to feel more confident and prepared when taking the certification exam. It is available online and can be accessed from anywhere at any time, making it a convenient and flexible option for busy healthcare professionals.
target_audience: For registered nurses who are interested in specializing in the care of patients with traumatic injuries.
For nurses who work in emergency departments, intensive care units, trauma centers, or other healthcare settings where trauma care is a significant component of the patient population.
For nurses who take the TCRN Certification course may have varying levels of experience in trauma care nursing.

For nurses who are committed to providing high-quality care to patients with traumatic injuries and who are interested in advancing their knowledge and skills in this important area of nursing practice.

courses.description:
Course Title: Introduction to Electrocardiography (ECG)
Course Overview: The Introduction to Electrocardiography (ECG) course provides comprehensive training on the fundamentals of ECG interpretation. Designed for healthcare professionals, medical students, and anyone interested in cardiology, this course covers the basic principles of ECG, including understanding waveforms, lead placement, recognizing normal and abnormal rhythms, and interpreting clinical significance.
Course Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will be able to:
Understand the basic anatomy and physiology of the heart as it relates to the ECG.
Identify and describe the components of an ECG waveform.
Properly place ECG leads and understand the significance of different lead positions.
Recognize normal sinus rhythm and differentiate it from common abnormal rhythms.
Calculate heart rate and interpret rhythm regularity using ECG strips.
Understand the clinical implications of various ECG findings, including myocardial infarction and ischemia.
Target Audience:
Medical students
Nurses
Paramedics and emergency medical technicians (EMTs)
Physician assistants
Junior doctors and residents
Other healthcare professionals involved in cardiac care
Course Outline:
Module 1: Introduction to ECG
Overview of electrocardiography
Importance and clinical applications
Basic cardiac anatomy and physiology
Module 2: Understanding the ECG Waveform
The P wave: atrial depolarization
The QRS complex: ventricular depolarization
Q wave
R wave
S wave
The T wave: ventricular repolarization
The PR interval, QT interval, and ST segment
Module 3: ECG Lead Placement
Standard 12-lead ECG
Limb leads: I, II, III, aVR, aVL, aVF
Precordial leads: V1, V2, V3, V4, V5, V6
Correct placement techniques
Significance of different leads
Module 4: Normal Sinus Rhythm
Characteristics of normal sinus rhythm
ECG strip interpretation
Identifying normal intervals and segments
Module 5: Recognizing Abnormal Rhythms
Atrial fibrillation
Ventricular tachycardia
ST elevation and myocardial infarction
ST depression and ischemia
Other common arrhythmias
Module 6: Rate and Rhythm Calculation
Methods to calculate heart rate (300, 150, 100, 75, 60, 50 method)
Identifying regular and irregular rhythms
Practical exercises with ECG strips
Module 7: Clinical Implications and Case Studies
Interpreting clinical significance of ECG findings
Case studies and real-world scenarios
Management and treatment implications
Learning Materials:
Lecture slides and handouts
Example ECG strips
Interactive quizzes and exercises
Case study discussions
Video tutorials on lead placement and ECG interpretation
Assessment and Certification:
Quizzes and practical assessments throughout the course
Final exam covering theoretical and practical aspects of ECG interpretation
Certificate of completion for participants who pass the final exam
Duration: 6-8 weeks (can be adjusted based on course format and participant needs)
Mode of Delivery:
In-person classes
Online modules with video lectures and interactive content
Hybrid (combination of in-person and online learning)
Instructor:
Experienced cardiologist or ECG technician with expertise in electrocardiography
Guest lectures from specialists in cardiology and emergency medicine
Enrollment Information:
Prerequisites: Basic understanding of human anatomy and physiology recommended
Registration process and fees
Contact information for further inquiries
This course will equip participants with the essential skills and knowledge to confidently interpret ECGs, enhancing their clinical practice and improving patient care outcomes.

requirements: Trainees should complete a Crane & Hoist training course prior to taking this course
courses.description:
Welcome to our comprehensive online course titled, "OSHA Rigging Signal Certification - Fully Online."
In this course, we provide training on rigging, signaling, and signal communications in crane and hoist operations, which is designed to meet certification requirements under OSHA guidelines. Our course provides essential knowledge and skills for safe and efficient crane and hoist operations, crucial for workers in various industries.
This course will cover several primary topics, including:
The basics of signaling protocols in crane and hoist operations.
The importance of establishing and becoming familiar with communication methods in advance of any operation, particularly between the crane signaler, the crane operator, and the lift director, if applicable.
How to utilize hand, radio, and verbal signaling in crane and hoist operations.
Becoming familiar with the 19 primary hand signals used in the Standard Method of Hand Signaling.
The importance of proper rigging gear and knots and how damaged rigging can reduce the effectiveness and safety of moving loads in crane and hoist operations.
Upon completion of the online training, participants will undertake two quizzes—one on signaling protocols and the other on performing proper hand signals. This will be followed by instructions on how to schedule a video call with our course operator experts to perform a final virtual performance evaluation, which is required for certification under OSHA guidelines.
We are a successful risk management and safety firm with decades of experience working with various industries that utilize crane and hoist equipment within their operations. Our curriculum has been meticulously crafted by our in-house experts, drawing from real-world experience in job-site safety to provide practical, relevant, and OSHA-compliant training.
Join us to elevate your skills and ensure safety in crane and hoist operations today!
target_audience: Workers on job sites utilizing crane and hoist equipment
Crane signalers, crane operators, lift directors, or any other occupation in which you work directly within a crane and hoist operation

courses.title: Practice Tests | VHF Marine Radio Course
courses.bio: Test your knowledge about effective marine radio communication at sea to obtain your radio operators certificate.
courses.description:
Do you love kayaking, yachting, or powerboating and want to get ready to get on the water safely?
One of the most useful safety tools while being on the water is a VHF radio.
To operate a VHF or Single Side Band radio, you must have an ROC-M certificate (Restricted Operator’s Certificate – Maritime) – it’s the law.


NOTE: This course should not be your only study material to prepare for the official exam. These practice tests are meant to supplement topic study material.


This course tests your ROC-M knowledge covering:
Maritime radio systems
Emergency radio procedures
Every day maritime radio operating techniques
Advanced maritime radio operations and applications
Channel frequencies
Phonetic alphabet
Procedural words and phrases
Digital Selective Calling (DSC)
Global Maritime Distress and Safety System (GMDSS)


The ROC-M certificate with DSC Endorsement certifies the student to operate VHF and MF/HF (single side band) radios and is valid for life.
This course is based on the Maritime Radio Course book as a supplement to the authorized courses.
Please note: You do NOT need a radio in order to take the exam. We actually recommend holding off buying a radio (if you don’t already have one) until after the course as you will have a better sense of what radio is right for you.
The Coast Guard encourages boaters to use a VHF-FM radio as their primary means of distress calling. VHF is superior to cell phones in reaching help for boating emergencies. When a Mayday is sent out via a VHF radio it is a broadcast to Coast Guard radio stations as well as any VHF-equipped boat within listening range. Nearby boaters can often offer immediate assistance long before a Coast Guard vessel or towing service can arrive.
If there is any chance you may enter U.S. waters, you should have a ship station licence. International regulations state that without a reciprocal agreement between countries, you must have a licence from your home country when venturing outside of your home waters.
target_audience: Persons interested in operate a VHF or Single Side Band radio

courses.title: Suchthilfe und Suchtbegleitung

objectives: Die ersten Schritte bei einer Sucht

Einleitung: Video 3 Die Voraussetzung für eine Kommunikation
Video 8 Der richtige Umgang mit Geld
Video 10 Der größte Fehler mit einen Konsumenten

requirements: nein
courses.description:
Ich war selbst sehr lange in der Sucht gefangen und ich habe mich und mein Umfeld mit meiner Sucht zerstört. Heute helfe ich Menschen aus der Sucht und zeige den Eltern und Angehörigen die richtige Suchtbegleitung. Wissen aus über 14 Jahren Sucht und einer Cleanzeit von 8 Jahren erwarten Dich im Kurs.

In diesem Kurs will ich mit Dir mehrere Punkte durchgehen:


Du wirst lernen:
Die möglichen Ursachen einer Sucht
Den ersten Schritt um nicht an der Sucht zu zerbrechen
Wie Du es schaffst und was Du beachten musst um eine Kommunikation aufzubauen
Die Voraussetzung um eine Kommunikation mit dem Konsumenten zu erreichen
Wie Du mit Gewalt, Ängsten und Respekt im Haus umgehst und Regeln erschaffst
Wie Du mit den Finanzen bei einer Sucht richtig umgehst und die Sucht nicht förderst
Wie Du in 4 bis 6 Wochen eine Kommunikation und regelmäßige Gespräche aufbaust
Die besten Abschreckmethoden um ein weiteres versinken in die Sucht zu verhindern
Die zwei größten Fehler bei der Sucht


Bonusvideo für den Konsumenten
Bonusvideo mit weiteren Bonis und Infos
Hast Du vielleicht Sorgen und Ängste
Dein Kind oder eine geliebte Person ganz an die Drogen oder an die Sucht zu verlieren?
Kennst Du diesen Schmerz im Herz, dass Du es nicht mehr mitansehen und ertragen kannst, wie sich Dein Kind weiter und täglich zerstört?
Wirst Du tagtäglich aufs neue enttäuscht, weil Du auf eine Besserung hoffst, aber dann erkennst Du wieder die Lügen?
Verlierst Du von Tag zu Tag mehr die Hoffnung und den Glauben, in Dich und in Dein Kind?
Ich kenne das Gefühl, aber von der anderen Seite. Über 14 Jahre war ich in der Sucht gefangen und habe in all dieser Zeit meinem Umfeld großes Leid zugefügt. Ich kenne die Sucht von der anderen Seite und das all zu gut.
Möchtest Du erfahren welche Schritte Du gehen musst um die richtige Suchtbegleitung zu gewährleisten?
Dann schau Dir jetzt den Kurs an
Im Training erfährst Du u.a.:
Wie Du es schaffst und was Du beachten musst um eine Kommunikation aufzubauen
Die Voraussetzung um eine Kommunikation mit dem Konsumenten zu erreichen
Wie Du mit Gewalt, Ängsten und Respekt im Haus umgehst und Regeln erschaffst
Wie Du mit den Finanzen bei einer Sucht richtig umgehst und die Sucht nicht förderst
Wie Du in 4 bis 6 Wochen eine Kommunikation und regelmäßige Gespräche aufbaust
Die zwei größten Fehler bei der Sucht
Ein weiteres Bonusvideo mit zusätzlichen Bonis und einem Geschenk!
Im kurzem zusammengefasst, eine einfache, klare, praxiserprobte und leicht umsetzbare Strategie, um Dein Kind bei der Sucht richtig zu begleiten und aus der Sucht zu befreien.
target_audience: Freunde und Bekannte von Personen die in einer Sucht feststecken

objectives: Understand the essential role WHMIS plays in protecting the health and safety of Canadian workers.

requirements: No prerequisites for this course. - A computer with internet.
courses.description:
This training course on WHMIS 2015 is designed to cover both the new Globally Harmonized System of Classification and Labelling for chemicals (GHS) introduced in 2015 and the content from the previous version, WHMIS 1988. It is composed of three chapters and a final exam, and is fully narrated. Participants can pause or resume the training at any time to suit their convenience.
In accordance with Canadian law, it is mandatory for individuals exposed to hazardous materials in the workplace to receive training in Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS). This comprehensive WHMIS 2015 course not only covers the new Globally Harmonized System of Classification and Labelling for chemicals (GHS) that was introduced in 2015, but also includes content from the previous WHMIS system (WHMIS 1988). The course comprises of three main chapters and a final exam, and upon passing the exam, participants can obtain their certificates of completion.
The training is fully narrated and can be paused or resumed at any time. Alternative training methods such as book-based distance learning and classroom training are also available.
This online training program is intended to be completed entirely online. However, depending on the duties or workplace hazards, supplementary training for specific hazardous materials, Safety Data Sheets, workplace labeling practices, or other additional considerations may be necessary.
target_audience: This course is suitable for anyone working in the industrial field or have been and need a WHMIS safety refresher.

courses.title: Excavation Safety Practice Test
courses.bio: Excavation Safety, Hazard Prevention
courses.description:
This comprehensive practice test is meticulously designed to assess and enhance your knowledge of excavation safety, a critical aspect of construction and engineering projects. Excavation work presents numerous hazards and risks, making safety a paramount concern. This test covers essential topics such as hazard identification, protective measures, regulatory compliance, and emergency response, ensuring a well-rounded understanding of excavation safety protocols.


The practice test is divided into two parts: the first part features multiple-choice questions, while the second part consists of true/false questions. This structure allows for a thorough evaluation of your knowledge from different angles, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of the subject matter.


Excavation safety is a crucial subject for a wide range of professionals, including construction workers, site supervisors, safety officers, and safety professionals. It is also valuable for beginners who are new to excavation work and need to learn the fundamentals of safe practices. By taking this practice test, learners will be able to reinforce their understanding of critical safety measures, improve their ability to recognize and mitigate risks, and ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations.


The multiple-choice section of the practice test includes questions that cover key aspects of excavation safety. These questions are designed to test your knowledge of important safety concepts and procedures. For instance, you will learn about the importance of properly sloped walls to prevent cave-ins, the necessity of daily inspections by a competent person, and the critical role of personal protective equipment (PPE) in maintaining a safe work environment.


The true/false section of the practice test covers fundamental aspects of excavation safety, ensuring that learners understand the critical safety measures and regulations. This part will help you quickly assess your grasp of essential concepts, such as the proper response to hazardous atmospheres, the importance of competent person inspections, and the necessity of protective systems in various soil types.


Overall, this comprehensive practice test is an invaluable tool for anyone involved in excavation work. Whether you are a seasoned professional looking to refresh your knowledge or a beginner seeking to learn the basics, this test will help you achieve your goals. By the end of the test, you will have a deeper understanding of excavation safety, be better prepared to recognize and mitigate hazards, and be equipped to ensure compliance with safety regulations. Prepare to improve workplace safety and prevent accidents with this detailed and informative excavation safety practice test.
target_audience: This course is ideal for construction workers, site supervisors, safety officers, and anyone involved in excavation activities.
It is also valuable for safety professionals seeking to enhance their knowledge of excavation safety, as well as beginners who want to learn about safe excavation practices.
Whether you're looking to improve workplace safety, comply with regulations, or gain new skills, this course provides the essential knowledge you need.

courses.description:
Course Overview:


This course is designed to provide participants with a clear and comprehensive understanding of the ISO 45001:2018 Occupational Health and Safety Management System (OH&S MS) standard. Through a combination of theoretical knowledge and practical examples, participants will learn about the history, key benefits, and requirements of ISO 45001, enabling them to effectively implement and manage an OH&S MS within their organizations.


Course Objectives:


Upon completion of this course, participants will be able to:


• Understand the history and evolution of ISO 45001.
• Identify the key benefits and aims of implementing ISO 45001.
• Recognize the success factors for implementing an ISO 45001 management system.
• Define an Occupational Health and Safety Management System (OH&S MS).
• Explain the Annex SL structure and its application to ISO 45001.
• Understand the Plan-Do-Check-Act (PDCA) cycle and its role in OH&S management.
• Navigate the ISO 45001 standard clause by clause.
• Identify the documents required for ISO 45001 compliance.
• Understand the key changes from OHSAS 18001 to ISO 45001.
• Explore the paths for certification of an organization.




Course Content:
• Introduction
• History From OSHA 18001 to ISO 45001
• Key benefits and aims of ISO 45001
• Success Factor of implementing and ISO 45001 management system
• What is an Occupational Health and Safety Management System (OH&S MS)?
• Annex SL
• PLAN, DO, CHECK, ACT (PDCA) cycle
• ISO 45001 (OSH management system) clause by clause:
• 8:1 scope
• 8:2 normative references
• 8:3 terms and definitions
• 8:4 context of the organization
• 8:5 leadership and worker participation
• 8:6 planning
• 8:7 support
• 8:8 operation
• 8:9 performance evaluation
• 8:10 improvement
• Integration with other management systems
• List of documents required by ISO 45001:2018
• Summary of principal changes: Moving from OHSAS 18001:2007 to ISO 45001:2018
• Paths for certification of the organization
• Summary and references




Course Methodology:
This course will employ a variety of instructional methods, including:
• Written information
• Explications
• Photos for explication
• Summary for each part
• Real examples


Target Audience:
This course is suitable for individuals involved in occupational health and safety management, including:
· Safety professionals
· Human resources managers
· Line managers
· Supervisors
· Employees at all levels


By participating in this course, participants will gain the knowledge and skills necessary to implement and maintain an effective ISO 45001 management system within their organizations.


We will explain all these parts in this course, and we will also provide more courses and explanations in the next days done by our training center, SET.

courses.title: Root Cause Analysis (RCA) for Effective Prevention
courses.bio: Turn Every Incident into an Opportunity for Improvement
objectives: Understand the basic concepts of incident investigation and the importance of root cause analysis in improving workplace safety.
Identify and describe the key steps of incident investigation.
Apply root cause analysis techniques to identify underlying causes of incidents and propose corrective actions.
Use effective communication skills to document and report investigation findings clearly and accurately.
Recognize the role of incident investigations in promoting a proactive safety culture and preventing future incidents.

Basics of Investigations and Root Cause: Beyond the Incident- Root Cause Analysis (RCA) for Prevention
Techniques used in root cause analysis
Investigation plan and competence of Investigator(s)
Analyzing the Information: Sorting and categorizing the collected information.
Using analytical tools to find Root Cause.
Root Cause Analysis using 5 WHY technique
Root Cause Analysis using Casual Factor Tree Analysis
Root Cause Analysis using Change Analysis technique
Root Cause Analysis using Swiss Cheese model
Root Cause Analysis using Barrier Analysis
Root Cause Analysis using Fishbone Analysis (Ishikawa Diagram)
Root Cause Analysis using Fault Tree Analysis (FTA)
Root Cause Analysis using Failure Mode Effect Analysis (FMEA)
Carry out FMEA of your computer as it failed to start in the morning
Root Cause Analysis using Bow-Tie Analysis
Analyzing the sequence of events leading to the incident.
Analyze human, organizational, and job factors.
Analyzing the information with RCA techniques
Identifying Risk Control Measures: Hierarchy of controls and apply it to incident prevention.
Identifying appropriate corrective and preventive actions.
Need for both short-term fixes and long-term solutions.
The Action Plan and Its Implementation: Writing clear and concise investigation reports.
Developing clear and structured action plan.
Monitoring and track the progress of the action plan.
Evaluating the effectiveness of implemented actions.
The Action Plan and its Implementation
Case Studies and Practical Applications: Complete the incident investigation report for the sample incident given

requirements: No prior experience or specific knowledge is required.
Basic understanding of workplace safety concepts is helpful but not mandatory.
courses.description:
Unlock the secrets to a safer workplace with our comprehensive course on Incident Investigation and Root Cause Analysis (RCA). Designed for anyone passionate about workplace safety, this course will give you the tools to identify the root causes of incidents, not just the symptoms. You'll gain essential skills in investigating incidents, analyzing data, and preventing future mishaps; thus, creating a proactive safety culture within your organization.
Through clear, practical lessons, you’ll learn how to gather critical information effectively, from securing the scene to conducting interviews and documenting evidence. We’ll walk you through powerful tools, making it easier than ever to uncover the true causes behind accidents and near misses.
The course will teach you how to assess risks and implement corrective actions that address both short-term fixes and long-term solutions. You'll learn how to prioritize actions to mitigate risks, ensuring a safer working environment for everyone. Additionally, you'll gain hands-on experience by creating actionable plans to implement your findings, tracking progress, and ensuring successful outcomes.
To bring the theory to life, the course includes a variety of real-world case studies from different industries. These practical examples will allow you to apply the concepts you've learned to actual incidents, enhancing your ability to think critically and act decisively. By analyzing these case studies, you’ll see firsthand how effective incident investigation and root cause analysis can prevent accidents, improve safety, and foster a culture of continuous improvement. And of course, it will come with a certificate at the end.
target_audience: Individuals working in any industry who want to learn about incident investigation and root cause analysis.
New safety professionals, health and safety officers, and managers.
Employees involved in safety improvement programs or incident reporting systems.
Anyone interested in improving workplace safety practices and learning the fundamentals of incident investigation.

requirements: Bu kursu almak için herhangi bir zorunlu ön koşul veya gereksinim yoktur.
courses.description:
Eğitim sonunda sertifikanızı almayı unutmayın. Bakanlık onaylı sertifika hakkında detaylı bilgi için eğitmen ile iletişime geçebilirsiniz.


Bu kapsamlı ilk yardım eğitimi, acil durumlarda etkili ve güvenli müdahalede bulunabilmeniz için gerekli bilgi ve becerileri kazandırmayı amaçlar. Eğitim, temel ilk yardım kavramlarından başlayarak, çeşitli acil durumlar için pratik uygulama yöntemlerine kadar geniş bir yelpazeyi kapsar.
Kursun içeriği şunları içerir:
Temel İlk Yardım Bilgileri: İlk yardımın önemi, acil durumlarda nasıl davranılacağı ve temel ilk yardım teknikleri.
Hayati Müdahaleler: Kardiyopulmoner resüsitasyon (CPR), Heimlich manevrası ve temel yaşam desteği gibi kritik müdahale yöntemleri.
Yaralanma ve Hastalık Yönetimi: Kanamalar, yaralanmalar, kırıklar, yanıklar ve zehirlenmelere yönelik uygulamalı çözümler.
Acil Durum Senaryoları: Gerçek yaşam senaryoları ve bu senaryolara uygun ilk yardım müdahaleleri.
Bilgi ve Pratik: Metin, görseller ve video örnekleri ile desteklenmiş detaylı açıklamalar ve pratik uygulamalar.
Kurs, hem sağlık profesyonelleri hem de genel halk için uygundur ve katılımcılara acil durumlarda etkili bir şekilde müdahale etme yeteneği kazandırır. Eğitimin sonunda, katılımcılar çeşitli acil durumlarla başa çıkma konusunda kendilerine güvenebilir ve hayati önem taşıyan ilk yardım becerilerini uygulama fırsatı bulurlar.


Kurs, acil durumlarda hızlı ve etkili bir şekilde hareket etmenizi sağlayacak bilgi ve becerileri kazandırmak için tasarlanmıştır. Eğitimin sonunda, katılımcılar sertifika alarak öğrendikleri bilgileri onaylayabilirler.


#ilkyardım #sertifika #eğitim #isg
target_audience: Bu kurs, geniş bir kitleye hitap edecek şekilde tasarlanmıştır ve aşağıdaki gruplara yöneliktir:

courses.bio: Shelter, Stone, Bone, Shell and Wooden Tools & Weapons
objectives: This course teaches you to access the wisdom and skill of ancient humans; to meet the base survival requirements, shelter, water, fire, food in a modern day survival emergency that you might tackle without any modern resources or equipment.

Primitive Survival Shelter: No Tool/No Cordage Shelter Construction Part 1
No Tool/No Cordage Shelter Construction Part 2
No Tool/No Cordage Shelter Construction Part 3
No Tool/No Cordage Shelter Construction Part 4
Making Stone Cutting Tools: The Theory of Stone Tool Making
Making Bone Cutting Tools: What Bones to Use for Tool Making
Splitting and Fracturing Bone for Tools
Shaping, Grinding & Abrading Bone into Tools
Making Shell Cutting Tools: Making Shell Tools Basics - Flaking Technique
Making Shell Tools Basics - Grinding Technique

requirements: There are no course prerequisites for this course.
courses.description:
This course is the first in a series of course packages produced by Rich Hungerford, Senior Survival & Tracking Instructor at The Bush Lore Survival School. This course is focused upon the practical application of ancient human ancestor knowledge in low or no technology situations to meet essential life support requirements.
The instructor wishes to make the clear distinction between survival skills that lean on ancestral knowledge and primitive living skills.
Being capable of manufacturing cutting tools, shelter and weapons without the aid of modern steel or iron tools adds another level of survival resilience to the experienced survivalist and brings new understanding to the beginner survival student.
Drawing on his real life experience as an Australian Special Forces Combat Survival Instructor, Rich Hungerford shows you what works, why it works and why you should focus on practical skills if you are training for survival.
target_audience: Beginner survival students through to those engaged in experiment archeology or anthropology.

HERO AWARD
The First Aid Hero Award is designed with the primary school classroom in mind. The award covers all of the statutory guidance for Health Education. There are 5 lessons each with a powerpoint, videos , and a worksheet for each video completed.


1. What is First Aid? What is an emergency and how to stay safe. How to get help.
2. Basic Life support - Recovery Position

The course is designed to be very user friendly. Each lesson has a 15-20 minute video. The videos are very informative and we encourage the students to follow and copy what we do in the video, either at the same time or when the video has ended.


DISCLAIMER:
EMT First Aid and Lifeguard Training provides this video for guidance and it is not in any way a substitute for medical advice. EMT First Aid and Lifeguard Training is not responsible or liable for any diagnosis made, or actions taken based on this video. We strongly recommend that you attend a practical First Aid course to understand what to do in a medical emergency.


Please be aware that the information is correct at the time of filming March 2020 and relates only to UK Resuscitation and First Aid guidelines. If you are outside the UK please refer to your countries guidelines and governing board.

courses.title: Medical Emergencies In a Dental Office
courses.bio: Handling medical emergencies in an office
objectives: Recognize and Identify common medical emergencies
Implement immediate emergency responses
Utilize emergency equipment and medications effectively
Develop and execute an emergency action plan
requirements: Only basic medical knowledge needed
courses.description:
Welcome to "Medical Emergencies in a Dental Office," an essential course designed for dental and medical professionals who seek to enhance their preparedness and confidence in managing medical emergencies. In this course, you'll gain the critical knowledge and practical skills needed to recognize, respond to, and manage a variety of medical emergencies that may arise in a dental setting.
Medical emergencies in offices are rare but potentially life-threatening. This course covers a wide range of emergencies, including syncope, hypoglycemia, allergic reactions, cardiac arrest, seizures, and choking. You will learn to identify the signs and symptoms of each emergency and understand the immediate actions required to stabilize the patient until professional medical help arrives.
Our curriculum includes  instructions on using essential emergency equipment and medications, such as Automated External Defibrillators (AEDs), oxygen tanks, EpiPens, and blood glucose monitors.
In addition to emergency response techniques, this course emphasizes the importance of creating and implementing an effective emergency action plan. You'll discover how to  train your staff through regular drills, and establish efficient communication protocols to ensure a coordinated response during emergencies.
By the end of this course, you'll be better equipped with the knowledge and skills to handle medical emergencies with confidence and competence, ensuring the safety and well-being of your patients.
Enroll now and take the first step towards becoming a more prepared and capable dental professional!
target_audience: Dentists and physicians that have an outpatient office

requirements: This Course is not requiring any level of experience.
courses.description:
The Civilian Trauma Response Course (CTR) goes far beyond first aid. This course is split in two sections. One is based on Tactical Combat Casualty Care (TCCC) procedures used by the Military to save lives during combat. The second section is based on the civilian BLS ( Basic Life Support ). Civilians are usually the first ones on scene in an active shooter incident, terrorist act, natural disaster or everyday accident. The CTR Course is putted together by different experts in emergency and tactical medicine. You should be prepared to make a difference and save a life. This course will have more than 8 Hours of video training materials.
Why is Civilian Trauma Response Training Important?
In the instance of an accident, or worst-case scenario of an active shooter incident, terrorist attack or active threat in the workplace or a school, civilians are the first responders. When seconds count, it is vital to begin aiding the wounded individual(s). During an active shooter incident or active threat, time can especially be strained. First responders will be rushing to the scene. Law enforcement’s first and primary objective is to eliminate the threat, potentially passing over and not treating wounded individuals until the threat has been resolved. This means that you are the true first responder in this active shooter or active threat scenario. Will you be able to treat the injured and help save lives?
Course Curriculum
Introduction to Advanced Tactical Casualty Care


M.A.R.C.H Algorithm
Bleeding management
Hemorrhage Control Concepts
Direct Pressure
Bandaging
Hemorrhage Control Concepts & Skills
Tourniquets

courses.title: Здоровая Аптечка от организатора пространства Миры Марининой
courses.bio: Оздорови домашнюю аптечку. Убери дубли и бардак в лекарствах, сэкономь тысячи рублей при покупке лекарств.

Введение: 4 Планируем шопинг и экономим тысячи рублей на фуфломицинах
Запись вебинара про грамотное расхламление. Выжимка полезности! Не про аптечку.

requirements: наличие домашней аптечки
Русский язык
courses.description:
Купили в аптеке новое лекарство, а потом нашли в аптечке такое же начатое, а может и не одну упаковку?


Простудились и опять оставили в аптеке несколько тысяч рублей по длинному списку лекарств от терапевта?


У ребенка температура 39, ночь, а сколько нужно отмерить жаропонижающего, сможете быстро ответить?
Знакомо?
А хотите за 5 понятных шагов сможете разобрать свое "кладбище недоеденных лекарств"?


Если вы выполните все задания курса,
вы больше никогда не купите лекарство-дубль,
не потеряете нужный препарат в завалах,
нужное лекарство вы и любой ваш домочадец найдёте за 10 секунд!
Бонусом вы узнаете про доказательную медицину и узнаете, что 90% лекарств делают здоровыми только кошельки их продавцов.
Это сэкономит вам при следующей покупке лекарств несколько сотен рублей. А за год до нескольких тысяч!




Программа курса состоит из 5 уроков:
1. Лечебное расхламление аптечки. Утилизируем лекарства правильно.
2. Кладбище недоеденных лекарств. Оптимизируем список своих лекарств.
3. Всему свое место. В отм числе и аптечке. Где что и как хранить.
4. Планируем аптечный шопинг. Знакомимся с доказательной медициной и расстрельным списком препаратов, которые полезны только их производителям.
5. Всё сложится. Подбираем контейнеры. Ориентируемся по списку из 40 позиций из онлайн-магазинов.


Курс останется в вашем вечном доступе, как и знания о системе 5 шагов, которые позволят вам разобрать аптечки у ваших старших родственников. А если вам понравилась подача материала и вы хотите продолжить разбор своего дома, посмотрите остальные курсы организатора пространства Миры Марининой или обратитесь за личной консультацией.
target_audience: все у кого есть домашняя аптечка и часто бывает, что нужное лекарство приходится искать подолгу, из аптеки вы приносите дубли, которые уже есть дома, любая простуда грозит многими тысячами оставленными в аптеке.

courses.description:
Si trabajas en el manejo o transporte de sustancias químicas, es importante que conozcas el Sistema Globalmente Armonizado (SGA) de etiquetado y clasificación de sustancias químicas. Tomar un curso de SGA te permitirá adquirir conocimientos sólidos sobre este sistema, lo que te ayudará a cumplir con las normas y regulaciones internacionales y nacionales de seguridad en el manejo de productos químicos.
Durante el curso, aprenderás sobre las diferentes categorías de peligros químicos y cómo identificarlos, cómo interpretar las etiquetas de productos químicos, y cómo aplicar correctamente los procedimientos de seguridad y manejo adecuados para cada tipo de sustancia. También te enseñarán sobre los cambios recientes en el SGA y cómo mantener tu empresa al día con las últimas regulaciones.
Al finalizar el curso, tendrás una comprensión profunda de cómo aplicar las normas del SGA para etiquetar y clasificar productos químicos de manera adecuada y segura. Además, estarás en una posición sólida para cumplir con las regulaciones y estándares internacionales de seguridad química, lo que te permitirá mejorar la seguridad en tu lugar de trabajo y minimizar los riesgos de accidentes y daños a la salud.
En resumen, si estás buscando mejorar tu conocimiento y habilidades en el manejo seguro de sustancias químicas, te recomiendo encarecidamente que tomes un curso de SGA. ¡No te arrepentirás!
target_audience: Operarios, profesionales, bomberos, estudiantes

courses.title: Elder Care Solutions
courses.bio: Critical Information for Caregivers and Anyone Who Needs a Caregiver
objectives: Get a better understanding of the realities of caring for and being cared for
Know how to prepare for and handle the responsibilities you will face
Learn how to take care of yourself, including your physical, and mental health
Prepare for the future for yourself too
Setup and arrange things better now to avoid all kinds of problems later!

An Introduction to Caregiving: How to Get The Most From This Course
Taking Care of Yourself and Your Family: Physical Injury Considerations and Preventative Measures
Legal Considerations and Related Issues: Difficult but Necessary Critical Conversations to Have NOW
Care Agreement, Responsibilities and Statement of Understanding
Responsibility for Expenses and Payment for Care
Do Not Resuscitate (DNR) - Wishes and Considerations
Final Wishes and Disposition of Remains
Daily Activities of Living, General Care: Amount and Types of Care Needed Varies and Will Increase Over Time
Transportation to and from Medical and Other Appointments
Common Problems and Challenges: Other Family Members, Friends and Others Opinions
Misinformed and Otherwise Incompetent Medical Personnel
Dealing with Denial - Yours and Theirs
Preparing for What Comes After Caregiving Is Over
Emotional Distress and the Heavy Toll You Will Pay and How to Cope
Equipment and Supplies That Can Help: Heavy Duty Grab Bars and Handrails
Home Delivery of Common Items and Supplies
Agencies, Organizations and Resources to: In Home Assistance and Care Providers
Funeral Homes and Related Service Providers
Support Groups and Ways You Too Can Help: Conclusion and Final Thoughts for This Course

requirements: An open mind and something to take notes with.
courses.description:
There is a coming tsunami that few are even aware of - never the less it's already on the way!
As people age, they eventually reach a point where they need help. Some more than others, and many will eventually become entirely dependent on a caregiver for daily survival.
Often when the need for care arises it catches both the person in need of care and the those who will become responsible for providing that care off guard and unprepared.
Most often it is going to be a family member who winds up caring for another family member. It may be a son or daughter taking care of a parent - or a husband or wife taking care of a spouse.  These are typical scenarios that are occurring every day. There are other relationships as well, and in other cases no relationship at all - other than a financial one.
When there is no family member who is willing or able to provide the necessary care then the services of a paid caregiver may be obtained - for a price that is, and hold onto your checkbook because it isn't going to be cheap either! Full time care can cost thousands of dollars per month, and even more.
The harsh reality is that far more people need care than can afford it.
Those who require care and can not afford it are in a very bad position - usually causing an immediate crisis within the family. Someone has to provide the care one way or the other - either by finding the money to pay for it or by actually doing it personally.
The Sooner You and Your Loved Ones Prepare the Better!
Sadly, far too many people don't begin to prepare at all until it becomes an immediate crisis. A heart attack, stroke, fall or other event occurs and the need for care has arrived - ready or not.
It is almost certain that you will either become a caregiver or need a caregiver in the coming years - and most likely both.
While it may be unsettling to consider such possibilities - it will be far better if you do it NOW and are informed and prepared as soon as possible.
The alternative is being forced to react immediately to a crisis that often comes with little to no warning until it is upon you.
That will make a difficult situation almost unbearable - but not if you do something about it before the need arises. If it already has - then the next best thing is to get the information you need right now and to start making intentional and informed decisions immediately.
This course is a good step in the right direction to help you do that.
target_audience: Anyone with an elderly family member or other loved one in need of care
Caregivers and their families

Everyone is WELCOME here. Even if you just somehow stumbled upon this course and have no current situation - do yourself a big favor and take the course anyway now. Later in life you will be glad you did, and it can help quite a lot.

courses.title: Health And Safety: Apply Ergonomics To Prevent Injuries
courses.bio: Reduce Workplace Injuries And Boost Productivity With Practical Ergonomic Strategies
objectives: Understand ergonomics principles and benefits.
Assess and design ergonomic workstations.
Implement posture and movement practices to prevent musculoskeletal disorders.
Use ergonomic tools and technology to enhance comfort and productivity.
Practise injury prevention strategies and workplace safety.
Build an ergonomic program for the entire organisation.

Introduction: Introduction To Ergonomics: Principles And Benefits
Health And Safety: Apply Ergonomics To P: Posture And Movement: Preventing Musculoskeletal Disorders
Ergonomic Tools And Technology: Enhancing Comfort And Productivity
Injury Prevention Strategies And Workplace Safety
Building An Ergonomics Programme: Best Practices And Implementation

requirements: No specific requirements.
courses.description:
Do you want to understand how ergonomic principles play a crucial role in preventing injuries and promoting the long-term health of employees? Are you interested in assessing and designing ergonomic workstations for sustained productivity and performance? Would it be helpful for you to implement posture and movement practices to prevent musculoskeletal disorders for your workforce? If you answered yes to any of these questions, then this course is for you!
The concept of ergonomics has been around for centuries, as evidenced by early chair designs that featured straight backrests and comfortable armrests in ancient Egypt, dating back to around 2,500 BC. When we slouch or sit awkwardly for long periods, it can put stress on our musculoskeletal system and cause pain and even long-term injuries or problems.
According to a 2022 study by US-based wellness platform WellFit Consultancy, effective ergonomics interventions can reduce musculoskeletal problems by 61%. This statistic highlights how ergonomic practices can significantly cut down on long-term health problems in individuals. Even in the office space, ergonomics plays a vital role in long-term productivity, with ergonomic tools reducing fatigue and musculoskeletal problems in employees.
In addition, a 2023 study by the US-based health agency, the Chartered Institute of Ergonomics and Human Factors, showed that ergonomic interventions reduce lost workdays by 88% and reduce staff turnover by 87%. This reveals the staggering effect positive ergonomic practices have in the workplace. This course is designed to educate managers and leaders about how they can revamp ergonomics in the workplace, optimise comfort and reduce injury risk for all employees.
Over a series of short video lectures, we will uncover how ergonomics can transform your work environment, improving comfort, boosting productivity and reducing the risk of injury. You will explore the core principles of ergonomics and discover how they apply across a wide range of work settings, whether you're at a desk, on the shop floor or working remotely. We’ll guide you through the process of assessing and designing ergonomic workstations, helping you identify common risk factors and make practical adjustments to reduce strain and fatigue. You'll learn how to implement healthy posture and movement habits that can prevent musculoskeletal disorders and support long-term wellbeing.
Together, we'll look at how to make use of ergonomic tools, equipment and technology to improve your day-to-day working experience. As you progress, you'll practise strategies to prevent injuries, enhance workplace safety and contribute to a culture of health and care. Finally, we'll explore how to build an effective ergonomic programme at an organisational level, giving you the knowledge to influence broader change and promote wellbeing across your entire team or company.
By the end of the course, you’ll be equipped to support the development of an ergonomic programme across your organisation. Enrol now to learn more!
target_audience: Human resources professionals ensuring workplace ergonomics is integrated into employee wellbeing programs.
Occupational health and safety specialists designing and enforcing ergonomic safety protocols to prevent workplace injuries.
Office managers and facility managers optimising workspaces and office equipment to improve comfort and productivity.
Managers and supervisors identifying ergonomic hazards in team workflows and promote practices to enhance safety and performance.
Employees learning self-management techniques to improve posture, prevent discomfort and reduce injury risk in daily tasks.
Wellness coordinators or employee wellness program managers developing and implementing ergonomic initiatives.

Treatment of a casualty with a seizure

requirements: This course is suitable for anyone who would like an increased knowledge in first aid.

courses.description:
Welcome to Paediatric first aid training.


This course is designed to give you the theoretical knowledge of First Aid skills to support during first aid emergencies when a child or infant become ill or injured.


This course is also an excellent First Aid Training package for parents and child carers to gain invaluable knowledge at their own time and pace. It also serves as a superb resource for those with English as a Second Language to equip them with the vocabulary and language skills and for all to refresh this vital knowledge on a regular basis.


First aid is probably one of the most essential life skills that everyone should have, but not every is like you and protective and are apart to embark on a journey in learning these skills.


The knowledge of first aid can literally be the difference between life and death when an emergency occurs.


The course consists of videos that encourage you to practice the skills you are learning. But would always encourage you to back up the knowledge you are learning on this e learning course by attending a practical course in your local area.


There are numerous handouts you can download and keep for future reference as well as short tests to check your learning after various sections.
We will keep you entertained and engaged throughout and will always be on hand to help answer any questions you have - just email info@emtfirstaid.com or use the Q&A section. The course is fully compatible with all computers and mobile devices.
You will be able to stop and start as often as you like and on completion you will be able to print your Certificate.


Course contents:
First aid kit
The role of the first aider
Managing an emergency and where to obtain help
Communication and casualty care
Treatment of an unconscious casualty
Resuscitation (Child, infant and adult protocols)
Anaphylaxis
Spinal injuries
Choking (Child, infant and adult protocols)
Asthma and diabetic emergencies
Head injuries
Extremes of hot and cold
Shock
Drowning
Seizures
Bleeding
Burns
Sprains, strains and fractures
Poisoning, bites and stings
Foreign objects
Eye injuries
Childhood conditions (e.g. meningitis and croup)
Sickle cell anaemia.


EMT First Aid and Lifeguard Training provides this course for guidance and it is not in any way a substitute for medical advice. EMT First Aid and Lifeguard Training is not responsible or liable for any diagnosis made, or actions taken based on this course.  We strongly recommend that you attend a practical First Aid course to understand what to do in a medical emergency.
Please be aware that the information is correct at the time of filming June 2021 and relates only to UK Resuscitation and First Aid guidelines. If you are outside the UK please refer to your countries guidelines and governing board.
target_audience: This course is an excellent First Aid Training package for parents and child carers to gain invaluable knowledge at their own time and pace.
This course can be used as part of a blended learning Paediatric First Aid Course.
You!

courses.title: NR 23 - Proteção contra incêndio (Básico)
courses.bio: Aprenda começando do zero!
objectives: Aprender sobre as propriedades do fogo
Identificar os métodos de extinção de incêndio para cada situação específica
Conhecer os agentes extintores e suas principais características
Classificar os incêndios com base nas suas características
Conhecer os equipamentos e materiais utilizados no combate a incêndios
requirements: Não é necessário ter conhecimento prévio em combate a incêndio. O curso aborda desde os conceitos básicos que permitem uma ação imediata em princípios de incêndio.
courses.description:
Um curso feito para iniciantes, começando do zero, desde o início. Também é indicado para profissionais da área que precisam de atualização desse conteúdo, para relembrar os métodos e técnicas de prevenção e combate a incêndios. Cada módulo e explicado com calma e exemplos práticos!
A Portaria Federal 3.214/1978, prevê na Norma Regulamentadora 23, subitem 23.1.1, que o empregador deve providenciar para todos os trabalhadores informações sobre utilização dos equipamentos de combate ao incêndio. O conteúdo programático deste curso atende plenamente esse requisito legal.
Nesse curso você vai aprender sobre:


Norma Regulamentadora 23
Teoria do fogo
Métodos de extinção de incêndio
Classes de incêndio
Agentes extintores
Extintores de Incêndio
Prevenção e Combate a Incêndio é o termo utilizado para se referir as medidas de segurança preventiva, utilizadas para evitar atos e condições inseguras, com potencial de gerar incêndio. Assim como, as medidas de enfrentamento e contenção do incêndio a serem adotadas, caso as medidas preventivas não tenham sido suficientes para evitar o inicio do sinistro.
A implantação da prevenção de incêndio se faz por meio das atividades que visam a evitar o surgimento do sinistro, possibilitar sua extinção e reduzir seus efeitos antes da chegada do Corpo de Bombeiros Militar.
Saber prevenir incêndios é tão importante quanto saber apagá-los ou mesmo saber como agir corretamente no momento em que eles se iniciam. A prevenção além de ser mais barata é os meios mais eficiente de se evitar danos ou perdas.
target_audience: Profissionais e estudantes que necessitem de conhecimentos na área de prevenção e combate a incêndios.

courses.title: Recuento Anatómico Premium
courses.bio: Un Enfoque Sistemático Sobre la Anatomía Humana
objectives: todo lo relacionado con el cuerpo humano a profundidad
requirements: tener pc smartphone o tablet
courses.description:
¿Cómo se puede estudiar la anatomía macroscópica?
El término 'anatomía' se deriva de la palabra griega 'temnein' que significa 'cortar'. Por lo tanto, claramente el estudio de la anatomía está vinculado en su raíz a la disección, aunque la disección de cadáveres por parte de los estudiantes ahora está aumentada, o incluso en algunos casos, se reemplaza al ver material plástico y modelos proseccionados (previamente diseccionados), o mediante computadoras tal como lo haremos en este curso.
La anatomía puede estudiarse siguiendo un enfoque regional o sistémico.
Con un enfoque regional, cada región del cuerpo se estudia por separado y todos los aspectos de esa región se estudian al mismo tiempo. Por ejemplo, si se va a estudiar el tórax, se examinan todas sus estructuras. Esto incluye la vasculatura, los nervios, los huesos, los músculos y todas las demás estructuras y órganos ubicados en la región del cuerpo definida como el tórax. Después de estudiar esta región, las otras regiones del cuerpo, es decir: el abdomen, la pelvis, la extremidad inferior, la extremidad superior, la espalda, la cabeza y el cuello; se estudian de manera similar.
En contraste, en el enfoque sistémico, cada sistema del cuerpo es estudiado y seguido en todo el cuerpo. Por ejemplo, un estudio del sistema cardiovascular examina el corazón y todos los vasos sanguíneos del cuerpo. Cuando esto se complete, el sistema nervioso :cerebro, médula espinal y todos los nervios; se puede examinar en detalle. Este enfoque continúa para todo el cuerpo, hasta que se hayan estudiado todos los sistemas; incluidos los sistemas esquelético, muscular, gastrointestinal, respiratorio, linfático y reticuloendotelial.
Cada uno de estos enfoques tiene beneficios y deficiencias. El enfoque regional funciona muy bien, si el curso de anatomía involucra la disección de cadáveres, pero se queda corto cuando se trata de comprender la continuidad de todo un sistema en todo el cuerpo.
Es por esta razón, que en este curso ofreceremos un enfoque sistémico que fomenta la comprensión de un sistema completo de todo el cuerpo humano, de manera muy didáctica, ilustrativa y precisa que sin duda será de tu agrado y te ayudará a adquirir un aprendizaje significativo.  Anímate y comienza ya. Gracias
target_audience: Estudiantes de medicina y enfermeria, medicos, enfermeros, paramedicos, bomberos o cualquier persona avocada al area de la salud

courses.title: 職場の熱中症対策のルールとポイント【2025年法改正対応】
courses.bio: 2025年6月の法改正で義務化された職場の熱中症対策を解説！現場担当者から人事・総務まで、幅広い立場の方に役立つ内容です
objectives: 職場での熱中症発生状況をデータで理解し、リスクの深刻さを把握する

熱中症は一旦発症すると死亡率が高く、毎年職場で多くの死亡災害が起こっています。


特に夏場の屋外作業や高温環境下での業務では、命に関わる重大リスクです。


本講座では、データをもとに職場での熱中症の危険性を具体的に解説するとともに、2025年6月に法改正により義務化された職場の熱中症対策のルールをわかりやすくお伝えします。


現場担当者や職長、人事・総務部門の安全衛生担当者の方々に最適な内容で、職場の安全環境づくりに役立つ実践的な講座です。


2025年の法改正を踏まえ、職場の熱中症リスクをしっかり管理・予防し、安心して働ける環境を実現しましょう。


■ 第１部：データで見る熱中症の危険 ～職場での災害発生状況～
近年の職場の熱中症の発生状況や、業種別の発生状況について解説します。
建設業・製造業の３大災害による死亡者数・死亡率との比較から、熱中症リスクの深刻さを具体的に把握できます。
なぜ、いま熱中症対策が強化され、法改正に至ったのか―その背景をデータをもとに説明します。


■ 第２部：熱中症に関する法改正 ～ルールを知って、現場を守る～
2025年6月に義務化された職場の熱中症対策の具体的な法改正内容を解説。
事業者に求められる措置や責任、管理体制の強化ポイントなどを丁寧に説明します。
職場での熱中症予防のために押さえておくべきルールをわかりやすく伝え、現場での実践につなげます。


■ 第３部：明日からできる熱中症対策 ～自分と仲間を守る“気づく力”～
死亡災害や重大災害を防ぐための予防・早期発見・適切な応急処置について具体的に解説。
熱中症のサインを見逃さず早期に対処するポイントや、発生時の対応フローも実務で役立つ内容を盛り込みます。

courses.description:
HIPAA Compliance Masterclass: Beyond Checklists to Real-World Protection
Most HIPAA courses give you dry regulations and endless legal jargon. This one is different.
In this masterclass, you won’t just memorize rules — you’ll discover how HIPAA really works in practice. We’ll take you inside real-world scenarios where patient privacy is at risk, walk through compliance mistakes that have cost organizations millions, and show you exactly how to protect data, prevent breaches, and build trust with patients.
Think of this as more than a course — it’s a practical survival guide for anyone who touches healthcare data. By the end, you’ll be able to spot risks instantly, apply HIPAA principles with confidence, and become the “go-to” person for compliance in your workplace.
What Makes This Course Rare & Different:
Story-based lessons (not just boring policy text)
Case studies of actual HIPAA breaches and what to learn from them
Hands-on compliance checklists you can use right away
Plain-language breakdowns of Privacy, Security, and Breach Rules
Insider tips from compliance practices used in real hospitals and clinics
What You’ll Learn:
See HIPAA through the lens of real-world impact, not legal complexity
Protect patient trust by mastering privacy and security fundamentals
Recognize and avoid the top HIPAA mistakes that sink organizations
Apply compliance strategies that actually work day-to-day
Gain confidence to talk about HIPAA with staff, patients, or auditors
Who This Course is For:
Healthcare professionals tired of boring compliance lectures
Business associates & IT staff who want clarity, not confusion
Students preparing for a healthcare or compliance career
Anyone who wants to turn HIPAA from “fear of fines” into a tool for trust and safety
target_audience: Healthcare professionals (doctors, nurses, technicians, therapists) who handle patient information.

courses.title: Risk Management: Hazard Identification & Risk Assessment
courses.bio: Risk Management: Hazard Identification & Risk Assessment (HIRA), Hazard Control & Mitigation, Risk Evaluation Techniques
objectives: The place of risk assessment in a health and safety management system and in our daily lives
The need and reason for carrying out risk assessment before doing any task
Identification of hazards in the workplace

requirements: Be able to read and understand English
Have preliminary knowledge of Health & Safety

courses.description:
We are living in a world where we are facing hazards every day and everywhere, the moment you wake up and went to the washroom, start your car drive to work, and work at an office and then come back home, you will bump into thousands of hazards including from slipping and tripping at home or reckless drivers on roads or any of the others depending on the type of work you are involved in. When we look at the industry we can see many dangerous processes going on, there are machines with moving parts, high-temperature procedures, people working at height handling sharp equipment and working in underground tunnels and mines, they are facing many hazards which can cause them near misses, injuries and in extreme cases deaths. Thus there is a need for Hazard Identification & Risk Assessment (HIRA) techniques.
Risk Assessment techniques must be understood in order for careful assessment of risk assessment if you are made responsible for risk assessment in your department you must be able to know what are the primary sources of hazards and how to evaluate those hazard by grading of likelihood and severity.
You don't need to be an expert level health and safety professional in order to carry out this job, however, you must be aware of HIRA which you will study in this course.
Key Takeaways - Students will be going to learn practically the making of a hazard risk assessment sheet from the scratch, the risk assessment sheet prepared in Microsoft Excel is the tool which I have developed for a logistics firm where I have worked as an HSEQ Manager. It is an excel based sheet with formulas you can download it from the downloadable resources tab of this lecture.
target_audience: People who are responsible for hazard identification and risk assessment
Those who want to learn the making of a hazard risk assessment sheet

Engineering students, engineers, professionals, team lead, safety officers, want to increase their knowledge on this subject
Anyone who want to learn about health and safety

courses.title: Effective Accident Investigation and Reporting in EHS
courses.bio: All you need to know to effectively conduct a safety and health accident investigation
objectives: Define and differentiate between accidents, incidents, near misses, dangerous occurrences, injury and non injury accidents.
Understand the need for accident investigation and what occurrences require investigation and/or reporting
Learn how to conduct an accident investigation.
Learn about accident causation models as a tool for accident investigation and for getting to the root cause of accidents
Learn how to collect information in an accident investigation, examine physical evidence, interview witnesses and consider background information
Learn how to carry out analysis, come to a conclusion, make recommendations and generate a report for management
Understand internal and external reporting requirements
requirements: Knowledge of the basics of Occupational Safety and Health will be very useful
courses.description:
Accidents are unplanned and unintentional events that result in harm or loss to personnel, property, production, or nearly anything that has some inherent value. Accidents are rarely simple and almost never result from a single cause. Most accidents involve multiple, interrelated causal factors. Accidents can occur whenever significant deficiencies, oversights, errors, omissions, or unanticipated changes are present. Any one of these conditions can be a precursor for an accident; the only uncertainties are when the accident will occur and how severe its consequences will be.


To conduct a complete accident/incident investigation, the factors contributing to an accident, as well as the means to prevent accidents, must be clearly understood. Management prevents or mitigates accidents by identifying and implementing the appropriate controls and barriers. Accidents occur when one or more barriers in a work system, including procedures, standards, and requirements intended to control the actions of workers, fail to perform as intended. The barriers may not exist, may not be adhered to, or simply may not be comprehensive enough to be effective. Personal performance and environmental factors may also reduce protection.


Understanding how to prevent or control accidents requires an understanding of the sequence of events leading to an accident in order to identify and implement countermeasures that contain risks.


The purpose of this course is to provide those responsible for conducting accident investigations with practical, detailed advice on conducting these investigations. The course provides in-depth guidance, as well as specific tools and techniques that will facilitate the investigation process.


Who should attend?
The course is ideal for anyone involved in accident investigation, including:
• Line Managers and Supervisors
• Site and Project Safety Officers
• Safety Professionals
• Safety Representatives
• Occupational health professionals
• Human resources professionals
target_audience: Line Managers and Supervisors
Safety professionals and practitioners
Site and Project Safety representatives and coordinators
Occupational health professionals
Human resources professionals
Anyone that is saddled with the responsibility of investigating accidents in the workplace.

courses.bio: Learn CPR online – anywhere, anytime! Created by physicians and adheres to the latest ILCOR Standards and Guidelines

Save A Life by NHCPS & The Disque Founda: Introducing Save A Life by NHCPS & the Disque Foundation
CPR, AED & First Aid Manual: CPR, AED & First Aid Provider Handbook
CPR, AED, & Choking for Adults: Knowledge Assessment: CPR, AED & Choking for Adults
CPR, AED, & Choking for Children (Ages 1: Knowledge Assessment: Child CPR, AED & Choking

requirements: No previous training or special materials are required
courses.description:
Knowing how to deliver Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR), AED & First Aid is critical in responding to everyday emergencies. Following the latest guidelines, this course will prepare you to perform CPR and First Aid and use an automated external defibrillator (AED).
This course will cover providing care to simple and complex injuries, responding to common medical problems, performing high-quality CPR, basic airway management, and safety and prevention. Populations covered include infants, children, and adults.
This course explains how to provide first aid to people with different emergencies, including medical problems, traumatic injuries, and environmental injuries. We define ‘first aid’ and outline its basic steps before delving into the contents of a standard first-aid kit. We introduce you to the cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) technique, which combines ‘rescue breathing’ and chest compressions to rescue people in medical distress.
The course then discusses choking since it is the most common incident at home or the workplace. We show you how to perform first aid on choking infants, children, and adults. We then widen our analysis of CPR and demonstrate how to safely apply and use automated external defibrillators (AED) to get hearts beating regularly during cardiac events.
We help you learn life-saving skills at your own pace, so sign up to acquire international accreditation that tells people you know how to save lives in a crisis. This course can help keep you and your loved ones safe at home and also qualifies you to be your office’s safety officer, something every workplace needs.
The course package includes:
- CPR, AED & First Aid Lectures and Video Presentations
- CPR, AED & First Aid Knowledge Assessments and Review Questions
- CPR, AED & First Aid Certification on NHCPS
Note: This course is for CPR, AED & First Aid training.
target_audience: Health Care Professionals

Emergency Responders
Anyone who wants to be prepared to save a life

courses.description:
"Pesticide Handler" is a comprehensive online course designed to help you stay safe while applying pesticides in any work environment. It is tailored for anyone who handles or applies pesticides and provides vital information on safety procedures, hazard awareness, and best practices to minimize risk and ensure compliance with safety standards.
The course defines pesticides and outlines the underlying concept governing how much pesticide should be used in any application. You will learn to identify the hazards of pesticide exposure and what the do's and do n'ts are for any application of pesticides. The course discusses what minimal exposure pesticides (MEPs) are why you must handle them with care.
This course highlights the importance of personal protective equipment (PPE), including a detailed focus on the requirements for respirator use.
You will learn the different ways pesticides can enter the body and critical emergency steps to take in the event of exposure, such as using an eyewash station or calling the Poison Control Center.
This course covers the relationship between pesticide handling and the hazard communication program, including the crucial step of reading safety data sheets and reading labels for all pesticides used. It also details the role of a medical surveillance program in monitoring the health of employees at risk for pesticide exposure.
Several key sections of the course involve mastering decontamination procedures, such as the Duck Dive method for removing contaminated gloves and properly cleaning clothing after pesticide exposure to avoid contaminating your home or family.
This course also touches on closed systems and the triple rinse method for proper cleaning and safety.
We are a successful risk control and safety firm with decades of experience in the industry. Our course is prepared and led by our in-house industry experts utilizing practices applied in the field.
By the end of this course, you’ll be well-equipped with the knowledge and techniques to handle and apply pesticides safely, protect yourself from exposure, and follow the best practices for preventing contamination and ensuring workplace safety. Start your training today.
target_audience: Anyone who applies or works around pesticides or at facilities where pesticides may be used.
Anyone who manages an Integrated Pest Management (IPM) program.
Anyone wishing to be more aware of the dangers of and safety guidelines for the use of pesticides..

courses.title: RCP, DEA y Primeros Auxilios
courses.bio: ¡Aprende RCP en línea, en cualquier lugar y en cualquier momento! Creado por médicos y conforme a los últimos Estándares
requirements: No se requiere entrenamiento previo ni materiales especiales.
courses.description:
Saber cómo realizar la Resucitación Cardiopulmonar (RCP), usar un DEA y dar Primeros Auxilios es crucial para responder a emergencias cotidianas. Siguiendo las últimas directrices, este curso te preparará para realizar RCP y Primeros Auxilios y usar un desfibrilador externo automático (DEA).
Este curso cubre cómo atender lesiones simples y complejas, responder a problemas médicos comunes, realizar RCP de alta calidad, manejo básico de vías respiratorias y seguridad y prevención. Se incluyen poblaciones como bebés, niños y adultos.
Este curso explica cómo brindar primeros auxilios a personas con diferentes emergencias, incluyendo problemas médicos, lesiones traumáticas y lesiones ambientales. Definimos "primeros auxilios" y delineamos sus pasos básicos antes de profundizar en el contenido de un botiquín de primeros auxilios estándar. Te presentamos la técnica de resucitación cardiopulmonar (RCP), que combina "respiración de rescate" y compresiones torácicas para rescatar a personas en apuros médicos.
Luego, el curso aborda el atragantamiento, ya que es el incidente más común en el hogar o el trabajo. Te mostramos cómo realizar primeros auxilios en bebés, niños y adultos que se están atragantando. Luego ampliamos nuestro análisis de la RCP y demostramos cómo aplicar y usar de manera segura los desfibriladores externos automáticos (DEA) para que los corazones latan regularmente durante eventos cardíacos.
Te ayudamos a aprender habilidades para salvar vidas a tu propio ritmo, así que inscríbete para obtener una acreditación internacional que le diga a la gente que sabes cómo salvar vidas en una crisis. Este curso puede ayudar a mantenerte a ti y a tus seres queridos seguros en casa y también te califica para ser el oficial de seguridad de tu oficina, algo que todo lugar de trabajo necesita.
El paquete del curso incluye:
Conferencias y presentaciones en video de RCP, DEA y Primeros Auxilios
Evaluaciones de conocimientos y preguntas de revisión de RCP, DEA y Primeros Auxilios
Certificación en RCP, DEA y Primeros Auxilios de NHCPS
Nota: Este curso es para entrenamiento en RCP, DEA y Primeros Auxilios.
target_audience: Profesionales de la salud.

Cualquier persona que quiera estar preparada para salvar una vida.

requirements: Não há pré-requisitos para fazer o curso
courses.description:
O Curso Preparatório de Condutor Socorrista de Ambulância - SBV (Suporte Básico de Vida) é destinado a quem quer uma nova profissão, tornando-o socorrista e estar preparado para assumir as melhores vagas desta profissão no Brasil.
A profissão de condutor socorrista de ambulância envolve trabalhar em serviços de emergências médicas, organizações de resgate e remoções inter hospitalares para prestar assistência a pessoas em situações de urgência ou emergência.
Os condutores socorristas são responsáveis por operar veículos de emergência, como as ambulâncias, e fornecer transporte rápido e seguro a pacientes que precisam de cuidados médicos imediatos.
O que faz um condutor socorrista?
Um condutor socorrista é um profissional treinado para conduzir veículos de emergência, como ambulâncias, e prestar os primeiros socorros em situações de urgência e emergência médica. Suas principais funções incluem:
Condução de veículos de emergência: Dirigir ambulâncias de forma segura e eficiente, seguindo as leis de trânsito e utilizando dispositivos sonoros e luminosos (sirene e giroflex) para deslocar-se rapidamente até o local da ocorrência e transportar pacientes para unidades de saúde.
Atendimento pré-hospitalar: Prestar os primeiros socorros a vítimas de acidentes, doenças súbitas ou outras situações de emergência. Isso pode incluir técnicas de ressuscitação cardiopulmonar (RCP), controle de hemorragias, imobilização de fraturas, entre outros procedimentos básicos de suporte à vida.
Colaboração com equipes de saúde: Trabalhar em conjunto com médicos, enfermeiros e outros profissionais de saúde para garantir o atendimento adequado ao paciente. Isso pode incluir a assistência na estabilização do paciente, na sua transferência para a ambulância e na comunicação com as unidades de saúde sobre a condição do paciente.
Manutenção e verificação de equipamentos: Verificar regularmente o estado da ambulância e dos equipamentos em uso em emergências.
Segurança e prevenção: Aplicar medidas de segurança para proteger a si mesmo, a equipe de saúde e os pacientes durante o atendimento e o transporte.
O condutor socorrista é um profissional essencial no sistema de saúde, especialmente em serviços de atendimento pré-hospitalar, como o SAMU (Serviço de Atendimento Móvel de Urgência) no Brasil.
Curso criado por quem tem mais de 8 anos de experiência como condutor e instrutor com certificação ECSI em APH/BLS.
target_audience: O Curso Condutor Socorrista - SBV serve tanto para a pessoa que é totalmente leiga e queira se tornar um condutor socorrista, quanto para o condutor que já trabalha na área e pretende aprimorar seus conhecimentos.

courses.description:
The Emergency Work Place First Aid Training Course
First aid is one of the most essential life skills that everyone should have at home and work. Knowing what to do in a first aid emergency can literally be the difference between life and death.
This is an Emergency First Aid course designed to give you the skills to help during a work place emergency. This course covers the full UK HSE Syllabus that follows UK First Aid Guidelines and includes:
Understanding the role and responsibilities of the First Aider
Assessing an emergency situation
First aid for a casualty who is unresponsive and breathing normally
First Aid for a casualty who is unresponsive and not breathing (use of AED)
Treatment for a casualty suffering from a seizure
First Aid for a choking casualty
First Aid treatment for external bleeding, including treatment of shock
First Aid treatment of burns
First Aid to a casualty with bites, stings and minor injuries
The course consists of videos that encourage you to practice the skills you are learning. There are numerous handouts you can download and keep for future reference as well as short tests to check your learning after various sections. We will keep you entertained and engaged throughout and will always be on hand to help answer any questions you have - just email info@emtfirstaid.com or use the Q&A section. The course is fully compatible with all computers and mobile devices. You will be able to stop and start as often as you like and on completion you will be able to print your Certificate.
If you wish to obtain a Emergency First Aid At Work (EFAW) Qualification (in accordance with the UK HSE requirements) you do need to complete at least 4 hrs in a classroom under direct supervision
This course has been updated with the most recent set of Resuscitation Council UK (RCUK) guidelines released in May 2021. They were distilled from the 2021 European Resuscitation Council (ERC) Guidelines and tailored to clinical practice in the UK.
EMT First Aid and Lifeguard Training provides this course for guidance and it is not in any way a substitute for medical advice. EMT First Aid and Lifeguard Training is not responsible or liable for any diagnosis made, or actions taken based on this course.  We strongly recommend that you attend a practical First Aid course to understand what to do in a medical emergency.
Please be aware that the information is correct at the time of filming July 2021 and relates only to UK Resuscitation and First Aid guidelines. If you are outside the UK please refer to your countries guidelines and governing board.
