courses.title: RIDDOR-Compliant Accident & Incident Reporting – Accredited
courses.bio: Incident Investigation | Accident Report Writing | RIDDOR 2013 | Accident Book | Editable Template for Reporting
objectives: Know what accident reporting is and understand the importance of keeping accident records.
Learn which incidents and accidents that must be reported.
Know about RIDDOR 2013 and understand your responsibilities under it.
Learn how to fill out and accident reporting form (A free accident report form is included with the course.
Get Employee Accident Reporting Example Template.
requirements: no formal qualification, skills or experience required to take this course. However, basic computer skills and a basic knowledge of health and safety is recommended to have.
courses.description:
Did you know less than a fifth of all non-fatal workplace injuries are reported under RIDDOR (Reporting of Injuries, Diseases and Dangerous Occurrences Regulations)?
Nobody wants accidents to happen. But sadly accidents at work can happen and it is important for everyone to know what to do in case it does. A good accident reporting can help to increase safety at work. It also helps you to avoid further accidents in the future. If you want to help maintain a safe working environment, then an accident reporting course can offer all the insight you need to make your business a safer place for all.
Reporting accidents is a vital process for any and all workplaces. By recording accidents, you can identify the causes of injury and then take steps to remove or control them. Remember! Reporting accidents is a LEGAL REQUIREMENT; failure to do so can lead to getting sued, fined or prison sentences.
This short yet comprehensive course equips you to fully understand and implement accident reporting skills. You’ll be able to understand what, when and how to report accidents or incidents in the workplace. The course covers all the relevant criteria of RIDDOR 2013 and all other relevant criteria as well.
This course comes with the following Sections:
What is Accident Reporting?: This module looks at the importance of keeping accident records. It should include information about Accident Books and data protection laws. It also explains what RIDDOR 2013 is and its relevance to accident reporting.
What Must be Recorded?: This module should look at what MUST be recorded, and what COULD be put in the Accident Book, depending on what level of reporting an organisation uses.
How to Complete a Report?: This final section is all about completing a report. It explains what information might be needed and suggests things that might be included in the report that you may not have thought about.
target_audience: If you want to make your workspace safe, this course is just for you.

courses.title: Hazards Identification, Risk Assessment & Risk Control
courses.bio: Hazards Identification, Risk Assessment and Risk Control (HIRARC)
requirements: WSQ ESS Workplace Numeracy and Literacy (WPLN) Level 6
Familiar with own organization products/services
courses.description:
·       We live in a World full of risks. Very often accidents happened at work and at play because we are oblivious to the hazards around us and hence underestimated the associated risk of an accident happening;
·       From the conversations between a father who is a veteran working in the industry and his child who is still studying, examples of hazards from our daily life and the workplaces are highlighted so that we can all cultivate a safety mind set and sharpened our skills in identifying hazards, assessing the risk, and taking appropriate risk control measures to prevent accident;
·       Topics covered in this course:
o   Topic 1: Hazard and Risk
o   Topic 2: Three Phases of Hazards
o   Topic 3: Hazards identification
o   Topic 4: Risk Assessment
o   Topic 5: Risk Control
·       This course is designed to replace 25% (4 hours) of the classroom-based 2-day WSQ Develop a Risk Management Implementation Plan course as part of blended learning approach
·       The course can also be taken individually and independently as a single subject in “Hazards Identification, Risk Assessment and Risk Control”
target_audience: Learners of WSQ Develop a Risk Management Implementation Plan (also known as bizSAFE 2 Training Course)
Management / Environmental / Health & Safety personnel, line supervisors, team leaders, Risk Management Team Leaders and Risk Management Champions.
Any one who wants to know about safety and health

courses.title: First Aid and CPR Training
courses.bio: 91 LifeSavers
objectives: Manage Small injuries, illnesses and mishaps for yourself and those around you
Save a Life when you get an Opportunity to do so
Become a productive, Efficient Samaritan who can offer help to society
Giving CPR & using AED machines to stabilize until Medical help arrives
requirements: Anyone above the Age of 18
No other qualification or vocational skill required
courses.description:
91Safeindia has a Vision of empowering citizens to take power in their own hands and do all they can to alleviate pain and save lives while with these skills.
Based on the Protocols set by American Heart Association which is recognised globally, the 91 FATE [First Aid Trauma & Emergency] Management Program was created in 2018.
This program equips non medicos – students, seniors, home makers, basically anyone to use just their hands and save lives! Those who take this course already exhibit a golden heart and we call them 91 LifeSavers!
Once you finish this course, you will be able to handle everyday home and work injuries like sprains and strains, allergies, bites etc moving to grave health events such as heart attacks & strokes. We train you to give CPR and revive a person even when unresponsive and the use of AED equipment if it is available. These are the ultimate forms of emergency management which are also used by medical professionals in ER.
With this course certificate under your belt, you have every chance to get atleast one opportunity in your lifetime to save a life, and even one life saved would make you a SuperHero!
So Are you ready to be a SuperHero with the invisible Cape!!??

courses.description:
Knowing the process of Basic Life Support (BLS) is critical in responding to life-threatening emergencies. The newest BLS course guidelines focus on doing several tasks simultaneously with a group process that promotes efficiency and minimization of errors.
This course will teach participants how to perform life support techniques including chest compressions, basic airway management, rescue breathing, AED use for defibrillation and more.
The course package includes:
- An online BLS study guide
- A BLS instructional presentation
NOTE - This course is for training in basic life support.

Emergency Responders
Anyone who wants to be prepared to save a life

courses.title: Primeros Auxilios
courses.bio: Aprende a salvar una vida, sabes que hacer si tu hij@ se esta atragantando? Si no sabes entonces este curso es para ti.
objectives: Salvar una vida.
Aprenderás en 6 pasos sencillos y sistemáticos, como elevar las probabilidades de salvar una vida, sin tecnicismos y palabras medicas, este curso esta dirigido a todas las personas.
Sabras que hacer en emergencias medicas como Atragantamiento, Infarto, Desmayos, Crisis Convulsivas, Golpes en cabeza, Fracturas, Quemaduras y mas!
Tu hijo cayo a una alberca y no respira, que haras?
Un amigo cae desmayado en una fiesta, que debes hacer?
Tu hijo se esta atragantando, sabes que que hacer?

Chequeo General: Estado de Conciencia y Vías Aereas
Oxigeno, lo mas importante en nuestro cuerpo.
Atragantamiento: Maniobra en Adultos, Niños y Bebes.
Intoxicación con Quimicos: Que hacer en caso de una intoxicación?
Hemorragias: Tecnicas para la Contension de Hemorragias
Fracturas: Que hacer en caso de una fractura.

requirements: No importa si nunca has tenido un curso de primeros auxilios.
No importa si no sabes tomar el pulso.
Sabes que significa RCP? NO IMPORTA! Aquí aprenderás todo de una forma fácil y divertida.
courses.description:
Tal vez nunca te ha pasado, pero que harías el día que algún familiar o amigo este en peligro de muerte?
SALVA SU VIDA!!
Es un curso sumamente sencillo, en donde adaptamos los primeros auxilios a todo publico, no necesitas tener experiencia previa, y puede ser aprendido desde los 11 años hasta los 85 años de edad.
Sin tecnicismos, y con un lenguaje sumamente sencillo, aprenderás a SALVAR UNA VIDA.
No esperes mas, no sabes si el día de mañana tendrás la necesidad de utilizar estas maniobras.
Impartida por José Alfonso Muñoz Carrasco, con experiencia de 16 años en el servicio y quien a sus 23 años de edad logro ser Jefe de Bomberos y Protección Civil de su ciudad teniendo a su cago mas de 50 bomberos. Este curso es único, y podrás aprender fácilmente a SALVAR UNA VIDA.
Tendras la oportunidad de contactarme y hacer cualquier pregunta sobre el tema a cualquier hora del dia.
Ademas te dare tips y sugerencias para prevenir accidentes en el Hogar.
target_audience: Si tienes 10 años, o tienes 80 años, este curso esta dirigido para ti, con practicas y explicaciones sencillas, cualquiera puede aprender a salvar una vida.

courses.title: Fun food safety and sanitation course
courses.bio: The food safety course will help prepare you for safely working in a kitchen and food handler tests like Servesafe.
objectives: Identify and reduce the causes of food-borne illnesses
Learn to handle food in a safe manner
Understand the HAACP System flow of food
Take actions to create and maintain a safe and sanitary working environment

Direct Contamination: Preventing Bacterial Intoxications and Infections Part 2

requirements: Check state and local regulatory information and your organization’s policies to determine your training and certification needs.
A paper and pen is needed for note taking.
courses.description:
Welcome to food safety and sanitation. In this fun and animated course you will learn about food borne illness, how to prevent it and how to train employees in food sanitation. It is imperative that everyone in your organization from the owner, to the manager to all your employees learn the basic food safety practices for preparing and serving food. Do not assume people understand these rules or how to apply them. It is your job to protect customer health, improve employee performance and preserve your business reputation. Most people like myself learn these essential food safety practices in culinary school but some do not. It is your job to understand, identify and create a culture of food safety.
The concepts covered:
•   The Importance of Food Safety
•   HACCP (Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points)
•   Receiving and Storing Food
•   Time and Temperature Control
•   Preventing Cross-Contamination
•   Safe Food Preparation
•   Methods of Thawing, Cooking, Cooling and Reheating Food
•   Cleaning and Sanitizing
•   Good Personal Hygiene
•   Food Safety Regulations
•   And much, much more . . .
target_audience: This food safety and sanitation course is designed to create a safe environment for your customers, your fellow employees and yourself.
Many city, county or state regulations require you to pass an exam accredited under the Conference for Food Protection (CFP) Food Protection Manager Certification Program Standards.

Aplicar Técnicas Básicas de Intervención Psicológica: Implementar estrategias inmediatas para estabilizar a una persona en crisis y reducir su nivel de angustia
Desarrollar Habilidades de Comunicación Eficaz: Utilizar técnicas de escucha activa y comunicación asertiva para brindar apoyo psicológico.
Planificar el Seguimiento y la Derivación Adecuada: Conocer cuándo y cómo derivar a una persona a servicios profesionales de salud mental para recibir ayuda esp

Quién soy y cómo puedo ayudarte: Quién Soy y Cómo Puedo Ayudarte
Introducción, importancia de los PAP y c: Introducción, Importancia de los PAP y Cronograma
Fase de Preparación: Principios de la Atención de PAP

requirements: Este curso no tiene requisitos previos específicos, lo que lo hace accesible para principiantes. Sin embargo, se recomienda tener: Interés en la Salud Mental: Un deseo de aprender sobre el manejo de crisis emocionales y primeros auxilios psicológicos. Habilidades Básicas de Comunicación: Capacidad para escuchar y comunicarse de manera clara y efectiva. Entorno Tranquilo para el Estudio: Un lugar donde puedan estudiar sin distracciones. Acceso a Internet: Para poder acceder a los materiales del curso y las sesiones en línea.
courses.description:
¿Sabes cómo actuar ante una crisis emocional? ¿Te gustaría adquirir las habilidades necesarias para proporcionar primeros auxilios psicológicos en situaciones de emergencia?
Primeros Auxilios Psicológicos: Herramientas Esenciales para Manejar Crisis Emocionales es un curso diseñado para capacitarte en la identificación, intervención y seguimiento de personas en crisis. Este curso es ideal para profesionales de la salud, educadores, cuidadores y cualquier persona interesada en aprender cómo ofrecer apoyo psicológico inmediato y eficaz.
¿Qué aprenderás en este curso?
Identificar Signos de Estrés y Crisis Emocionales: Reconocer los síntomas de estrés agudo, ansiedad, y otros estados emocionales críticos.
Aplicar Técnicas Básicas de Intervención Psicológica: Implementar estrategias inmediatas para estabilizar a una persona en crisis y reducir su nivel de angustia.
Desarrollar Habilidades de Comunicación Eficaz: Utilizar técnicas de escucha activa y comunicación asertiva para brindar apoyo psicológico.
Planificar el Seguimiento y la Derivación Adecuada: Conocer cuándo y cómo derivar a una persona a servicios profesionales de salud mental para recibir ayuda especializada.
Únete a este curso y adquiere las herramientas esenciales para manejar crisis emocionales de manera eficaz y compasiva. Conviértete en un recurso valioso para tus seres queridos, compañeros de trabajo o cualquier persona que pueda necesitar tu ayuda en momentos de angustia emocional.
target_audience: Personas interesadas en mejorar sus habilidades para ayudar a otros en momentos de angustia emocional.
Profesionales de la salud que deseen ampliar sus conocimientos en la atención de emergencias psicológicas.
Cuidadores y familiares que quieran aprender a proporcionar apoyo psicológico en situaciones de estrés o crisis
Personas interesadas en mejorar sus habilidades para ayudar a otros en momentos de angustia emocional.

courses.title: Urban Survival - How to prepare and make it out alive
courses.bio: Learn the key elements to urban survival. Preparing for emergency. Urban survival hacks. Living in a post-disaster world
objectives: This course will teach the key elements of how to survival urban environments
How to decide to stay or leave your residence during times of a disaster
Various Home Survival Shelters
How to be properly prepared for when disaster strikes
Surviving a Terrorist Attack
Surviving a Government/Economic Collapse
How to make your own 72 hour Bug-out Bag
Surviving in a post-disaster world
And Much More...

Urban Survival - What is it and key pers: Three Key perspective of Urban Survival
Other Urban Survival Topics: Making with a battery and gum wrapper - DEMO

requirements: Have access to a computer or mobile device to view materials
courses.description:
This course is about learning to survive and make it out of a urban survival situation. Many threats faces us today, from natural disasters, terrorist attacks, economic collapse, war, etc. During times like these, society has little to no order, only chaos. The skills taught in this course will help you to survival in a urban survival scenario until help arrives and/or aid you if you need to get out to town to stay alive.


Topics covered in this class:

What is Urban Survival?
Why Prepared for an Emergency?
Three Key perspective of Urban Survival
Survival Items for your Home and Vehicle
How to build a 72 hour bug-out survival bag
Deciding when to stay or leave your residence based on your situation
Survival a Government/Economic Collapse
Surviving a Terrorist Attack
Key resources to scavenge for and utilize
Home Survival Shelters
Situational Awareness in Urban Survival
Urban Survival Like Hacks
And More


Upon completion of this course you will have the know-how and confidence to survive a urban survival situation. Also checkout another course 'Wilderness Survival and Awareness' for more detailed survival info.
Have fun on the course!
Jeremy

courses.title: Trenching, Shoring and Excavations
courses.bio: The ultimate course on excavation safety
objectives: Learn the difference between a trench and excavation
Learn the inspection requirements
Learn the access requirements
Learn how to slope
Learn the relevant OSHA standards related to this topic
Learn how to work safer when doing work related to this topic
Increase your workplace safety and health skill set
Get certified and become more valuable in the workforce
requirements: No experience necessary. Everyone welcome.
courses.description:
Need to learn how to stay safe in an excavation or trench, then this course is for you.  The course covers everything you need to know about trenches and excavations.  Excavation work is one of the most deadly things a person can do.  Each year hundreds of people lose their lives in excavations because the skip the basics.  Don't let that happen to you!
This course is intended to provide safety and health training in compliance with Federal OSHA and State OSHA training requirements such as CalOSHA. If you have questions, you may ask our instructors and they will respond to you with in a short period of time as is outlined by the OSHA standards.
The training will cover all of the required elements outlined in Federal and State OSHA standards to ensure that your training meets or exceed the minimum required training. If your training has a time-requirement, the content of the training has been designed to meet that requirement.
The training is developed by our in-house, real trainers with twenty years of experience, working in the field and with real crews and is trusted by public agencies throughout California.
There are no prerequisites required for this course. The course will walk you through all of the elements required to be successful and complete any questions or quizzes or testing that may be required.
target_audience: Anyone working in or around trenches or excavations

courses.title: Implementation of Occupational Health and Safety in Industry
courses.bio: Occupational Health and Safety
objectives: Understand the importance of occupational health and safety (OHS).
Identify common workplace hazards and risks.
Develop and implement OHS policies and procedures.
Conduct effective risk assessments.
Investigate accidents and incidents.
Implement emergency response plans.
Promote a safety culture within the organization.
requirements: Basic safety practices, emergency procedures, personal protective equipment (PPE), and reporting hazards.
courses.description:
This course provides a comprehensive overview of Occupational Health and Safety (OHS) principles and their critical role in safeguarding workplaces. Participants will gain a solid understanding of the fundamental concepts, legal framework, and the profound impact of OHS on both individuals and organizations.
The course commences with a clear definition of OHS, delineating its scope and objectives. It delves into the intricate legal and regulatory landscape governing occupational health and safety, emphasizing the importance of compliance. Participants will explore the multifaceted benefits of a robust OHS culture, including enhanced employee morale, reduced accidents, and improved organizational reputation.
A key focus of the course is on the human element of OHS. It underscores the significance of safeguarding workers' physical and mental well-being, highlighting the potential consequences of workplace hazards and the devastating impact of occupational injuries and illnesses. Participants will learn how OHS contributes to creating a positive and supportive work environment, fostering employee engagement and productivity.
Furthermore, the course emphasizes the economic implications of OHS. It explores how effective OHS management can lead to cost savings through reduced accidents, workers' compensation claims, and absenteeism. Additionally, it highlights the role of OHS in enhancing organizational performance and competitiveness.
By the end of this course, participants will have a strong foundation in OHS principles and their practical application. They will be equipped to identify potential hazards, assess risks, and contribute to the development and implementation of effective OHS programs. This knowledge will empower them to create safer and healthier workplaces for themselves and their colleagues.
target_audience: Management level
Supervisory level
General workforce

courses.title: Mastering Fire Safety Risk Management
courses.bio: Comprehensive Training on Fire Hazards and Risk Management
objectives: Understand Fire Fundamentals
Classify and Prevent Fire Hazards
Apply Fire Protection and Risk Management Strategies
Operate Firefighting Equipment Safely
requirements: Basic understanding of workplace safety principles is recommended but not mandatory.
No prior experience with fire safety is required; this course is suitable for beginners.
courses.description:
Are you prepared to handle fire-related emergencies and protect lives and property? Our Fire Risk Management Course is your gateway to mastering essential fire safety skills. Designed for individuals and professionals alike, this course equips you with the knowledge and tools to prevent, detect, and respond to fire hazards effectively.
This engaging course takes you through the fundamentals of fire behavior, including the fire triangle, tetrahedron, and stages of fire. You'll learn how fire spreads and explore practical strategies for identifying and mitigating fire risks. With comprehensive modules on fire prevention, fire risk assessment, active and passive fire protection systems, and evacuation planning, you'll be prepared to handle emergencies confidently.
Interactive lessons and real-world examples will guide you through using fire extinguishers, understanding extinguishing methods like cooling and starvation, and safely operating firefighting equipment. Whether you're a safety professional, facility manager, or simply someone passionate about fire safety, this course is tailored to meet your needs.
This course is perfect for busy professionals, remote learners, and anyone looking to upskill at their convenience. Empower yourself with the knowledge of fire safety management to protect lives, property, and workplaces; all while learning at your own pace. Enroll now and take the first step toward becoming a fire safety expert!
Multiple resources are included along with ready to use templates to carry our fire inspections and fore risk assessment. And of course, all this comes with a certificate.
target_audience: Safety officers, managers, and supervisors responsible for fire safety in their organizations.
Facility and property managers seeking to enhance fire risk management skills.
Individuals interested in learning fire prevention, protection, and firefighting techniques.
Employees and teams required to meet workplace fire safety compliance.

courses.title: Toxicology for Industrial Hygienists & Safety Professionals
courses.bio: CIH Preparation and General Health and Safety
objectives: Understand basic principles of toxicology and how they can be applied to the practice of industrial hygiene and occupational health and safety.
Understand the toxicology principles that are required for the Certified Industrial Hygienist (CIH) and the Certified Safety Professional (CSP) exam.
requirements: Basic knowledge of science (chemistry, physics and biology), industrial hygiene and occupational health and safety.
An inquisitive mind
A willingness to learn
courses.description: Prepare for the Certified Industrial Hygiene (CIH) exam or acquire knowledge to protect workers. The average workplace environment contains numerous chemicals that can be inhaled, ingested, or absorbed through the skin by workers. Toxicology is concerned with the adverse effects of these chemical agents as well as physical and biological agents on living organisms. This course will introduce important concepts that would integrate critical toxicology principles with occupational health and safety. Safety Professionals and Industrial Hygienists will learn toxicology principles that would assist in controlling several hazards found in the workplace. This course is ideal for students preparing for the CSP or the CIH exam. The toxicology requirement for these exams was built into this course. If you are not preparing for these exams but want to add toxicology principles to your health and safety knowledge base, this course is also for you. The concepts are broken down into small components that would allow those who are unfamiliar with the topic to follow along easily. Toxicology has often been referred to as one of the most important components of the CIH exam. This course is an excellent summary of toxicology principles found on the CIH exam rubric. The course begins with a review of basic anatomy before proceeding to explore these principles.
target_audience: Occupational health and safety professionals and industrial hygienist who want to take a refresher course or learn toxicology.
Persons who are preparing to take the ABIH's Certified Industrial Hygienist (CIH) exam.
Persons who are preparing to take the BCSP's Certified Safety Professional (CSP) exam

courses.title: Kurs pierwszej pomocy online z certyfikatem
courses.bio: Zdobądź umiejętności ratujące życie: od resuscytacji po złamania – bądź gotów, gdy liczy się każda sekunda!
objectives: Zanim przyjedzie karetka, bezpiecznie ocenisz miejsce wypadku i pewnie wezwiesz 112.
Nauczysz się sprawdzać przytomność i oddech poszkodowanego i wiesz, co zrobić, gdy oddechu brak.
Poznasz zasady skutecznych ucisków i wdechów oraz podłączania AED, by przywrócić pracę serca.
Opanujesz metodę tamowania krwotoków, zakładania opatrunków i stabilizacji złamań.
Nauczysz się jak reagować przy zadławieniu.
Rozpoznasz objawy udaru, zawału, cukrzycy czy silnej alergii i prawidłowych reakcji nim zanim sytuacja się pogorszy.
Dowiesz się jak ułożyć nieprzytomnego w pozycji bocznej i chronić go folią NRC przed wychłodzeniem.
Poznasz metody przełamania blokad do udzielania pierwszej pomocy.
requirements: Brak wcześniejszego doświadczenia medycznego — zaczynamy od zera.
Opcjonalnie: rękawiczki jednorazowe i podstawowa apteczna do samodzielnych ćwiczeń.
courses.description:
„Pierwsza Pomoc – Kurs, który może zmienić wszystko”
Czy wiesz, że w nagłej sytuacji to Ty możesz być pierwszą i najważniejszą szansą na przeżycie? Nasz kurs pierwszej pomocy online został zaprojektowany z myślą o codziennych bohaterach – takich jak Ty. To łącznie około 3,5h godziny angażujących filmów z symulacjami wypadków i wykładów ekspertów.
Dlaczego warto?
Otrzymasz oficjalne zaświadczenie o ukończeniu kursu, które możesz wykorzystać w pracy, w szkole lub jako element budowania swojej profesjonalnej marki.
Zdobędziesz realne kompetencje do ratowania życia – nie tylko w sytuacjach publicznych, ale przede wszystkim, by chronić bliskich w domu, na wakacjach czy na drodze.
Nauczysz się, jak zachować spokój, działać skutecznie i bezpiecznie, nawet pod wpływem stresu.
Kurs w pełni online i dostępny 24/7 – uczysz się, kiedy chcesz i gdzie chcesz.
Materiały opracowane przez ratowników medycznych i psychologów – zgodnie z aktualnymi wytycznymi Europejskiej Rady Resuscytacji.
Przejrzysty podział na moduły, quizy sprawdzające wiedzę, ćwiczenia praktyczne w formie scenariuszy.
‍‍‍ Kurs jest odpowiedni dla dorosłych, a także młodzieży za zgodą dorosłych – jako edukacja rodzinna.


Moduł 1: Bezpieczeństwo i przygotowanie psychiczne
Uczestnik nauczy się:
Oceny bezpieczeństwa miejsca zdarzenia i unikania narażenia siebie oraz innych.
Gotowości psychicznej: jak przełamywać opory psychiczne (strach, wstręt, stres) związane z udzielaniem pomocy.
Rozpoznawania mechanizmów obronnych, które mogą prowadzić do bierności.
Budowania odwagi i poczucia sprawczości poprzez ćwiczenia refleksyjne i scenariusze sytuacyjne.
Znaczenia uważności i empatii w reagowaniu na potrzebujących pomocy.

Moduł 2: Osoba nieprzytomna i resuscytacja
Uczestnik nauczy się:
Rozpoznawać stany nieprzytomności i ich przyczyny (np. uraz głowy, zatrucie, zawał).
Posługiwać się skalą AVPU w ocenie stanu świadomości.
Oceniać prawidłowy oddech (metoda: słyszę, widzę, czuję).
Reagować na oddech agonalny i odróżniać go od wydolnego.
Prawidłowo układać poszkodowanego w pozycji bocznej bezpiecznej.
Stosować folię NRC do zabezpieczenia przed wychłodzeniem.
Rozpoznawać sytuacje wymagające resuscytacji krążeniowo-oddechowej (RKO) i podejmować działania ratunkowe.
Delegować pomocników i koordynować działania na miejscu zdarzenia.

Moduł 3: Urazy i krwotoki
Uczestnik nauczy się:
4 uniwersalnych zasad postępowania przy urazach (nic na siłę, ustal priorytety, elastyczność, rozmowa).
Stosowania wywiadu SAMPLE (symptomy, alergie, leki, choroby, posiłek, zdarzenie).
Rozpoznawania i opatrywania:
ran i krwotoków (ucisk bezpośredni, techniki opatrunkowe),
ciał obcych w ranach (stabilizacja, nieusuwanie),
złamań i zwichnięć,
urazów głowy, szyi i kręgosłupa,
oparzeń i odmrożeń.
Techniki zabezpieczenia osobistego (rękawiczki, unikanie kontaktu z krwią, dezynfekcja).

Moduł 4: Nagłe stany zagrażające życiu
Uczestnik nauczy się:
Rozpoznawania i udzielania pomocy w przypadku:
Hipoglikemii i hiperglikemii – objawy, podawanie cukru, pozycja bezpieczna.
Udarów cieplnych – różnice między udarem a wycieńczeniem, schładzanie, nawodnienie.
Zawałów serca i udarów mózgu – rozpoznanie objawów, reakcje w pierwszych minutach.
Epilepsji – zabezpieczenie przestrzeni, czas trwania napadu, kiedy wzywać pomoc.
Anafilaksji i wstrząsu anafilaktycznego – rozpoznanie objawów, użycie autoiniektora, układanie ciała.
Zatrucia i porażenia prądem – kontakt z pogotowiem, zabezpieczenie miejsca zdarzenia.
Zadławienia – techniki Heimlicha, różnice u dorosłych i dzieci.
target_audience: Dla tych co chcą uczyć się elastycznie online i uzyskać certyfikat PDF.
Dla tych którzy pragną zdobyć kompetencje mogące uratować życie w domu, pracy, na drodze czy podczas uprawiania sportu.
Muszą spełnić wymogi BHP w zakresie tematycznym kursu i zaświadczenie pracodawcy.
Kurs przeznaczony dla osób dorosłych, ale może być obejrzany przez młodzież za zgodą dorosłego

courses.title: SB553 Workplace Violence Prevention Training for California
courses.bio: Understanding The Basics of Workplace Violence And The Impact of CA SB553
objectives: Learn what SB553 is and how the new law changes the requirements for dealing with workplace violence
Learn to identify what behaviors qualify as workplace violence under the standard
Learn to identify who can perpetrate workplace violence, including recognizing prominent risk factors
Learn to combat workplace violence with training, planning, and policy
Understand the importance of reporting workplace violence, how to report incidents, and who to report them to
Learn what the Violent Incident Log is, what the new recordkeeping requirements are under SB553, and how to obtain copies of pertinent records and logs
Learn what a Temporary Restraining Order is and how employers can aid employees in obtaining a TRO
requirements: No experience necessary. Everyone welcome.
courses.description:
In our comprehensive online course, "SB553 Compliance: Workplace Violence Prevention Training," we guide you through the intricacies of California's latest workplace safety law. As of July 1, 2024, employers and employees are mandated to undergo annual training in accordance with SB553, a stricter workplace violence prevention law recently implemented by the State of California.
This course isn't just about meeting legal requirements; it's about ensuring a safe and harmonious work environment. Taught by seasoned experts with two decades of real-world experience in risk management and loss control for public agencies, our training goes beyond the basics.
Key Course Highlights:
Understanding SB553: Delve into the details of the law, from definitions and related terminology to identifying behaviors that qualify as workplace violence.
Identifying Aggressors and Victims: Learn to spot potential aggressors and victims, gaining insights into the impact of workplace violence on the job.
Reporting Incidents: Explore the process of reporting workplace violence incidents, including the necessary details and the appropriate authorities to contact.
Violent Incident Log: Understand the importance of the Violent Incident Log, how to obtain it, and other crucial documents to ensure compliance.
Temporary Restraining Orders (TRO): Gain insights into the process of obtaining a TRO through the employer, addressing circumstances that necessitate such measures.
OSHA Compliance: Our course not only fulfills SB553 requirements but also provides safety and health training in compliance with Federal OSHA and State OSHA standards. Ask our experienced instructors any questions, and receive prompt responses as outlined by OSHA standards.
Trusted Instructors: Developed by our in-house trainers with a proven track record, trusted by public agencies throughout California.
No prerequisites are required. Whether you're an employer or an employee, this course is designed to guide you through every step, ensuring your success in meeting or exceeding the minimum required training. Invest in the safety and well-being of your workplace – enroll today!
target_audience: Anyone working with others, and of particular use for supervisors, safety managers, security personnel, and HR workers
All Employees working in California

objectives: What is Occupational health and safety at work?

requirements: Nil
courses.description:
Course Description

ISO 45001:2018 is the world’s first occupational health and safety (OH&S) international standard. This new standard replaces the old OHSAS 18001:2007.


ISO 45001 helps your organization provide a safe and healthy workplace for your employees and other people, prevent deaths, work-related injury and ill-health as well as continually improve OH&S performance.
This ISO 45001 awareness PPT presentation can be used to brief your employees, new hires and potential auditees so as to create awareness of the OH&S standard. Alternatively, the presentation may be used to supplement your materials for the training of OH&S professionals and internal auditors.


It covers the what and why of ISO 45001, the OH&S clause structure, and also offers practical tips on how to handle an audit session. When you are done teaching this material to your employees, they will be much more informed and comfortable with ISO 45001.
NOTE: This training package includes:
1. ISO 45001:2018 (OH&S) Awareness PPT training presentation (PowerPoint format)
2. ISO Certification Audit poster (PDF format, in color and monochrome, printable in A3 size)

Learning Objectives
1. Provide background knowledge on ISO 45001
2. Gain an overview of ISO 45001 structure
3. Understand the ISO 45001 certification process
4. Gather useful tips on handling the audit session.



Contents

1. Overview of ISO 45001
· What is an OH&S Management System?
· What is ISO 45001?
· Development of ISO 45001
· Why Was ISO 45001 Developed?
· Objectives of ISO 45001
· What's Changed Since the Last Update?
· Key Focus of ISO 45001
· Benefits of OH&S Management System
· Advantages of Certification


2. ISO 45001 Structure
· Annex L - Implications
· Overview of Annex L
· The ISO 45001 Structure is Aligned to the Common Structure for MSS
· HLS: The Same Core Elements
· The Plan-Do-Check-Act (PDCA) Process Model
· ISO 45001 Approach is Based on the PDCA Cycle
· PDCA and ISO 45001 Clause Structure


ISO 45001 Key Clause Structure (4-10)
Context of the Organization
Leadership & Worker Participation
Planning
Support
Operation
Performance Evaluation
Improvement


4. Handling an Audit Session
· Rights of Auditee
· Rights of Auditor
· How to Handle the Audit Session?
· Auditee’s Conduct
· Do’s
· Don’ts
· Protecting Health, Safety and the Environment is Everyone's Job
Appendix
· ISO 45001:2018 Detailed Clause Structure
You may also be interested in the following Management System Standards (sold separately):
1. ISO 9001:2015 (QMS) Awareness Training
2. ISO 13485:2016 (Medical Devices - QMS) Awareness Training
3. ISO 14001:2015 (EMS) Awareness Training
4. ISO 19011:2018 Auditing Management Systems Training
5. ISO/IEC 20000-1:2018 (SMS) Awareness Training
6. ISO 20121:2012 (ESMS) Awareness Training

courses.description:
The concept of first aid to me is a universal practice that should be thought in school and learn by every parent or guardian, the practice  of first aid protect life and can easily prevent death. First aid is the immediate assistance given to any person suffering from either a minor or serious illness or injury, this aid in preserving life and also helping to prevent the worsening of the condition so that recovery can be quick and fast. This is down to ensure that before the professional health officers arrived with ambulance the person is stable to continue receive professional treatment from the clinic or hospital that he/she will be send to. Currently there are psychological first aid which is used in the treatment of  people who have the potential to develop into post traumatic stress disorder. There  are some key pillars that are used by any person practicing first aid or applying first aid to other, the key overall aim of the first aid is to preserve life, this is down to save life and also minimize the treat of death on the patients, and also aid in preventing further harm and ensuring recovering. Let as get something straight, first aid is not medical treatment so its always better to ensure that after the first aid application,  the affected person should be sent to a medical facility.
What l have observe in most first aid that l have personally down to people is that in most critical situations their breathing is not the best so in most cases of first aid its very important to check that the patient is breathing properly and the airways is also not being obstructed and the passage of air is allowed through the open mouth or uncongested nose, down through the pharynx and into the lungs.
Every house in this modern times must ensure that there is proper first aid kits with details tool or content that is fit for purpose in this time, every parent should know something about first aid in other to save the children and the families in case of medical crisis. Reputable organizations must ensure that they train some of their employees to know more about first aid so they can apply it when some body in the company is in crisis. We can all contribute in one way or another to save life if we just learn a little information about first aid.
target_audience: Parents, caregivers, guardians, companies, self employed, managers, consultants, nurses, doctors, health agencies, students, teachers, directors, nursing mothers, pregnant women, fir officers, police, ambulance staff, drivers, everybody etc.

courses.title: (TCRN) Trauma Certified Registered Nurse: 1000+ Practice Q&A
courses.bio: Prepare and 100% pass (TCRN) Trauma Certified Registered Nurse exam with Topics wise 1000+ Practice Questions {NEW]
courses.description:
The (TCRN) Trauma Certified Registered Nurse: 1000+ Practice Q&A course is designed to help you thoroughly prepare for the TCRN certification exam with topic-wise practice questions covering key trauma nursing concepts. This course provides a comprehensive review of critical trauma care areas, ensuring you are well-equipped to handle complex trauma scenarios and pass the exam with confidence.
What This Course Offers:
1000+ practice questions covering essential trauma nursing topics.
Topic-wise breakdown to reinforce key concepts and clinical applications.
Real-world trauma scenarios to enhance critical thinking and decision-making skills.
Explanations to clarify important concepts and guidelines.
Course Topics Covered:
1. Clinical Practice: Trunk Trauma
Thoracic trauma, including pneumothorax, hemothorax, and cardiac tamponade.
Abdominal trauma involving liver, spleen, pancreas, and intestines.
Genitourinary trauma, including renal and bladder injuries.
Trauma considerations for pregnant patients.
2. Clinical Practice: Head and Neck Trauma
Neurologic trauma, including traumatic brain injuries (TBI), concussions, and increased ICP.
Maxillofacial and neck trauma, such as airway obstruction, facial fractures, and ocular injuries.
Spinal cord injuries affecting cervical, thoracic, and lumbar regions.
3. Clinical Practice: Special Considerations
Trauma care for special populations (pediatrics, geriatrics, and obstetric patients).
Psychiatric considerations in trauma nursing.
Shock management, including hypovolemic, cardiogenic, neurogenic, and septic shock.
Fluid resuscitation strategies and blood transfusion protocols.
4. Professional Issues in Trauma Nursing
Trauma team coordination and interdisciplinary communication.
Ethical and legal considerations in trauma patient care.
Documentation standards, quality improvement, and patient safety initiatives.
Disaster preparedness and mass casualty incident (MCI) management.
5. Continuum of Care for Trauma Patients
Prehospital trauma care, including EMS response, triage, and initial stabilization.
Emergency department trauma assessment and interventions.
Critical care and ICU trauma management.
Rehabilitation strategies and long-term trauma patient care.
6. Clinical Practice: Extremity Trauma & Wound Care
Musculoskeletal trauma, including fractures, dislocations, and crush injuries.
Burn and wound care management, including infection prevention and wound healing.
Compartment syndrome recognition and treatment.
Amputation procedures and post-surgical considerations.
This course is an unofficial resource and is not affiliated with or endorsed by BCEN. It is specifically designed to help trauma nurses master exam-relevant concepts and pass the TCRN exam with confidence.
target_audience: Registered Nurses (RNs) preparing for the Trauma Certified Registered Nurse (TCRN) exam.
Nursing Students or Recent Graduates interested in specializing in trauma nursing and advancing their careers.
Nurses Seeking Certification who want to enhance their knowledge and increase their chances of passing the TCRN exam.

courses.description:
O curso de NR 5 - CIPA abordará todos os requisitos de treinamentos dispostos na norma regulamentadora NR-5 (item 5.7.2), promovendo assim os conhecimentos necessários para atuação da comissão e sua organização.
Nosso curso online de CIPA é a maneira perfeita para você aprender tudo o que precisa saber sobre segurança do trabalho. Nosso curso é reconhecido em todo território nacional e é ministrado por instrutores especializados.
Este curso de CIPA vai te ensinar o que você precisa saber para manter seus funcionários seguros.
Você aprenderá sobre os riscos de segurança no trabalho, como identificá-los e evitá-los, e como desenvolver um plano de segurança eficaz. Este curso é perfeito para empresas de todos os tamanhos e é uma ótima maneira de cumprir as leis de segurança do trabalho.
Você pode estudar no seu próprio ritmo e no seu próprio tempo e terá acesso a uma biblioteca de recursos abrangentes, incluindo aulas com animações que ajudam na fixação do aprendizado, fórum disponível na plataforma de ensino e interações com o professor, caso desejar, materiais complementares e testes de conhecimento.
Ao final deste curso o estudante será capaz de entender a atuação da Comissão Interna de Prevenção de Acidentes e de Assédio (CIPA), aspectos para a formação e suas aplicações.

courses.title: Emergency First Aid at Work - Level 2
courses.bio: Learning First Aid Skills is Learning Life-Saving
objectives: Learn how to recognise what normal breathing looks like.
First Aid for poisoning includes immediate removal from the source.
Learn how to locate and check a person's pulse.
Techniques for assessing and treating wounds, including controlling bleeding and applying dressings.
Ability to perform a primary survey to identify and address life-threatening conditions.
requirements: There are no formal prerequisites for enrolling in this First Aid course.
courses.description:
Explore the Emergency First Aid at Work - Level 2
Unexpected emergencies can happen to anyone. But, knowing what to do in the first crucial 10 minutes can make all the difference. Your First Aid skills are invaluable in these moments, as they empower you to potentially save a life, including your own. Your knowledge and preparedness are powerful tools for making a positive impact in critical situations.


Emergency First Aid at Work - Level 2 equips you with the vital knowledge and confidence to respond effectively to an emergency situation. This course goes beyond being a mere resume booster; it is a fundamental life skill that you'll carry with you. Ready to make a real difference when it matters most.


This insightful demo course aims to provide you with a valuable introduction to First Aid skills that could prove invaluable one day. Within this course, you'll find 7 carefully crafted theory videos aimed at providing you with essential knowledge in First Aid. There is a mock exam with 40 questions based on videos to test your knowledge at the end of the course.


The course curriculum covers below topics;
- Introduction – The First Aider
- Primary Survey
- Breathing And Circulation
- Disorders Of The Circulation
- Wounds And Bleeding
- Burns And Scalds
- Bones Joints And Muscle Injuries
- Poisoning
- Bites And Stings
- Effects Of Heat And Cold


In the beginning of the series, there is an introductory session about the savvy- First Aid trainer Maz Maktari. He has experience in training First Aiders for many years. Driven by a fervent desire to empower individuals and make a positive impact on lives, Maz has dedicated the past dozen years to serving as a Freelance Medic Trainer and SIA Trainer. In this role, he imparts his extensive expertise and wisdom to those aspiring to effect changes in the world. Throughout the video series, Maz will give his expertise in First Aid practices to you.


Primary Survey is known as an essential part in First Aid practices. After successfully completing this First Aid course, participants will have the skills to conduct a comprehensive primary survey. This enables them to quickly recognise and attend to any immediate life-threatening conditions, ensuring timely and efficient intervention in critical situations.


In a crisis, understanding first aid basics is crucial. Recognising normal breathing and identifying distress signs are key. Assessing pulse points gives insights into circulatory health. CPR, with chest compressions and rescue breathing, maintains blood flow during cardiac arrest. Empowered with these skills, you can be a lifesaver. Stay composed and informed. For comprehensive training, explore through our video series. Your ability to respond effectively starts with today's knowledge.


You'll gain expertise in assessing burn severity, effectively cooling the burn, and providing vital protection. Additionally, we'll guide you through pain management techniques to ensure comfort and care. With our guided video series, you'll learn how to mitigate the impact of burns, empowering you to respond effectively in critical situations.


Recognising signs of poisoning is vital in first aid, as symptoms vary depending on the type of toxin. Swiftly moving the victim away from the source of poisoning is crucial to prevent further harm. Our video series will acknowledge you to save lives in these kinds of crucial moments. Join Emergency First Aid at Work - Level 2 and be a savvy First Aider today.


This demo course is inspired by the Emergency First Aid at Work- Level 2 Course awarded by CPD. In this demo course, you will cover 6 out of 13 modules discussed in the main course. You can enrol in the full course to gain a broader knowledge of First Aid.


You will receive unlimited access to course materials. You can progress through the course at your own pace. Additionally, you will have a 30-day money-back guarantee.


Now, you can enrol in the Level 2 First Aid full course through the trusted course provider, Global Edulink.
target_audience: You!
Designated First Aiders
Anyone who cares about others
Caregivers
Parents
Organisations seeking emergency First Aid training
School teachers
Security Industry

courses.title: Laboratories Safety Course Level-1
courses.bio: Based on Int. Standards & Guidelines: ISO 15190:2020.; OSHA 29 CFR; ISO45001; ACS & WHO Labs Safety Guidelines.
objectives: Comprehend International Laboratory Safety Standards and Regulatory Frameworks Participants will gain a deep understanding of key laboratory safety standards.
Identify, Classify, and Analyze Laboratory Hazards with Risk-Based Thinking Participants will be equipped to identify various laboratory hazards.
Demonstrate Proficiency in Core Laboratory Safety Practices and Engineering Controls Learners will develop practical competence in implementing control measures
Promote a Proactive Safety Culture through Risk Awareness and Continuous Improvement
requirements: No prior experience is required as this is the basic Level-1 labs' safety course.
courses.description:
Laboratories Safety Course Level-1
as per
ISO 15190:2020: MEDICAL LABORATORY SAFETY REQUIREMENTS
OSHA 29 CFR 1910.1450:2011 OCCUPATIONAL EXPOSURE TO HAZARDOUS CHEMICALS IN LABORATORIES.
GUIDELINES OF AMERICAN CHEMICAL SOCIETY (ACS) & WHO (World Health Organization)
ISO 45001:2018I INTERNATIONAL STANDARD FOR OCCUPATIONAL HEALTH & SAFETY MANAGEMENT SYSTEM.


Every day, laboratories around the world unlock discoveries in science, medicine, and innovation. But behind every breakthrough lies a critical foundation: "safety." Did you know? The International Labour Organization (ILO) reports over 340 million workplace accidents and 160 million work-related illnesses annually — many of them in labs.
Laboratories are seen to have significant hazards but it is assumed that the laboratory staff know about them and how to control the associated risks. It is generally left to the laboratory staff itself to control their own risks. But have the staff really got the expertise and the knowledge to identify the hazards and do they know the best way to control the risks? Or, if they do, has the everyday pressure to get the job done put attention on safety into the background?
Laboratories are always full of hazards like chemicals, biological materials, gas cylinders, equipment, electricity and fire etc. “American Chemical Society’s (ACS), published the report “Identifying and Evaluating Hazards in Research Laboratories” which states that key elements of hazard identification and evaluation include defining the scope of work, recognizing the potential hazards involved in every step of an experiment and evaluate the chances of its occurrence.
This course will provide a background to the importance of laboratory safety and give reasons why it should always be at the forefront of both staff and management’s mind even when highly trained and experienced staff is in control.
The various potential hazards will be identified and the risks associated with them assessed. Guidelines and suggestions on the control of hazards will be provided in this Level-1 Labs Safety Management Course while in the Level-2, we will guide you step by step implementation and documentation of Labs Safety management system. Level-2 will also elaborate you Labs Safety Audit importance and step by stepy guidance to perform labs safety audit.


Course Programme:
Information on the requirements of the following standards for laboratory safety will be provided.
ISO 15190:2020: MEDICAL LABORATORY SAFETY REQUIREMENTS
OSHA 29 CFR 1910.1450:2011 OCCUPATIONAL EXPOSURE TO HAZARDOUS CHEMICALS IN LABORATORIES.
ISO 45001:2018INTERNATIONAL STANDARD FOR OCCUPATIONAL HEALTH & SAFETY MANAGEMENT SYSTEM.
American  Chemical Society (ACS)
WHO(World Health Organization) Labs Safety Guidelines.
In addition to the above “Laboratory Safety Management System” standards, following laboratory safety topics would be covered based on the international good laboratory practices (GLP).


Module-1: What is Health & Safety
Module-2: Hazards in the Labs and its types
Module-3: Chemical Hazards & Lab Safety
Module-4: Microbiological Hazards & Lab Safety
Module-5: Laboratory Hoods & its performance
Module-6: Gas Cylinders Safety in the Labs
Module-7: Electrical Safety in Laboratories
Module-8: Fire Safety in Laboratories
Module-9: Labs Risk Assessment.
FINAL EXAM


TRAINING METHODOLOGY:
This classroom-based course is highly interactive. All courses use accelerated learning where possible. Courses use PowerPoint slides and detailed explanation of each slide. Practical examples are given throughout all courses.
WHO SHOULD ATTEND?
Laboratory Managers, supervisors, Lab chemists, lab analysts, lab technicians and all laboratory staff who wish to ensure that they maintain a safe work place for themselves and for their colleagues.
FREE TRAINING MATERIAL: All training slides and my published book on Amazon,”Lab Safety Management System”
target_audience: Laboratory Managers, supervisors, Lab chemists, lab analysts, lab technicians and all laboratory staff who wish to ensure that they maintain a safe work place for themselves and for their colleagues.

courses.title: OSHA’s Top 10: Mastering Workplace Safety
courses.bio: Enhance Workplace Safety and Stay OSHA Compliant
objectives: Apply hazard identification techniques to your workplace.
Recognize the 10 most common workplace hazards.
Understand OSHA-recommended control measures for each hazard.
Develop a safer, more compliant work environment.
Develop a simple action plan to mitigate risks and enhance safety.
requirements: No prior safety training required.
Suitable for managers, supervisors, and employees in any industry.
courses.description:
This course is designed to equip managers, supervisors, and employees with essential knowledge to identify and mitigate everyday risks in the workplace. Guided by OSHA standards, this course provides a practical approach to workplace safety; recognizing the most frequent hazards that threaten safety and productivity.
The following is a list of the top 10 most frequently cited standards for Fiscal Year 2023 (Oct. 1, 2022, to Sept. 30, 2023); following inspections of worksites by federal OSHA for all industries. OSHA publishes the list to alert employers about these commonly cited standards so they can take steps to find and fix recognized hazards addressed in these and other standards before OSHA shows up. Workers suffer preventable injuries, illnesses, and deaths related to the hazards addressed in these standards.
1. Fall Protection, construction (29 CFR 1926.501)
2. Hazard Communication, general industry (29 CFR 1910.1200)
3. Ladders, construction (29 CFR 1926.1053)
4. Scaffolding, construction (29 CFR 1926.451)
5. Powered Industrial Trucks, general industry (29 CFR 1910.178)
6. Control of Hazardous Energy (lockout/tagout), general industry (29 CFR 1910.147)
7. Respiratory Protection, general industry (29 CFR 1910.134)
8. Fall Protection Training, construction (29 CFR 1926.503)
9. Eye and Face Protection, construction (29 CFR 1926.102)
10. Machinery and Machine Guarding, general industry (29 CFR 1910.212)
By understanding OSHA’s hazard control hierarchy and applying real-world risk assessment techniques, learners will be able to proactively manage workplace safety. The course also emphasizes the importance of fostering a culture of continuous improvement, employee engagement, and regular safety inspections.
target_audience: Small and medium-sized business owners
HR professionals managing health and safety.
Employees responsible for workplace safety.
Safety officers and supervisors.

courses.description:
The Ultimate First Aid Training Course
This is a complete First Aid course designed to give you the knowledge of First Aid skills to support during first aid emergencies when someone is ill or injured. This course will cover First Aid Treatment for Adults, Children and Babies/Infants as well as a bonus section for your pet!


First aid is probably one of the most essential life skills that everyone should have. The knowledge of first aid can literally be the difference between life and death when a medical emergency occurs.
The course consists of videos that encourage you to practice the skills you are learning. There are numerous handouts you can download and keep for future reference as well as short tests to check your learning after various sections. We will keep you entertained and engaged throughout and will always be on hand to help answer any questions you have - just email info@emtfirstaid.com or use the Q&A section. The course is fully compatible with all computers and mobile devices. You will be able to stop and start as often as you like and on completion you will be able to print your Certificate.


Course content includes:
Understanding the role and responsibilities of the First Aider
Assessing an emergency situation
First aid for a casualty who is unresponsive and breathing normally
First Aid for a casualty who is unresponsive and not breathing (use of AED)
Treatment for a casualty suffering from a seizure
First Aid for a choking casualty
First Aid treatment for external bleeding, including treatment of shock
First Aid treatment of burns
First Aid to a casualty with bites, stings and minor injuries such as splinters.
First Aid to a casualty with animals bites, weaver fish, hairy caterpillars, jellyfish, snake bites.
Be able to conduct a secondary survey for a conscious casualty
Be able to treat a casualty who is drowning.
Treatment of injuries to the bones, muscles and joints.
First Aid treatment for suspected head and spinal injuries and soft tissue injuries
Treatment for chest injuries
First Aid treatment for a casualty with an eye injury
First Aid treatment to a casualty who has been poisoned or suffered anaphylaxis
First Aid treatment to a casualty who is suffering from the heat or the cold
Knowledge of how to provide first aid to a casualty who is suspected of a major illness such as Heart Attack, Stroke, Asthma, sickle cell, Diabetes or Epilepsy
Learn how to perform CPR on a pet
target_audience: You !!
This course is suitable for anyone who would like an increased knowledge in first aid.
Anyone who is motivated to help others
People who want to be prepared to save a life
Workplace first aiders who want to refresher their knowledge
Any person in a work place that wants to learn first aid.

What You'll Learn:
This course covers three major domains of the CNL exam:
Nursing Leadership:
Apply ethical principles in clinical decision-making.
Develop horizontal leadership skills for effective collaboration.
Integrate lateral care services to enhance patient outcomes.
Conduct comprehensive patient assessments with confidence.
Advocate for patient rights and influence healthcare policy.
Understand the CNL role's implementation across healthcare settings.
Clinical Outcomes Management:
Manage acute and chronic illnesses efficiently.
Promote health and disease prevention strategies.
Evaluate healthcare policies and their impact on patient care.
Care Environment Management:
Enhance interprofessional communication and collaboration.
Utilize knowledge management and informatics for better care delivery.
Navigate healthcare systems and organizational structures.
Lead teams effectively to ensure quality patient outcomes.
Understand healthcare finance, economics, and resource management.
Implement evidence-based practices to improve patient safety and quality.
Why Take This Course?
-- 3 Real Exam Simulations – Experience the exam environment with timed tests.
--  400+ Exam-Style Questions – Covering scenario-based and conceptual topics.
--  Comprehensive Explanations – Understand not just the correct answers, but also the reasoning behind them.

Prepare smarter and clear your Certified Clinical Nurse Leader (CNL) exam with confidence! Enroll today and take the next step in your nursing leadership journey

Using moral, financial and legal arguments you would be able to justify the health and safety improvements at your workplace

courses.description:
Learn the vital skills needed to respond confidently to common first aid and emergency situations in a home care setting. This course provides step-by-step guidance on managing injuries, medical emergencies, and unexpected crises, empowering you to act quickly and effectively when it matters most. Designed for caregivers, family members, and anyone involved in home care, this course covers key topics such as wound care, burns, falls, diabetic emergencies, cardiac events, and more. Gain practical knowledge, hands-on techniques, and the confidence to provide safe and effective care in any home emergency.


In addition to first aid protocols, this course will teach you to assess the severity of different emergencies, prioritize care, and understand when to escalate the situation to medical professionals. You’ll also learn how to create a safer home environment, recognize potential hazards, and incorporate prevention strategies. With real-life scenarios, you’ll be equipped to handle situations calmly and decisively, ensuring the well-being of those under your care. Mastering these skills will not only improve your response but also boost your confidence in handling high-pressure situations, making you a more capable and reliable caregiver.
Take this life-changing course to gain the knowledge and skills that will empower you to make a real difference in any emergency situation, enhancing both your professional and personal confidence. Enroll today and transform the way you respond to home care emergencies!
target_audience: This course is structured for caregivers, home health aides, and family members interested in improving their emergency response skills.

courses.title: EXPERTO EN PRIMEROS AUXILIOS + OPCIÓN DC-3 STPS
courses.bio: Conviértete en el primer respondiente: Domina el Soporte Vital Básico y actúa con seguridad.
objectives: El protocolo P.A.S. (Proteger, Avisar, Socorrer) para gestionar emergencias y realizó la valoración primaria de la víctima siguiendo el protocolo ABCDE.
Técnicas de Reanimación Cardiopulmonar (RCP) de alta calidad para diferentes grupos de edad y usó el Desfibrilador Externo Automático (DEA) de manera efectiva.
Hemorragias externas graves y dio cuidado inicial para heridas, fracturas, esguinces, luxaciones y quemaduras.
Emergencias médicas súbitas como ataques cardíacos, ACV, crisis convulsivas, anafilaxia, intoxicaciones y mordeduras/picaduras.
requirements: No se requiere ninguna experiencia previa. Este curso está diseñado desde cero para cualquier persona, sin importar su profesión o conocimientos previos, que tenga el deseo de aprender a ayudar y salvar vidas.

Nuestro objetivo es precisamente empoderar a ciudadanos sin formación médica para que puedan actuar como el primer y más crucial eslabón en la "Cadena de Supervivencia". Aprenderás todo lo necesario para reconocer una emergencia, actuar con calma y aplicar las técnicas correctas de manera segura y eficaz. Los primeros auxilios son un acto humanitario accesible para todos, y este curso te proporcionará las herramientas y la confianza para marcar la diferencia.
courses.description:
En una emergencia, cada segundo cuenta. La diferencia entre un desenlace trágico y una vida salvada a menudo reside en la acción de la primera persona en la escena. Este curso integral de "Experto en Primeros Auxilios" está diseñado para darte el conocimiento teórico-práctico y la confianza para ser esa persona, transformándote en un primer respondiente capaz y decidido.
A lo largo de este completo programa, aprenderás los principios fundamentales que rigen tu actuación, desde la ética humanitaria hasta la protección legal que ofrece la "Ley del Buen Samaritano" para que actúes sin temor. Dominarás el protocolo de actuación universal P.A.S. (Proteger, Avisar y Socorrer), una guía mental esencial para gestionar cualquier emergencia de forma segura y ordenada, priorizando siempre tu propia seguridad para poder ayudar eficazmente.


El núcleo de tu formación será el Soporte Vital Básico (SVB). Te capacitaremos para:


Realizar una RCP de Alta Calidad en adultos, niños y lactantes, enfocándonos en la frecuencia y profundidad correctas, la reexpansión torácica completa y la minimización de interrupciones, que son claves para la supervivencia.
Utilizar un Desfibrilador Externo Automático (DEA) de manera rápida y correcta, un eslabón crítico en la "Cadena de Supervivencia".
Actuar eficazmente ante una Obstrucción de la Vía Aérea (OVACE), aplicando la Maniobra de Heimlich en víctimas conscientes y el protocolo de RCP en inconscientes.
Además, el curso te preparará para manejar una amplia gama de lesiones y emergencias, incluyendo el control de hemorragias externas graves mediante presión directa y el uso de torniquetes , el manejo del shock hipovolémico , la inmovilización de fracturas y luxaciones , y la atención de quemaduras , ataques cardíacos y accidentes cerebrovasculares (ACV).
Basado en las últimas guías internacionales, este programa te convierte en un recurso vital para tu familia, trabajo y comunidad. Inscríbete y adquiere la competencia para actuar bajo presión y marcar la diferencia.
target_audience: Empleados y responsables de seguridad laboral: Trabajadores de cualquier sector que quieran fomentar un entorno laboral más seguro y estar preparados para ser el primer auxilio ante un accidente en la oficina, fábrica o cualquier lugar de trabajo.

Ciudadanos con responsabilidad cívica: Personas que buscan adquirir las habilidades y la confianza para ayudar a otros en situaciones críticas y contribuir a crear comunidades más seguras y resilientes.
Padres, madres y cuidadores: Aquellos que desean aprender a prevenir accidentes en el hogar y saber cómo actuar para proteger a sus seres queridos, especialmente a los niños.

Cualquier persona que quiera estar preparada: Individuos que entienden la importancia de ser el primer eslabón en la "Cadena de Supervivencia" y quieren tener la capacidad de salvar una vida en los minutos cruciales antes de que llegue la ayuda profesional.

courses.title: COMPLEXITIES OF AN EMERGENCY
courses.bio: How to deal with the issue of stress before, during and after an emergency.
requirements: This is a course designed to prepare lay responders for the different phases of an emergency. It will help the none professional responder (lay responder) to prepare and train T
courses.description:
This course is designed to help the average person (lay responder) successfully navigate an emergency. The course covers not just an injury, but the more complex emotional issues of stress, each responder must face. Stress is explained and categorized so it is placed in context for each phase of an emergency to help lay responders, understand and cope with stress. This course walks you through preparation before, during, and after the emergency in detail.  PTSD and complex PTSD are explained to the layperson and lists of symptoms are outlined to help alert the responders of what to look for after an emergency and understand what happens to the body during stress. The body’s autonomic nervous system controls your heart rate, breathing, and vision changes. What is the  “fight-or-flight response"?
The course covers what physical symptoms of stress to look for:
Aches and pains.
Chest pain or a feeling like your heart is racing.
Exhaustion or trouble sleeping.
Headaches, dizziness or shaking.
High blood pressure.
Muscle tension or jaw clenching.
Stomach or digestive problems.
Trouble having sex.
Weak immune system.
Stress can lead to emotional and mental symptoms like:
Anxiety or irritability.
Depression.
Panic attacks.
Sadness.
How these can manifest into long-term health and economic issues for the individual and the organization
target_audience: Complexities of an Emergency should be considered a mandatory course for all lay responders. The course focuses on helping untrained rsponders develop the training proceedures to be organized and successful in emergencies. This course will help ordinary people understand the components of emergencies, and understand the stress that comes with dealing with emergencies.

courses.title: Reasonable Suspicion Training for Supervisors
courses.bio: FMCSA-compliant training to help supervisors identify, document, and respond to drug and alcohol use.
objectives: Identify signs of drug and alcohol use that may impair a commercial driver’s ability to safely perform job duties.
Understand FMCSA requirements for reasonable suspicion training and testing procedures.
Conduct and document contemporaneous observations to support reasonable suspicion testing decisions.
Respond appropriately to various workplace scenarios involving suspected substance use or impairment.

Introduction: Introduction to Reasonable Suspicion and FMCSA Requirements
The Supervisor’s Role in Reasonable Suspicion
Understanding Drug Use and Its Impact on Drivers
Understanding Alcohol Use and Its Impact on Drivers
Recognizing the Signs: Physical, Behavioral, and Performance Clues 1st Half
Recognizing the Signs: Physical, Behavioral, and Performance Clues 2nd Half
How to Document and Act on Reasonable Suspicion 1st Half
How to Document and Act on Reasonable Suspicion 2nd Half
Scenario Practice and Final Course Review 1st Half
Scenario Practice and Final Course Review 1st Half

requirements: here are no prerequisites for this course. This training is designed for supervisors and managers at any experience level. No prior knowledge of FMCSA regulations is required. All essential information will be clearly explained throughout the course. A willingness to learn and a commitment to maintaining a safe, compliant workplace are all you need.
courses.description:
This Reasonable Suspicion Training for Supervisors course is designed to meet the Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration (FMCSA) requirement outlined in 49 CFR Part 382.603. Supervisors of commercial drivers are mandated to complete two hours of training—one hour focused on the signs and effects of drug use, and one hour on alcohol misuse. This course fulfills that requirement while also giving supervisors the knowledge and confidence needed to take appropriate action when safety is at risk.
Through detailed instruction, this course teaches how to recognize physical, behavioral, speech, and performance indicators of impairment. Supervisors will learn how to make legally sound reasonable suspicion determinations, properly document their observations, and follow company and FMCSA protocols for initiating testing.
The course breaks down complex regulations into easy-to-understand sections, includes real-world examples and scenarios, and provides a step-by-step guide for handling reasonable suspicion situations. Emphasis is placed on practical skills like consistent observation, objective documentation, and clear communication with company leadership or designated employer representatives (DERs).
Whether you’re new to a supervisory role or just need to complete your annual training, this course helps ensure you remain compliant and prepared. A certificate of completion is issued at the end to document your fulfillment of the FMCSA training requirement.
target_audience: Supervisors of commercial motor vehicle (CMV) drivers
Managers overseeing DOT-regulated drivers
Fleet safety coordinators and compliance officers
Dispatchers with supervisory responsibilities
Human resource professionals in transportation companies
Safety and compliance personnel in trucking, bus, or delivery operations
Terminal or site managers with driver oversight
Designated Employer Representatives (DERs)
Anyone required to comply with FMCSA 49 CFR Part 382.603

courses.bio: Prepare and 100% pass PTCB Certified Pharmacy Technician exam with Topics wise 500+ Practice Questions {UNOFFICIAL]
courses.description:
This course is designed to help candidates thoroughly prepare for the PTCB Certified Pharmacy Technician (CPhT) exam through a topic-wise structured approach. With over 500+ practice questions, this course ensures comprehensive coverage of all key areas tested in the PTCE exam.
By breaking down the syllabus into topic-wise practice tests, learners can focus on each domain individually, reinforcing their understanding before attempting a full-length mock exam. The course includes multiple-choice questions, fill-in-the-blanks, and true/false questions, ensuring well-rounded preparation.
This course provides realistic exam-style questions that challenge learners and help them identify knowledge gaps. Each question comes with detailed explanations, allowing for better retention and conceptual clarity.
This is an unofficial practice resource designed to supplement your studies and improve your confidence before taking the official PTCE exam.
Course Features:
500+ Topic-Wise Practice Questions
Detailed Explanations for Every Answer
Fill-in-the-Blanks and True/False Questions to reinforce key concepts
Full-Length Mock Exam to simulate real PTCE conditions
Covers All PTCE Exam Domains with a structured learning approach
Course Content Outline:
1. PTCB CPhT Exam Prep: Part 1 - Medications
117 Questions
Covers drug classifications, therapeutic equivalence, interactions, dosage forms, adverse effects, contraindications, NTI medications, stability, reconstitution, and storage.
2. PTCB CPhT Exam Prep: Part 2 - Federal Requirements
93 Questions
Focuses on handling and disposal of hazardous and non-hazardous substances, DEA regulations, controlled substance prescriptions, restricted drug programs, and FDA recall requirements.
3. PTCB CPhT Exam Prep: Part 3 - Patient Safety and Quality Assurance
70 Questions
Covers high-alert medications, error prevention strategies, pharmacist intervention scenarios, event reporting procedures, and hygiene standards.
4. PTCB CPhT Exam Prep: Part 4 - Order Entry and Processing
83 Questions
Includes prescription order processing, compounding, calculations, conversions, sig codes, abbreviations, expiration dates, and identifying dispensable/non-dispensable medications.
5. Fill in the Blanks and True/False Questions
98 Questions
Reinforces fundamental concepts and terminology in a concise format.
6. Full-Length Mock Exam
90 Questions
Simulates real exam conditions with a mix of all topics covered in the PTCE.
This course is ideal for pharmacy technician candidates looking for a structured and practice-driven approach to PTCE preparation. By mastering each topic separately and testing your knowledge with a realistic mock exam, you will gain the confidence needed to pass the PTCB certification exam successfully.


Disclaimer:
This course is not affiliated with, endorsed by, or sponsored by the Pharmacy Technician Certification Board (PTCB). It is an independent exam preparation resource designed to help candidates prepare for the PTCB Certified Pharmacy Technician (CPhT) exam through topic-wise practice and study. All trademarks, logos, and brand names are the property of their respective owners and are used for identification purposes only.
target_audience: Pharmacy Technician Candidates preparing for the PTCB Certified Pharmacy Technician (CPhT) exam.

Anyone Seeking PTCB Certification who needs structured, topic-wise practice with realistic exam-style questions.

courses.description:
The trucking industry has contributed a lot to the socio-economic development of nations, trucking issues must be taken serious because we are talking about the driver, passengers, pedestrians, goods and logistics. Policy makers must not see the transportation industry as any how industry, but must be really careful in developing policy directions that will build the industry and help the economy to grow. Trucking business has employed a lot of people in any country, as l speak trucking fatalities across the globe is very high, many great citizens are dying through avoidable accidents, when you look at both develop and developing nations trucking accidents are so many and this has serious economic challenges and financial burden for the nations and families.
Safety of the trucking industry has long be forgotten, now is the time for all of us to stand up and let our individual voice be hear so that road accidents or trucking accidents will be taken serious, and the rightful avoidance strategies will be develop for the safety of our roads and humans. Let us all understand that trucking safety goes beyond the driver. while many believe the driver is ultimately responsible for the safe performance of a vehicle, safety goes much deeper than who is behind the wheel. Technologies introduce in the trucking industry helps to reduce accidents, forward collision warning and mitigation systems, on the other hand aim to target accidents caused by driver inattention by alerting drivers if they are tailgating or getting too close to the rear end vehicle. courses.title: First Aid & Basic Life Support (BLS)
courses.bio: Learn CPR, FA, & AED and BLS online! Created by physicians and adheres to the latest ILCOR Standards and Guidelines

Save A Life by NHCPS & The Disque Founda: Introducing Save A Life by NHCPS & the Disque Foundation

Use of an Automated External Defibrillat: Use of an Automated External Defibrillator (AED)
Use of an Automated External Defibrillator (AED)
