people who are in charge of safety to direct workforce and implement safety at work.

courses.title: How to Save a Life - Free Illustrated First Aid course
courses.bio: This course will teach you how to save a life!
requirements: This course is designed for laypeople and does not requires any previous knowledge.
courses.description:
Project Hearts is an international NGO that aims to empower youth Via life-saving skills, We opened our Course to the public in order to promote life-saving skills!
This course is fully animated and is perfect for children and youth!
Learn how to recognize the most common and dangerous medical emergencies, and what to do while you wait for help to arrive.
Save the Life of a Loved One with these Basic First Aid Skills
Learn CPR
Stop your baby from choking
Save a loved one from a heart attack
Recognize a stroke before it’s too late
Help accident victims
Stay safe during a fire


When the Sh** Hits the Fan, You Can Keep Your Cool if You Know What to Do
In the age of the internet, there are plenty of online first aid courses for you to choose from. These will teach you all the same things, but you won’t get to practice those skills to get them right.
Here, you will learn to reach the same goal – saving a life – in a way that you won’t need to practice in class to get it right.
Calling for an ambulance is always step one, but what then? When every second count, you can make the difference between your loved one making it in (relatively) good shape onto the ambulance, or deteriorating catastrophically before help has even arrived.
If you want to learn what to do when things go wrong, check out this course.

Content and Overview
We designed this first aid course so that you can learn crucial skills like CPR without practicing them in class. You don’t need any prior knowledge to take this course.
We cover the most common life-threatening emergencies, from the generic “there’s someone lying on the ground, is he unconscious?” to “that car hit a woman in the crosswalk, I think she’s still breathing!”
You will learn not only what to do in different types of emergencies, but also how to help different types of people. For example, you can’t do CPR on babies the same way you do on adults, the Heimlich maneuver is different for pregnant women, and not everyone can be saved from a heart attack using aspirin.
We’ve also included some bonus content:
Info on the leading causes of death in the world – heart attacks and strokes – why they happen, how you can recognize them, and what you should do when they happen.
The important guideline you should follow in case of a fire, as well as tips on how you can prevent the fire altogether.
Finally, we’ve boiled everything down to the exact steps you need to remember for each emergency situation, and put them all in the downloadable Study Manual for you to keep and refer back to whenever you want or need to. Now you’re ready to roll.    Please support our cause by spreading this course!


Every penny collected from this course is going back to empowering underprivileged youth in the developing world.
target_audience: Anyone who wants to learn what to do in an emergency.

courses.title: OSHA Compliance – Electrical Safety (29 CFR 1910 S)
courses.bio: Understanding the Electrical Hazards and Safe Work Practices Under 29 CFR 1910 Subpart S
objectives: Understand Basics and Identify common electrical hazards
Differentiate between various types of electrical risks
Explain fundamental methods of protection against electrical hazards
Understand the roles and responsibilities of employers and employees
Respond effectively to electrical emergencies

Types and Causes of Electrical Injuries: Effect of Current on Human Body
Fundamental Methods of Protection: Safe distance from overhead power lines
Inspection of portable tools extension cords
Use of power tools and equipment as designed
Use of enclosures, guarding, and barriers
Safe use of extension cords & temporary wiring
Emergency Response and Incident Handling: What to do in case of electric shock or arc flash
Roles, Responsibilities & Emergency Response in Electrical Safety

requirements: No prior electrical training is required. This course is suitable for beginners and non-electricians.
Basic understanding of workplace safety concepts. (Recommended but not mandatory)
Familiarity with general industry work environments. (Recommended but not mandatory)
Ability to read and understand safety instructions in English.
courses.description:
This training course is designed to provide participants with a foundational understanding of electrical safety within general industry settings. Many workplaces rely on electricity as a daily utility, and while it powers essential operations, it also presents a wide range of hazards. Employees may be directly or indirectly exposed to electrical risks, whether they are working hands-on with electrical systems or simply operating near energized equipment.
This course explores the key concepts of electrical safety, emphasizing the identification and control of hazards such as electrical shock, arc flashes, fire risks, and electrocution. Participants will learn about the different types of electrical hazards and the practical safety measures that can be implemented to minimize risk. Additionally, the course highlights the employer's responsibilities under regulatory frameworks to ensure a safe working environment.
The course is built upon the framework of OSHA 29 CFR electrical safety regulations, promoting best practices for risk prevention and safe equipment usage. It is suitable for all employees in general industry environments, especially those involved in maintenance, operations, and safety oversight. Through interactive discussions, real-world examples, and awareness-building strategies, participants will be better prepared to work safely around electrical systems and help foster a culture of safety within their organizations.
target_audience: General industry workers who may be exposed to electrical hazards in the workplace.
Maintenance and operations personnel responsible for handling or working around electrical systems and equipment.
Supervisors and safety officers looking to enhance their understanding of OSHA’s electrical safety requirements.
New employees or contractors who require orientation or basic awareness of electrical hazards.
Anyone seeking foundational knowledge on electrical safety and OSHA compliance under 29 CFR 1910 Subpart S.

courses.description:
You will learn about an ELD system, ELD device, HOS – Hours of Service, The Split Sleeper, The ELD Dashboard, Unidentified Trips and how to assign them, the ELD Disconnection events, Personal Conveyance duty status, Reports (Location History), The case numbers, how to add vehicles and drivers in the admin panel, The driver’s application, how to export IFTA as pdf - International fuel tax agreement, The policy and HOS requirements, Daily Audit, Dealing with drivers, when the driver is speeding and gets pulled over by a DOT officer, Dealing with dispatchers, The simplicity of the job, what driver needs to have in his log for logs to look good, DOT violations, When a DOT officer pulls over a driver, Re-assigning a driving event to driver's co-driver, Facilitating assignments of a driving event and unidentified trips, The DOT audit.
Since owner-operators are drivers who own their trucks and operate under the trucking company's MC number, working with them is a challenge since they try to bend the rules as much as possible, even if it will harm the trucking company's safety. My job is to maintain a good safety score for a trucking company, and in this course, you will learn how to do it yourself. If you end up working in a trucking company with employees driving the company’s trucks, it will be easier for you to do the safety manager's job than dealing with owner-operators.

courses.description:
Looking to elevate your skills in construction safety?
Proactive Construction Safety: Master Hazard Identification is your ultimate guide to creating safer worksites. Designed for safety professionals, supervisors, and aspiring leaders, this course teaches you how to identify, assess, and manage risks effectively.
The construction industry is filled with potential hazards—from unstable scaffolding to heavy machinery risks. Learn how to mitigate these dangers with practical tools and techniques, including Job Safety Analyses (JSAs), digital hazard tracking, and systematic site inspections. Gain insights into building a safety-first culture that empowers workers and prevents incidents.
This course covers:
The core principles of hazard identification for construction sites.
Strategies to engage workers and foster accountability.
Adapting to changing site conditions caused by weather, task transitions, or operational shifts.
Advanced tools like JSAs and digital applications for real-time risk management.
Led by an IDip NEBOSH-certified expert, this course is the first offering of CertifySafe Academy—a brand dedicated to innovative safety training. By combining global standards with real-world applications, we prepare you to lead with safety in mind.
Take the first proactive step toward creating safer, more productive worksites. Join Proactive Construction Safety today and gain the confidence to master hazard identification and protect your team!
target_audience: This course is designed for individuals across the construction industry who are committed to improving workplace safety and preventing hazards. Whether you’re an experienced professional or just starting your career, this course equips you with practical tools, strategies, and insights to make a difference. Who will benefit most from this course? Construction supervisors and site managers seeking to lead with confidence and implement effective safety protocols. Safety officers and HSE professionals who want to enhance their hazard identification and risk prevention skills. Team leaders and foremen aiming to build a culture of accountability and safety-first practices on their sites. Construction workers and contractors who want to recognize risks, protect themselves, and support a safer work environment. Aspiring professionals or students entering the construction industry and looking to gain foundational knowledge of proactive safety practices. If you’re passionate about creating safer, more efficient worksites and reducing risks through proactive management, this course is for you.

DO THE FOLLOWING

Execute how to Open the Airway
Demonstrate how to give Breaths
Use Automated External Defibrillator (AED)


KNOW THE FOLLOWING:
Describe why the learning of CPR skill is important
Explain how the Normal body functions for survival

Explain the causes of Cardiac arrest: H's and T's
Recognize the Legal implications: Good Samaritan Law
Illustrate that one can not harm or kill the patient while doing Cardio Pulmonary Resuscitation
Explain the options if suspicious of Disease Transmission
Describe what to do if the scene is not safe

FEEL/NOT FEEL THE FOLLOWING:

requirements: Herkes İlk Yardım Yapmayı Öğrenmeli. Eğitim İçin Hiçbir Gereksinim Yoktur.
courses.description:
İlk Yardım gerektiren durumlar her an, heryerde karşımıza çıkabilecek durumlardır. Sokakta yürürken, okulda, işte ve belki de kendi evimizde, bu sebeple ilk yardım, 7'den 70'e her bireyin öğrenmesi gereken bilgiler bütünüdür. İlk yardım gerektiren durumlar, sakatlıktan, ölüme kadar varabilecek olaylar ile sonuçlanabilmektedir. Böyle bir sonuç ile karşı karşıya kalmak için yapılabilecek tek şey, yerinde ve doğru müdehaledir. Bir birey olarak, çevremizdeki insanları ve ailemizi korumak için gerekli yetkinliklere ulaşmalıyız. Bu kurs ile, ilk yardım gereken durumları tanıyabilecek, yerinde ve gerekli müdehaleyi yapabilme yetkinliğine sahip olacaksınız. Unutmayın; '' İlk Yardım Hayat Kurtarır '' ve bu sizin elinizde.


Ülkemizde bilinçsiz ilk yardım uygulamaları ile birçok kişi zarar görmekte ve hayati tehlikeye maruz kalmaktadır. Bu eğitimin amaçlarından bir tanesi de, toplumumuzun bilinçlenmesini ve doğru zamanda doğru ilk yardım uygulamalarını gerçekleştirebilmesini sağlamaktır.
Bu eğitimde, sadece ilk yardımın nasıl yapılacağı değil, aynı zamanda acil durumlar ile nasıl başa çıkılır? ve bir acil durum nasıl yönetilir?, gibi sorulara da cevap bulacaksınız. Bu eğitim herkes için uygun bir eğitimdir. Hiç sağlık bilgisine sahip olmayan veya sağlık çalışanı olup, ilk yardım konusunda kendisini geliştirmek isteyen bireyler için uygun bir eğitimdir. Anlatım dili sade ve anlaşılırdır. Her bireyin anlayabileceği bir seviyede hazırlanmıştır. Eğitim, sağlık bakanlığının ilk yardım yönetmeliğine uygun olarak hazırlanmıştır ve ilk yardım tüm detayları ile anlatılmıştır. Bu eğitim sonunda ilk yardım uygulamalarını tamamen öğrenmiş olacaksınız.
Bu eğitimin sonunda, bir katılım sertifikası alacaksınız. Bu katılım sertifikasının, sağlık bakanlığının vermiş olduğu İlk yardımcı sertifikası ile bir bağlantısı bulunmamaktadır. Aynı zamanda bu eğitim, ilk yardım sertifikası almak için hazırlanan kişiler için bir çalışma kaynağı olcaktır.
target_audience: İlk Yardım Yapmayı Öğrenmek İsteyen Herkes

Módulo 4: Paso 4 – Intoxicaciones y Aler: Lección 1: Intoxicación por productos químicos o medicamentos
Módulo 5: Paso 5 – Prevención de Acciden: Lección 1: Medidas de seguridad en cada habitación

requirements: No se necesitan conocimientos previos en salud.
Tener interés genuino en proteger la vida y seguridad de bebés y niños.
Disposición para practicar con simulaciones mentales o muñecos caseros.
courses.description:
¿Sabes qué hacer si un bebé se atraganta? ¿O si tu hijo sufre una convulsión o una caída grave?
En este curso teórico, el Dr. Valmaceda —médico, educador en salud y creador de contenido— te enseñará paso a paso cómo actuar ante las emergencias más comunes en bebés y niños, desde el nacimiento hasta los 12 años.
Aprenderás desde cómo armar un kit de primeros auxilios en casa, hasta realizar maniobras de RCP pediátrica, identificar señales de alerta, tratar quemaduras, heridas, convulsiones, alergias, intoxicaciones y mucho más. Todo explicado de forma clara, accesible y con un enfoque preventivo y natural.
Este curso es ideal para:
-Padres y madres primerizos
-Cuidadores, niñeras y educadores infantiles
-Personal de guarderías o preescolares
-Cualquier persona que quiera estar preparada para proteger a sus hijos
Al finalizar tendrás:
-Conocimiento práctico para actuar con seguridad en emergencias
-Un checklist de prevención para hacer tu hogar más seguro
-Simulaciones guiadas para que practiques paso a paso
-Acceso a recursos descargables y plantillas útiles
Además, tendrás acceso a la sección de cada clase con comentarios, donde podrás compartir tus dudas y casos reales, y recibir orientación directa del Dr. Valmaceda.
¡Este curso puede literalmente salvar vidas! No esperes a que ocurra una emergencia para aprender lo que podrías haber sabido antes.
target_audience: Padres y madres primerizos que quieren estar preparados.
Cuidadores, niñeras, babysitters y abuelos responsables del cuidado infantil.
Profesores y personal de instituciones educativas o guarderías.
Estudiantes de salud, educación o puericultura.
Cualquier adulto que tenga bebés o niños a cargo.

courses.title: Safety Compliance for UK Management
courses.bio: The ultimate introduction to health and safety in the UK
objectives: Understand the Health and Safety at Work Act 1974 and how to apply its principles in all organizations.
Learn to conduct effective risk assessments and develop emergency response plans to protect employees and prevent workplace hazards.
Gain practical knowledge on enforcing safety policies, identifying hazards, and fostering a proactive safety culture within teams.
Be prepared to handle inspections from local authorities and the Health and Safety Executive (HSE), ensuring compliance and a safer work environment.

courses.description:
Take control of workplace safety with our Safety Compliance for Management: Health and Safety at Work Act 1974 course! Designed for managers, supervisors, and professionals at all levels, this course provides a deep understanding of workplace safety laws and the practical skills needed to ensure compliance and protect employees.
You'll learn how to conduct thorough risk assessments, ensuring that potential hazards are identified and controlled before they cause harm. The course will guide you through developing and implementing emergency response plans, preparing you to act swiftly and effectively in the event of an accident or crisis. You’ll also gain expert insights into handling safety inspections from local authorities and the Health and Safety Executive (HSE), ensuring your workplace remains compliant and avoids penalties.
Beyond compliance, this course equips you with the skills to enforce safety policies, foster a proactive safety culture, and lead workplace health and safety initiatives. You’ll learn how to train employees on safety protocols, monitor workplace conditions, and implement corrective measures to prevent incidents. Additionally, we cover legal responsibilities, employer and employee obligations, and real-world strategies to reduce workplace risks.
With flexible online learning you can complete the course at your own pace and apply your new skills immediately. Enroll today and take the first step towards a safer, more compliant, and well-managed workplace!
target_audience: Managers and supervisors responsible for workplace safety.
